loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, a 58-year-old mother of three grown children, aims to improve her small eatery to increase her income. She wants to offer more kinds of recipes to her customers, but lacks sufficient capital.

Carmelita is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to buy raw ingredients such as fish, vegetables, dressed chicken and pork to cook and sell in her eatery. She knows that through her hard work and initiative, she will be able to make more improvements to her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as fish, vegetables, dressed chicken and pork to cook and sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio  Mario pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Mario tiene 65 años de edad, tiene 03 hijos y es casado, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, dvds entre otros, él socio vende de forma ambulatoria a todos sus clientes que solicitan su mercaderia,el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa como casacas para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Mario belongs to the communal bank SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco and department of Cusco.
Mario is 65 years old. He has three children and is married. He alternates his daily activities with the clothing business and dvd's among others. The member sells as a street vendor to his customers that request his merchandise. The member is doing well working at this business which is thanks to his determination that he puts forth each day at his work. The member wants to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting his family. The member is requesting the loan in order to buy clothes like coats for his business.
The member is grateful for the loan offered and promised to comply with the payments established.

loans.use: to buy clothes like coats for his business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Erlinda requested a PHP 6,000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, spices, etc..

Erlinda has been in this business for three years now. With your help Erlinda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods and spices.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 50 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Estrella works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Estrella is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, eggs, milk and soap.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucena is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Lucena requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to  buy new fish to sell to restart her business activities.

Lucena has been in this business for years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Lucena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase new piglets and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been pig-fattening for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new piglets and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 47-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines for the past two years that sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

Pacita has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aid is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and earns additional income from tailoring. 

Aida requested her twenty fourth loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients and utensils for her restaurant business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elma works hard to support her family. She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell rice business.  

Elma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional materials to be used for her vulcanizing shop business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to be used for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes, incense and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Nori Belen

texts.en:
Nori Belen is 58 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nori Belen is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nori Belen has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice-retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ambulant business vending spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional spices to sell in her ambulant vending spices business.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years. Delia earns additional income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres integran este grupo llamado Mujeres unidas, todas ellas vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Caaguazú, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, que por medio de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
La Sra. Lourdes es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas variadas, y también a la venta de productos variados en forma ambulante, es una persona que se destaca por el sacrificio que hace por poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia, para poder darles todo lo que no pudo tener, y así que no les falta nada. Su familia es su fortaleza y motivo de lucha.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas variadas para la venta, ya que tiene pedidos con los que quiere cumplir y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
Seventeen women compose this group, which is called Mujeres Unidas [United Women]. They are all friends and neighbors in the city of Caaguazú. They are part of the elimination of poverty program that uses a 50-indicator-survey through which each woman will be able to determine her living standard.

Señora Lourdes is part of this group. She sells various kinds of jewelry and other products on foot. She is a person who stands out because of the sacrifices that she makes in order to be able to improve her life and that of her family, and give them everything that she was not able to have, so that they will not lack for anything.  Her family is her strength and her reason to strive.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of various types of jewelry to sell, as she has orders that she wants to fulfill, and this way, she will be able to continue working as she has before. She is grateful to have this opportunity to be able to continue growing, and improving her life.

loans.use: to purchase various kinds of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata est une femme d’une cinquantaine d’année qui vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des parfums et prêts à porter et vend des Lacoste, chemises et pantalons. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des marchandises de prêt à porter et renforcer son fond de roulement. Elle a une expérience de 5 ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée chaque jour de 10h pour la terminer à 19h. Aminata est prise en charge par son mari cause pour laquelle elle n’a pas de charges particulières à part ses propres besoins. Elle voudrait à l’avenir être le fournisseur potentiel du marché et être autonome financièrement.
texts.en:
Aminata is a woman in her fifties who lives with her husband and her children. She markets perfumes and ready-to-wear fashion, and sells Lacoste items, shirts and pants. 

She is seeking this loan in order to buy ready-to-wear merchandise and to increase her working capital. She has 5 years of experience in this business, and starts each work day at 10 a.m., finishing at 7 p.m. 

Aminata is financially supported by her husband, which is why she doesn't have any particular expenses outside of her own needs. In the future, she would like to be a potential supplier for the market and to be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy perfume and ready-to-wear fashion to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 37 years old from Antequera, Bohol. She is married with four children aged three to twelve. For many years now, Loida has made baskets for a living. This is her way of providing for the needs of her children and helping her husband who is a driver. She is asking for a loan to buy straw and buri. These materials are needed for weaving baskets.

Her income helps buy food for her family and pay for school fees. 

Loida aspire to be successful in her business so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy straw and buri.

loans.name: Gemes

texts.en:
Gemes is a 40-year-old man from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. He is married with two children, ages one and a seven-month-old baby. 

Gemes owns a sari-sari store business and he drives a tricycle for an income. His business has been in existence for five years now. His wife also works as a cosmetics dealer for Avon company where she sells cologne, body lotion, and makeup kits. 

Gemes is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to pay for renewal of business permits for his tricycle and his store.

His income helps pay for his children's daily needs. He is determined to work hard, so that he can be successful in his business and pay for his children's school needs someday.

loans.use: to pay for the renewal of business permits for his tricycle and his store.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 49 years old and has six children two of whom are in school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Edna is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Edna has requested PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Edna is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, toothpaste, soap and sugar.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 49 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Consolacion requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Consolacion has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 41 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Emily is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emily has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

Emily is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines. 

Lucilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell for her buy and sell used clothes business.

Lucilyn has been in this business for 10 years. Lucilyn earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lucilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 39 years old and married with one child who is in school. Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo,  groceries, etc.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Eliah

texts.en:
Ma. Eliah is 37 years old and married with two children, who both are in school. Ma. Eliah works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Eliah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Eliah has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Eliah would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.en:
Baltazara, a married 56-year-old mother of seven children, three of whom are still in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For five years now she has been operating a bag-making business in the Philippines. 

Baltazara has requested a PHP 9500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her bag-making business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a jewelry business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Grace is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more jewelry to sell.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Al-Ghwidy Group

texts.en:
Al-Ghwidy Group consists of four women from Al-Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER. 

Aisha, a 38-year-old married woman from Al-Hodeidah, is the leader of the group. She is the mother of six children and the breadwinner of the family. Two years ago, she started up her business in selling ice cream to assist her husband in covering household expenses. She had no choice but to work and provide her family with food and clothing. 

She managed to succeed in the first business of her entire life. Al-Hodeidah Governorate is one of the warmest cities in Yemen, and therefore most of the residents buy ice cream daily. Aisha wants to start selling ice cream in new quarters and places in her city, and this is why she applied for a loan from AMB. 

She looks forward to improving her family's living conditions and buying a new fridge.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream for resale.

loans.name: Ashjan Group

texts.en:
The members of the Ashjan Group are four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They know each other through friendship and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 100,000 YER. 

Fawzia is the leader of the group and is 30 years old. She's been selling ladies' perfumes and clothes for two years. She says that she does very well with the business. 

She applied for a loan from AMB. She hopes that she'll do better, and will use the loan to buy fabrics, incense, perfumes, etc. She is happy and hopes to get a lot out of the loan. 

She hopes the business will continue growing like it's done to date. She is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, incense, perfumes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay hired help to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Unurbayar

texts.en: Unurbayar, 35 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at a private company for six years. His wife is an assistant cook and works at a restaurant. Their three children go to high school. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy a low pressure heater for house heating. Installment of the heater will reduce their coal consumption greatly and its effect on the environment is less air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares about the surrounding environment.

loans.use: to buy a low pressure heater.

loans.name: Flor De Estaño Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ESTAÑO” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de papa y chuño, tienda de decoraciones, ferretería, venta de flores, taller de pollerería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar y que ella al casarse decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “FLOR DE ESTAÑO” is beginning its eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer at the German Busch central office. The communal bank consists of eight members, and is led by a governing body whose president is Angélica. The members' businesses are varied, and include: selling clothes, selling meals, selling different types of potatoes, running a decorations shop, running an ironmongery, selling flowers and running a poultry shop.

The loan they are taking out will help small micro entrepreneurs including Angélica. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 4 years, and that she became a member on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the organisation. She currently has a clothes-selling business, and she states that it was a family business and that when she got married she decided to run her own independently. The loan she is now taking out is for increased capital to buy wholesale clothes, which she will buy in the markets of El Alto city so that she can sell them afterwards in her place of business. This form of work allows her to make an income to maintain her family, as she is married with four children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the ability to save money that the organisation offers her.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothes.

loans.name: Munkhzorig

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhzorig, 38 years old, lives with his daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is acting chief executive officer of a small construction company which specializes in building roads and bridges. His daughter is a first year student at the university and his son goes to high school. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to pay his daughter's tuition fee so that she will concentrate on her studies without worrying about her tuition fee. If his daughter graduates from the university successfully, it will be great help for the family. Mr. Munkhzorig is a hardworking individual who is a very caring father of his children.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida has been working on her family's farm for a living. For many years, this has been their main source of income and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying copra. She had to improve her business to gain more income for the family. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more copra to resell. Adelaida wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional copra to sell.

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is a 39-year-old married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be innovative and creative. 

She operates a retail business where she sells groceries, and she also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area for the business. 

She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house. 

Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a widow who operates a general store to make a living. For years in running the business, she earned well to support the needs of her family and was able to sustain it. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud owns and operates a "sari-sari" or retail store which primarily sells daily-use products to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for four years  and earns well from it. 

Salud, having repaid her previous loan, has requested a new one  from GDMPC micro credit to buy more groceries to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns more income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell like tomatoes, garlic, onions, eggplant, etc. 

Ada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell, like tomatoes, garlic, onions, eggplant, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: Genara works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bag-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business. Genara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Malak Group

texts.en:
This group is called Malak, and it consists of four members. They are all female and live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The members of this group work in different businesses in order to improve their living conditions. They have taken out a loan of 110,000 YER. 

Shafiqa is the leader of the group. She is 45 years old, married and has two children. She has been selling different things as a business for four years. She has been selling incense, perfumes and clothes. She puts forth a lot of effort to increase her profit so that she can apply it to her family's needs. 

She has applied for a loan from AMB to buy goods for her business, such as clothes, perfume and incense. She hopes to expand her business to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy goods for her business, such as clothes, perfume and incense.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is 44 years, a married woman with one child who lives in Takeo Province. She has been a retailer since 2002 and her husband has been a motor-taxi driver since 2009. Both of them can make $15 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to buy a new motorbike for her brother to provide services to clients. As her mother passed away, she is the one who takes responsibility for her four brothers. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a house, and support her child getting a diploma.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her brother to provide service to clients.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Benigno vive en compañia de sus hijos en la ciudad de el Alto. Trabaja como aguicultor se dedica a la plantacion de la hoja de coca. Este hombre necesita el crédito para poder comprar semilla fertilizantes y  de esta manera poder tener un mejor ingreso economico.

El sueño de Benigno es mejorar sus ingresos para el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
Benigno lives with his children in the city of El Alto.  He works as a farmer, and he grows coca leaves.

He requested this loan in order to be able to buy seeds and fertilizers.  This way he will be able to have better income.

Benigno’s dream is to improve his income for the good of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia est née vers 1963 à Mopti. Mère de 7 enfants elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Heremakono nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle mène des activités de vente des habits depuis plus de 10 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes d’habits. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son  9 ème prêt maintenant, les  prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter  50 pièces de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes au comptant à une clientèle mixte dans les différents quartier en de Bougouni, ambulant. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Kadia was born around 1963 in Mopti. She is the mother of 7 children, and lives in a traditional family in the Heremakono neighborhood, north of the city of Bougouni (in the third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). 

She has been in the business of selling clothing for more than 10 years. Her experience in the domain earned her a good reputation, helping her get clothing orders. So in order to have the necessary resources to satisfy her customers, she is working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is now on her 9th loan, after having paid back her previous loans on time. 

This new loan will enable her to buy 50 lengths of pagne [traditional cloth wrap]. She gets her supplies in Bamako from the wholesalers, and makes her sales for cash to male and female customers while traveling through the different neighborhoods of Bougouni. 

With this loan, she hopes to earn an average monthly income of 50,000 CFA Francs. This income would allow her to pay the interest on her loan and to invest what is left over in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [traditional wraps].

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 52 years old, presently residing in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children, all are married already. She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for eight years with a monthly income of PHP 5,000. 

She has been a member of Paglaum Cooperative for 3 years. The profits from her sari-sari store will be used to purchase a piglet as an additional source of income to slowly improve her living standards.

loans.use: purchase stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is studying Business Administration in a university and wants to improve the family's living situation in the future. Her parents earn from farming but their income cannot afford to send them all to school, for they have a big family of 12 siblings. She was determined to finish her course in order to gain a better job and wants to help her parents when they get old. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay her tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay the school's tuition fees.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben has been growing vegetables in his garden for more than five years. He earns well from this and has successfully repaid his previous loan used for fertilization of the farm. 

He plans to expand his plot to gain more returns for the family. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizer. He dreams of improving the general living of his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luz Marie

texts.en:
Luz Marie is 62 years old and a widowed mother of eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more of a variety of goods to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load). Luz Marie aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more of a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Memot District in Kampong Cham Province, Rin is 52 years old and widowed with three children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava for 15 years. The current business earns her about 18,000KHR per day. 

Rin has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her current business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Rin is going to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow better crops so as to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a natural medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food-vending. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more natural medicines to sell to customers.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more natural medicines to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes works hard to support her family. She has a live-in and has a bag making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her bag making business. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her bag making business.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 42, is a married woman with five children from Kampong Speu Province. For a living, her husband works as a construction labor and her four children and her son-in-law work as factory laborers. All of them can earn $26.64 per day. Now she would like to apply for loan of $1500 to buy land. She is going to build a house on this land.

loans.use: to buy land in order to build a house

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Song is 36 years old and is a married woman with two children. She lives at Takeo Province. She has been a farmer since 2000, and her husband is a construction laborer. Both of them can earn $9 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for a loan of $250 for buying a pig in order to breed it and to get a profit from selling it. 

She hopes that in the future, she can buy more pigs, cows and chickens to make more profit and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a pig to breed.

loans.name: Jati Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan is the head of the Jati Indah group. They make their daily living as farmers and pig farmers in the village of Baturiti, in the central area of Bali. With her husband, Ni Wayan is trying to develop her pig business by borrowing from MUK.

From the sale of four pigs in this period, Ni Wayan managed to get a profit of 600,000 IDR. The gain is very helpful to the family's finances as they are currently experiencing difficult times due to increasingly expensive necessities of life.

Ni Wayan and the Jati Indah group decided to continue borrowing from MUK as it is especially helpful in developing their pig businesses. Because the price of pigs and pig feed is growing, Ni Wayan then expects an increase in borrowing in the next period.

Two of the members resigned because they were successful in selling their pigs and earning profit which they used as capital and are now continuing their businesses themselves. They were replaced by two new members. Seeing their friends are successful, they are motivated to work harder in terms of raising pigs. 

The current loan will be used to buy superior piglets in order to get maximum results. Ni Wayan will use her loan to purchase three superior piglets. Ni Wayan and her group members hope this effort will succeed and they will be able to support their family and save for their children education. Their final goal is to be able to continue the business with their own capital.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris vive en la ciudad del Cusco al Sur de Perú. Esta ciudad de muy encantadora porque tiene diferentes paisajes y porque es la capital histórica de América. 

Doris es mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de jugos. Desde hace varios años fue invitada a participar del banco comunal “Imasumac II”  y en cada oportunidad obtiene un crédito y en esta ocasión ella requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo plátanos, piñas, naranjas, uvas, fresas, papayas y otras más. 

Doris se siente muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Doris lives in the city of Cusco, in the South of Peru. This is a very charming city because it has different landscapes and because it is the Historic Capital of America. Doris is a hardworking woman who gets her family ahead with the hard effort in her work. She works in the sale of juices. For some years she has been invited to participate in the communal bank "Imasumac II", and each time she has obtained a loan. This time she requests a loan to buy inputs such as banana, pineapples, oranges, grapes, strawberries, papayas and many others. Doris is very grateful for the loan granted and commits to making her established loan payments.

loans.use: to buy products like plantains, pineapples, oranges, grapes, strawberries, papayas y other things

loans.name: Sogue

texts.fr: Monsieur SOGUI est un jeune homme âgé de 23 ans, qui est célibataire et vit avec ses parents. Voyant la cherté de la vie il s’engage à faire la commercialisation des habits de prêt à porter pour femmes. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de ses parents. Il demande ce crédit d’un montant de 200.000F pour renforcer son fond de roulement et satisfaire ses clients. Il a une expérience de 4 ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 18h.Il voudrait à l’avenir renforcer son boutique de marchandises et il compte sur l’aide des crédits de  l’institution
texts.en: Sogui is a 23-year-old man who is single and lives with his parents. After observing the high cost of living, he set out to sell ready-to-wear women's fashion. He manages the daily expenses of his parents. He is requesting this 200,000 F loan in order to increase his working capital and to satisfy his customers. He has 4 years of experience in this business, and his days start at 7 a.m. and finish at 6 p.m. He would like to stock his boutique with more merchandise and is counting on the loan from the institution.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear women's fashion for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia Veronica tiene 33 años es comviviente y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de ladrillos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ladrillo y le va muy bien.La socia solicita le credito para comprar ladrillos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Veronica is 33 years old and lives with her two children.  She sells bricks and works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and has been doing this for several years.  Things are going very well for her and she wants to expand her business.  She is asking for this loan to buy bricks. 

She is very happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bricks.

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay is 30 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. For their means of living, Gay is earning income from their parcel of cocoland. She is earning an approximate amount of PHP10,000 each month in doing this farming activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in paying the medical costs for her son’s medical treatment as he is now suffering some intestinal problem. Gay has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Gay hopes to engage in other type of business.

loans.use: To pay the medical cost for her son’s medical treatment.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is a married man with an only child. He operates a buy and sell business in his village to make a living. For the five years he has been running the business, he has been earning well to provide his family. He buys assorted kinds of farm products and sells them in town. 

With his micro finance loan taken from GDMPC, he will buy more farm products to sell. In the future, Enrique wants to see his children successful.

loans.use: to buy more farm products to sell.

loans.name: Matilde Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Las Vegas, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Matilde, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos de 9, 6 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en una camaronera. 
Doña Matilde es una mujer que le gusta ganar algo y con esto ayudar con los gastos que generan la crianza y educación de sus hijos, ella tienen en su casa un pequeño deposito en el cual distribuye agua en bidones o por galones, cuando su marido está el le ayuda realizando entregas a domicilio y cuando el no está sus clientes llegan hasta su local ya que este es un liquido indispensable para las personas que viven en la localidad y también a los pescadores que salen a alta mar a realizar sus faenas de pesca, ella lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad con la cual se ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar más embases de agua porque se avecina la temporada y le hacen mucha falta para sus clientes. Lleva 2 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The members of Grupo De Crédito Las Vegas meet in the Crucita parish of Portoviejo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches that surround this beautiful place which is very popular with national and foreign tourists. It’s known by the name “Crucita la Bella” (Crucita the beautiful).

Matilde lives here. She is 28 years old and is in a common-law relationship and has 3 children ages 9, 6 and 3; the two eldest are in school. Her husband works on a shrimp farm. Matilde is a woman who likes to earn some money and with this it helps with the expenses, the education and raising of her children. She has a small tank in her house which she distributes water in cans or per gallon. When her husband is present he makes home deliveries and when he isn't his clients go to the site as water is an essential liquid for the people who live in this area as well as for the fishermen who go out to sea and fish. She has been doing this work for 6 years which helps her to get ahead.

This loan is to purchase more water containers because the season is approaching and it’s needed for her clients. She has been a part of this loan group for 2 years and she likes it because the loans help a lot. 

Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy water containers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Elsa works hard to support her family. She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elsa is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more dried fish to sell to customers.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elena Beatriz

texts.es:
Elena es madre soltera de un hijo adolescente; a sus 39 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser dedicada a su familia y apasionada por su labor. Lleva 10 años ejerciendo como confeccionista de su propia línea de prendas, las cuales fabrica y comercializa en los diferentes almacenes  del centro de la ciudad; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, encaje) con el fin de culminar los pedidos que tiene pendientes y entregarlos de manera oportuna.
Elena, con su espíritu emprendedor y con las ganas de salir adelante, está preparada para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y verlo crecer, para mantener una estabilidad económica favorable y, disfrutar en compañía de su familia, una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elena is a single mother with a teenage son. She is 39 years old and is known for being dedicated to her family and passionate about her work. For the past 10 years, Elena has worked as a seamstress and has designed her own line of clothes. She produces and sells her products to different stores in the central part of the city. Working in this manner enables her to generate enough income to cover her household expenses.

The loan she is requesting will help her to buy supplies in bulk, such as fabrics, thread, and lace. This will enable her to complete her outstanding orders and deliver them in a timely fashion. Elena has an enterprising spirit and the drive to succeed. She is prepared to continue strengthening her business so that she can see it grow. This would allow her to maintain favorable financial stability and to enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and lace in bulk.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising livestock businesses. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy an additional sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a 29-year-old, married mother of one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Hazel has a business selling snack foods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more snack foods to sell.

Hazel has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn is 38 years old and a married woman with two children. She lives in Takeo Province. 

She has been a cleaner for four years, and her husband, who is joining her in the picture, has been a security guard for five years. Both of them can earn $10 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 for buying a computer for her children's studies. She hopes that both of her children can get bachelor’s degrees in the future.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children's studies.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
One month before the settlement day, Ni Made, as the head of her group, informed the members of Karanjung Lestari 1 group to prepare their repayments. With 8 members, they made their repayment of 28,000,000 IDR. During the loan period, all the members can keep the pigs well. Nutritious feed and supervision by the vet make the pigs grow healthy and fat. They can be sold with a good price.

Ni Made sold her 4 pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. As planned, she used the profit to renovate her house. She saids thanks to all the Lenders for supporting her business and making her dream of making her house a pleasant place to stay come true.

Karanjung Lestari 1 group is applying for their fourth loan from MUK: Eight members of 8 and a total loan of 28,000,000 IDR (one memeber is new, replacing a member who left the group). The loan will be used to buy piglets, feed for the piglets and to repair cages.

Ni Made is using the loan to buy three superior piglets and feed. The price for superior pig breeds is currently very expensive, ranging from 400,000 - 500,000 IDR. These pigs will be maintained for 5 months for fattening. Ni Made expects that during the loan period the pigs will be able to develop properly without being attacked disease.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets and feed for the piglets.

loans.name: Beatriz Estelita

texts.en:
Beatriz Estelita is a 48-year-old woman from the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. She is married with one adult son. For seven years now, she has been farming rice and raising hogs for an income. Beatriz would like to expand her business and is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed, supplement and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that through her loan she will not have to worry about buying feed on a daily basis as well as the maintenance of her farm.

In the future, she plans to make her business more successful for it to bring a better return on investment.

loans.use: to buy feed, supplement and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a 35-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a farm where he grows tea to sell. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a rural area, and his primary customers are small-scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather, which affects tea growth. 

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy a water tank and buy more stock of tea leaves for resale. The water tank will enable his family to store clean water for domestic use. 

His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and buy more stock of tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatou Seydou

texts.fr:
Madame KADIATOU SEYDOU est née en 1984 à Bougouni. Mère de 2 enfants elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elle mène des activités de vente de pagnes depuis plus de 8 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de pagnes. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son  1er prêt.  Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter   39 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle les revend au comptant à une clientèle mixte au marché  et dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 51 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Kadiatou Seydou was born in 1984 in Bougouni. She is the mother of 2 children and lives in a traditional family in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (in the third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). 

She has been selling pagnes [traditional cloth wraps] for more than 8 years. Her experience in the domain has garnered her a good reputation and helped her get orders for pagnes. So in order to have the necessary resources to satisfy her customers, she is working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. 

This is her 1st loan. It will enable her to buy 39 lengths of wax cloth pagne. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She sells them for cash to male and female customers at the market and in the different neighborhoods of the city of Bougouni. With this loan, she hopes to earn an average monthly income of 51,000 CFA Francs. This income will allow her to pay the interest on her loan and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [traditional wrap].

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, needles, thread, etc. for her tailoring business.

Agustina has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from fish vending and raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, needles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Glory Ann

texts.en:
Maria Glory Ann is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from charcoal retail.  Maria Glory Ann is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Maria Glory Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nana Siata

texts.fr:
Madame NANA SIATA est née vers 1984 à Tombouctou. Mère de 5 enfants elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elle mène des activités de commercialisation des tapis et tasses depuis plus de 8 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de tapis et tasses. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son  2 eme prêt maintenant, le prêt passé a été correctement remboursé.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter, une grande quantité  de tapis et de tasses. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Bougouni et à la maison.  
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 130 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Nana Siata was born around 1984 in Timbuktu. She is the mother of 5 children and lives in a traditional family in the Heremakono neighborhood to the North of the city of Bougouni (in the third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). 

She has been in the business of selling rugs and cups for more than 8 years. Her experience in the domain has earned her a good reputation and helped her get orders for rugs and cups. So in order to have the necessary resources to satisfy her customers, she is working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. 

She is now on her 2nd loan, after having repaid the first one on time. This loan will enable her to buy a large quantity of rugs and cups. She gets her merchandise in Bamako and sells it for cash, retail, and on credit to male and female customers in the different neighborhoods of Bougouni and from her home. 

With this loan, she plans on earning an average monthly income of 130,000 CFA Francs. This income will allow her to pay the interest on her loan and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy rugs and cups.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is a resident of Kampong Cham province. She is married with one daughter who is still in school. 

A steel milling service is the main business of the family. They also have a rice farm to make additional income. 

Leading a group of two, Srey is asking for the loan from VisionFund to purchase steel for her family's local small business. She hopes to expand her steel milling business to make more profit so that she can keep on supporting her child to tertiary study.

loans.use: to purchase steel.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Juntas Podemos está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Las integrantes del comité han formado un grupo muy unido, gracias a la responsabilidad, solidaridad y trabajo en equipo de cada una de ellas.
La Sra. Mirian es la presidenta del grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de joyas d plata, comenta que tiene sus esperanzas puestas a que por medio del programa de comité, sumado a las capacitaciones y por medio del préstamo vayan mejorando sus condiciones de vidas y la de sus familias, ella solicita de este préstamo para la compra de joyas de plata, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group, Juntas Podemos [Together We Can], is in its second cycle with the women’s communal bank program, in which everyone works and helps each other to move forward. They have formed a very united group, thanks to the responsibility, solidarity, and teamwork of each member. 

Señora Mirian, who is the president of the group, sells silver jewelry. She says that she is hopeful that through the communal bank program, their training will be completed, and that by means of the loan they can continue improving their living conditions and those of their families. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of silver jewelry, which will help her to implement her business plan, and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Nia

texts.fr:
Madame NIA est née en 1973 à Bougouni. Mère de 5 enfants elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elle mène des activités de commercialisation des habits depuis plus de 5 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes d’habits. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son  3 eme prêt maintenant, les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  une grande qualité d’habits pour enfants. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle  les revend au comptant à en détail et à crédit une clientèle mixte au quartier Torakabougou et les différents quartiers de la ville de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 52 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Nia was born in 1973 in Bougouni. She is the mother of 5 children and lives in a traditional family in the Torakabougou neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). 

She has been in the business of selling clothing for more than 5 years. Her experience in the domain has earned her a good reputation and has been helping her get clothing orders. So in order to have the necessary resources to satisfy her customers, she has been working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. 

This is her 3rd loan, after having repaid her previous loans on time. The loan will enable her to buy a large quantity of children's clothing. She gets her merchandise in Bamako and sells it for cash, retail, and on credit to male and female customers in the Torakabougou neighborhood and in the different neighborhoods of Bougouni. 

With the loan, she hopes to earn an average monthly income of 52,000 CFA Francs. This income would allow her to pay the interest on her loan and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Mamadou Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur MAMADOU ZOUMANA est né en 1987 à Bougouni. Père de 2 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités de couture depuis plus de 8 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son  3 eme prêt maintenant, les 2 prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  une machine à broderie  à Bamako. L’utilisation de la machine se fait dans son atelier de couture dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 115 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mamadou Zoumana was born in 1987 in Bougouni. He is the father of 2 children and lives in a traditional family in the Heremakono neighborhood north of the city of Bougouni (third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). 

He has been making clothing for more than 8 years. His experience in the domain has earned him a good reputation and helped him get orders. So to obtain the necessary resources to satisfy his customers, he is working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. 

This is his 3rd loan, after having repaid the 2 previous loans on time. This loan will enable him to buy an embroidery machine in Bamako. He will use this machine in his sewing shop in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni. 

With this loan, he hopes to earn an average monthly income of 115,000 CFA Francs. That income will allow him to pay the interest on his loan and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Las Pilitas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal las pilitas está conformada por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron terminar sus estudios básicos por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Francisca  y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, jabón, detergente, huevos, queso, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Las Pilitas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Las Pilitas Communal Association is composed of 8 members, 6 women and 2 men. They are responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children under their responsibility. They are natives of Sauce, a town located in the western zone of the country known for its hard-working and responsible people with the personal drive to get ahead. Unfortunately, the members could not complete their basic studies due to the lack of economic resources. At present, they struggle day to day to offer their children a better future.

An example of their efforts and desire to advance is the coordinator, Francisca, whose economic activity is her general store, a small business that sells groceries in small quantities, including rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, soap, detergent, eggs, cheese, juice, and soft drinks. Francisca dedicates some 12 hours a day to her business, selling groceries. The business is located in her home.

The objective of her loan is to invest working capital in restocking her store, buying and selling grocery products, so that in the near future Francisca can obtain better income.

Las Pilitas is grateful for Kiva investors' help offered to persons of scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, promoting a means of dignified work.

loans.use: invest working capital to supply her business with grocery products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, soap, detergent, eggs, cheese, juice, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sabou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SABOU est constitué de  8 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 8 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de MARIETOU qui est la 4ème femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diverses quantités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Group Sabou is composed of eight women; all married, they are on average 34 years old with eight children. They live in traditional extended families in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They met through neighbors, friends, and business relations. To increase their financial capacity and better do business, they joined micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with which it is their first loan. This group of women trades in condiments, as illustrated by the case of Marietou, the fourth woman standing in the picture, going from left to right. With her loan, she is planning on purchasing various quantities of condiments from wholesalers in Bougouni. She retails at the market and from home, taking cash from or extending credit to her mixed-gender clientele.

She is counting on an average monthly benefit of 21,000 XOF, which will be reinvested in the business and repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Khardiata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de deux femmes fait partie du banc villageois créé depuis le 26 décembre 2011. Elles unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Madame Khady la représentante est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont 2 garçons de 31 et 22 ans et trois filles âgées de 29 /27 /25 ans tous scolarisés.
Elle est à gauche de la photo la main levée. Elle s'active dans le commerce de produits de beauté et de tissus . Son nouveau crédit de 500000 franc CFA lui permettra de se payer des balles de tissus et des caisses de produits de beauté. Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, sanitaires et scolaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
These two women are part of the banc villageois created on December 26, 2011. They are connected through good social and professional ties. Khady, the representative of the group, is a 53-year-old married woman with 5 children: 2 boys aged 31 and 22, and 3 girls aged 29, 27 and 25. All of her children have received an education. She is on the left in the photo with her hand raised. 

Khady is in the business of selling beauty products and fabric. Her new 500,000 CFA Franc loan will allow her to buy bales of fabric and cases of beauty products. The resulting income will allow her to pay for food, healthcare and education for her children and to increase her savings in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy fabric and beauty products for a small shop.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette, a mother of an only child, helps her husband operating their own farm for a living. She is also engaged in retailing groceries in their village to gain more income for the family. After six years of running the business, the couple earns well to provide for the family. She has borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, and has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent place for doing business. She will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy a water storage facility and buy more stock of bread for resale. The water storage facility will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, her life will be different. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility and more stock of bread for resale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 56 years old, married and has nine children. One child is in school. Aida is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aida has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Aida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: madeleine est une femme de 40 ans, célibataire et mère de 3 enfants dont deux vont à l'école. elle possède un point de vente de poissons braisés depuis 6 ans dans un quartier de la ville. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premiers en achetant des cartons de poissons et pour acheter un congélateur afin de conserver ses poissons, de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans l'activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a forty-year-old woman, and the single mother of three children, two of which go to school.

She has owned a braised-fish selling stall in one of the city’s neighborhood for the past six years.  She is requesting a loan to stock up on supplies by purchasing boxes of fish and a freezer in which to safely store the fish, in order to satisfy her growing clientele and increase her sales. 

Generated profits will be reinvested in the business and provide for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and supplies.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en: Haifa was born in 1984. She is married and a mother of five children. Her husband is in the military. Haifa decided to help her husband financially in order to cover her children's needs by running her project of selling accessories in her house. Six months ago, she started her project selling a small amount and now she needs to expand by buying a larger quantity of accessories to raise her sales and income. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more accessories for her business.

loans.name: Vanney

texts.en: Vanney (in this photo with her daughter) is 38 years old and a married woman with eleven children living in Takeo Province. She is a vehicle guider at school, her husband is a policeman and an arc welder and her three children are labourers. All of them can earn 27 USD per day. She would like to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD for buying metal for building roofs for clients. This loan helps her husband's business to get more profits.

loans.use: to buy metal for building roofs for clients.

loans.name: Margara

texts.es: Margara vive en la ciudad de Huancarani al sur de Perú y sus actividades económicas son la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria y la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y chanchos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carne, tubérculos y menestras. Actualmente, Margara en sus horas libres ayuda a su esposo en el taller de carpintería.
texts.en: Margara lives in the city of Huancarani in the south of Peru and her economic activities are selling food as a street vendor and selling small animals such as guinea pigs and pigs. She has had this business for several years already, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. This time she needs the loan to buy supplies such as vegetables, meat, root vegetables, and lentils. Currently, in her free time Margara helps her husband in the carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as vegetables, meat, root vegetables, and lentils

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Dar es Salaam is the thriving economic capital of Tanzania. With a population of roughly 5 million people it is by far the largest city in the country, and it also boasts the largest electrification rate. However this remains around 60%: this means that an estimated 2 million people living in the city have no access to the national grid.

This is a significant obstacle to economic development: shops have to close after sunset or use expensive (and sometimes very unhealthy) alternatives for lighting, such as small generators and kerosene, or battery-powered lanterns. For the hundreds of thousands of children living in Dar es Salaam's slums and poorer areas, it is impossible to study at night or do their homework.

With the help of African Solar Rise, Deo has opened a solar shop in Dar es Salaam, where he offers a sustainable alternative to his community. With his solar systems, they will be able to light their homes and shops at no extra cost for the next 5 years, thus increasing their income as well as their quality of life; their children will no longer have to read surrounded by kerosene smoke; and for some of them, this will be the opportunity to start a new business or expand an existing one by offering phone charging facilities.

Deo's solar shop has been open for a month now and has already registered sales of over 10 systems. A loan from Kiva will help Deo purchase more solar systems at a wholesale price and on credit from African Solar Rise, making his business flourish. It will also give him the opportunity to make his shop better and invest in marketing activities - to reach more and more families in the area and give them access to electricity and light.

loans.use: to buy solar systems for his Solar shop

loans.name: Kheang's Group

texts.en:
A rice farmer from Prey Veng province, Kheang, is a married father to four children. He is the leader of this group. 

Rice farming is the main business of the family. In his spare time, Kheang goes fishing and also works for others for a labor fee to make additional income to support his big family. 

This is Kheang's first loan from VisionFund Cambodia. He will use the borrowed money to buy fertilizer for the rice field and also to build a decent latrine to improve the sanitation practice in the family and, hence, the health of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El socio David sr sigue dedicando al negocio de carpinteria de estructuras metalicas,el socio realiza diferentes trabajos como ventanas,puertas y marcos entre otros trabajos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años trabajando en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del  socio es ampliar el negocio de carpinteria metalica.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas y metales para su trabajo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
David continues to work as a metal structures builder and makes different things like windows, doors, frames, and other things.  He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and has been doing this for several years.  Things are going well and he wants to expand his business.  He is asking for this loan so he can buy tools and metal.

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es:
El socio Bruno se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,chompas y blusas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa.El socio solicita el credito para comprar polos,blusas y chompas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bruno continues with his clothing sales business. He sells pants, sweaters, and blouses. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. He has been in this business for several years already and it is going very well for him. His dream is to expand the business selling clothing.
