He is asking for the loan to buy polo shirts, blouses, and sweaters.

He is happy because of the loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, blouses, and sweaters

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.en:
A very determined and hard worker, for many years Edelmira, a 49-year-old widowed mother, has been growing and harvesting vegetables and other crops to provide for her family. 

In order to enhance her farm, Edelmira has requested a loan from GDMPC to buy additional seedlings and fertilizer. In the future, she wants to secure a better source of income to improve her family's general living situation.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. She runs a general store selling goods in their local community to earn a living and has been ten years in this business. She earns well from this and she was determined enough to expand it.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She planned to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family needs

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be intelligent and kind. He operates a retail business where he sells cables, bulbs, pans, nails and other items. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low sales and his family challenge to be scarcity of rain. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and buy more cables, bulbs, pans etc for resale. The water storage facility will enable his family to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will build a permanent business premise. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and to buy more stock of cables, bulbs, pans etc for resale

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. Aileen is married and has a food vending (barbecue) business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of meat and frozen foods for her business.

Aileen has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future Aileen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of meat and frozen foods for her business

loans.name: Jeanne's Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwachirimwami est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Tenez bon 2», senior entrepreneur, âgée de 69 ans  veuve et mère de 6 enfants, tous mariés. La cliente est une vendeuse de beurres et fromages. Elle est fournisseur de sa marchandise dans les boutiques et alimentations de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêtde l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 52 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 250kg de beurres et 100 fromages. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses 3 petits fils orphelins. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile  post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Our customer Mwachirimwami is a retailer, a member of business group “Tenez bon 2,” a senior entrepreneur, a 69-year-old widow and the mother of six married children.

This customer sells butter and cheese. She supplies her merchandise to shops and restaurants in the city. She started her business with an initial capital received from her husband, when he was still alive. Later, she benefited from a loan by MFI Hekima.

She has been in this business for 52 years. This new loan will be used to purchase 250 kilos of butter and 100 cheeses.

With this, she wishes to build a house as well as feed and send to school her three orphaned grandsons. To conclude, she strongly thanks Hekima to support the autonomization of women entrepreneurs excluded from traditional financial systems, especially during this difficult post-war period in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy 250 kilos of butter.

loans.name: Andrelin

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Andrelin works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Andrelin is borrowing 5,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her native foods. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her native foods.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia continúa en el banco comunal Santa Rosita de Lima.
La socia continua con el negocio de venta de productos de dormitorios como sábanas, fundas de almohadas, edredones, colchas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas entre otros.
La socia Lucia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Lucia continues to be a member in the community bank Santa Rosita of Lima.  She's still running her business selling goods for the bedroom such as sheets, pillowcases, quilts, bedspreads and more. She is responsible and enterprising, and her business is how she gets her family ahead. She has years of experience at this line of work, and she finds it brings her personal as well as economic satisfaction. She hopes to continue working this way so that she can continue to support her family. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy sheets and other things. Lucia is grateful for the loan, and she is committed to meeting the agreed upon payment schedule.

loans.use: buy sheets and other home goods.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han is 56 years old and married with one child. She is a farmer and her husband who is with her in the photo is a timber retailer. Both of them can earn $33 per day. Now she would like to apply for $1000 for buying more timber to sell. This loan helps her husband’s business expansion as well as getting more profit.

loans.use: to buy more timbers to sell

loans.name: Alfredo Isaac

texts.es:
El socio Alfredo Isacc se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion y venta de muebles de madera y metal,el socio ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles.El socio solicita el credito para comprar materiales como madera y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Alfredo Isaac continues to run his business making and selling wood and metal furniture. He has ten years of experience in this business, and it's going very well for him. His dream is to expand his furniture business. He is requesting his loan in order to buy materials like wood and tools.  Alfredo is happy about the loan, and he is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: buy wood and tools for his furniture making business

loans.name: Grety

texts.es:
La socia Grety se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende chompas,pantalones y blusas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas,pantalones y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Grety continues to run her business selling clothing, particularly sweaters, pants, and blouses. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm every day. She has several years of experience in this work, and it's going well for her.  Her dream is to expand her clothing sales business.  This loan will be used to purchase sweaters, pants, and blouses.  Grety is happy about the loan, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: buy sweaters, pants, and blouses for resale.

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Yvones est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «La Gloire de Dieu», senior entrepreneur, âgée de 55 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants, tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse de divers habillements. Elle étale sa marchandise dans le marché central de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de sa famille. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 9 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 ballons de friperie. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants orphelins. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Our customer Yvones is a retailer and a senior entrepreneur member of business group “La Gloire de Dieu.” At 55, she is a widow and a mother of seven children, all students.

This customer sells clothing. She displays her merchandise in the city’s central market. She started her business with an initial capital received from her family. Later, she benefited from a loan by MFI Hekima. She has been in this business for nine years. This new loan will be used to purchase five bundles of used clothing.

With this, she wishes to build a house, feed, and send to school her orphaned children. To conclude, she strongly thanks Hekima for the autonomization of women entrepreneurs excluded from traditional financial systems, especially during this difficult post-war period in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy five bundles of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is studying at a university and wants to improve her living situation in the future. She was determined to finish her course in order to gain a better job and wants to help her parents when they get old. She had joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan to pay her tuition fees. She is thankful to GDMPC for being a part of her journey. In the future, she wants to become successful and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando, who is 19 and lives with his parents, finished school and is seeking employment. 
He is currently unemployed, but he is studying English with the help of his parents. 
He loves video games and wants to start selling them to help pay for his education since his parents cannot help due to lack of money. 
He wants to buy PlayStation games to resell to friends. 
With the help of a friend who has experience and a cheaper price, he can have a profit and generate income.

loans.use: to buy games for PlayStation for resale

loans.name: Judid Carolina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosita de Lima” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia continua administrando una carpintería, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de trabajos como camas, reposteros, mesas, sillas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The group member belongs to the communal bank, “Santa Rosita de Lima” which is part of the Arariwa Association. She continues managing a carpentry shop. She has dedicated herself to this business for years, and it has been satisfying for her, financially as well as personally.  She is a responsible and diligent person, and this is the way that she supports her family. 

She makes different kinds of furniture such as beds, counters, tables, chairs, and other items. She wants to continue working this way to support her family. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of wood. She thanks those, who by this means are part of her dream; and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIOS ES AMOR” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sinforosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de CD’s y librería, venta de dulces, venta de abarrotes, artesano en chompas, venta de papa y chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sinforosa es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al asistir a un centro de reuniones para mujeres, donde enseñaban artesanías y al contar con el crédito de Pro Mujer decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de las fronteras Bolivia - Perú y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo en grupo y el ahorro que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Dios Es Amor" (God Is Love) communal bank will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Regional Office. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board, of which Sinforosa is the President. The members of the communal bank have a variety of businesses. Among them are selling food, selling CDs and books, selling sweets, selling groceries, artisan sweaters, and selling potatoes and chuño (an artisanal freeze-dried potato).

The loan they will take out will benefit small microbusinesswomen, of which Sinforosa is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer nine years ago, joining at the invitation of a promoter of the institution who went to visit her at her home. Currently she has a business knitting sweaters; she makes it known that she learned this business by attending a women's meeting center where they taught handcrafts, and when she had the loan from Pro Mujer she decided to develop an independent business.

The loan which she will now take out is to increase capital (buying wholesale wool) that she will acquire at the fairs on the Bolivia - Peru border, and after production she will sell it at her stand. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the group work and the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco es originario de Camoapa, casado. Tiene 26 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado. Inicio su negocio con capital propio, poco a poco fue creciendo y hoy cuenta con un negocio próspero y surtido. Su meta próxima es diversificar su negocio con la venta de productos veterinarios. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Zapatillas, Botas de hule y cuadernos cocidos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar su inventario y obtener mayores ganancias. Su plan futuro es ampliar su negocio con mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en: Francisco, married and 26 years old, comes from Comoapa. He sells clothing and shoes. He started his business with his own money, and has been growing it little by little. Today he has a prosperous and well stocked business. His next goal is to diversify his business by selling pet supplies. He is requesting this loan to purchase slippers, galoshes, and ruled notebooks.  He believes the loan will be of great assistance to him in expanding his inventory and earning greater income. His future plan is to expand his business with a great variety of products.

loans.use: buy assorted shoes and products for resale

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget is 53 years old and is a married woman of four children in Takeo Province. Nget and her husband (who is with her in the photo) are farmers and all her children are laborers. All of them can earn $26 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1500 for buying beauty salon materials. This loan helps her daughter in opening a beauty salon shop as well as making profit for the family.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon materials.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim is 27 years old and is a married woman of one child in Takeo Province. She is a silk maker and her husband is an arc welder. Both of them can earn $11 per day. She would like a loan of $600 to purchase dirt for filling her land. This loan helps her in making her house better.

loans.use: to purchase dirt for filling her land.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 2 Group

texts.en:
The Karanjung Lestari 2 Group pays off their loans on time. They have a meeting at the head of the group's house and make their payment one by one. In the meeting, they discuss the progress about their pigs. Most of them can maintain the pigs well and earn a satisfactory profit. The profit can fulfill their needs and saving. Now they decided to borrow a new loan to continue and improve their business. They said thank you to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting the business, especially in their pig business. They hope they can improve their life with this business.

After success with their last loan, the Karanjung Lestari 2 Group received their new loan. Now, most of the members already have sows. They need a new loan to purchase feed, superior piglets, and renovate the cage. 

To make the piglets grow fast, healthy, and fat, Ni Made used her loans to purchase super quality feeds. Now she has one sow and three local piglets. She hopes after 5 months, she can sell the piglets and the sow can give birth. Her husband supports her business because it can help their family's income.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feeds.

loans.name: Clarifer

texts.en: Clarifer helps her husband operate their own farm for a living. For ten years of farming, the couple earns well to provide the family. Her husband earns additional income from working as a private driver. Clarifer borrowed a loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm as they have planned. In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Unidos Por Fe Group

texts.es:
Samuel, tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Don Samuel, lleva 15 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz, yuca y plátano, este cultivo lo realiza en un terreno que alquilan. La producción la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es por 12,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar insumos y fertilizantes para el cultivo y darle buen mantenimiento para sacar mejor cosecha y para surtir el negocio de variedades que tiene en su casa donde recibe otros ingresos. Su meta a fututo es cultivar palma africana y con las ganancias mejorar su vivienda.
El préstamo es en forma grupal y se llama Unidos por Fe, esta integrado por dos miembros don Samuel que en la foto esta de camisa cuadriculada a la derecha y don Domingo a la izquierda, que se dedican a la agricultura, viven en la misma comunidad y solicitan un préstamo total por 27,000 lempiras para fertilizar el cultivo de plátano, maíz y yuca.
texts.en:
Samuel, 58 years old, is married and has three children. He lives in a neighborhood in the city of Choloma, Cortes. Samuel has 15 years of experience at growing corn, yucca, and plantain on some land that he rents. He sells his produce at a local market. His portion of the loan will be used to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops which will help him get a better harvest. He will also use part of the loan to stock a variety store that he has in his home that helps him bring in additional income. His goal for the future is to plant oil palm and use his earnings to improve his life.

This is a group loan, and the group is called Unidos por Fe (United by Faith). It is composed of two members: in the picture, Samuel is on the right in the plaid shirt and Domingo is on the left. Both are farmers who live in the same community. They are asking for a total of 27,000 lempiras to fertilize their crops.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for crops and stock a home-based variety store

loans.name: Aning

texts.en:
Aning is 64 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business of buying and selling coconut-leaf roofing in the Philippines and requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase stock of materials for her business. Aning has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Aning would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of materials for her business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 38-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of selling onions with her husband for many years. She is very passionate in her business of selling onions and she manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a mother of three children. 

Yasmeen is trying to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more onions. This will help her to consistently meet market demands. It’s her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more onions.

loans.name: Kuncup Mekar Group

texts.en:
With a loan from Kiva, members of the group "Kuncup Mekar" have completed 2 cycles. They are very grateful for once, because with their Kiva loan, they were able to develop their businesses, adding new types of foods and more adequate equipment. With their new level of welfare they can develop better, happier families.

This group is led by a woman named Lulu. Her efforts in opening her catering services is growing, and her children can all go to school. Together with her husband, Lulu is trying to fill orders for food from the offices it serves. Her hope is that, with this cycle to three members and their business venture, her business can be much more developed. With this loan, Lulu will buy cookware and purchase an additional gas stove. Kuncup Mekar says thank you very much to lenders, may you always be blessed and given a better welfare.

loans.use: to buy cookware and to purchase an additional gas stove.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 55-year-old energetic married woman. For the last many years she has been doing a business of manufacturing ‘waan’, a material used in making 'charpoy' (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she is famous for providing good quality waan in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. 

Saira needs to improve her business so she requested Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy another machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread. This will help her to grow her sales. It’s her seventh loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy another machine for spinning thread.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is 39 years old and is a married man with four children living in Takeo Province. He is a construction laborer and his wife is a factory laborer. Both of them can earn $13 USD per day. Now Touch would like to apply for loan of $500 USD for buying a motorbike for traveling. This loan helps him in reducing expenses. He hopes that his wife can be a hair tailor at home and his children can get diplomas.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells foodstuffs and household items. She describes her family challenge to be shortage of water and poor water storage facilities. She will use the Kes 41,500 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit 10 family members. She hopes that in the future, she will have easy access to water. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM.  Previous loans of KES 150,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be polite and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, milk, sugar, and other items. She describes her family challenge to be poor drainage and access to clean water. She will use the 11,500 KES loan to buy a water tank and buy stock of bread, milk, and other items she sells. The water tank will enable her family of six members to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and buy stock of bread, milk, and other items she sells.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 43; she is the mother of two sons and four daughters and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover their household necessities from his own store as well, his  relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. 

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Nasreen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy general store items  such as flour, sugar, rice, salt, and other groceries

loans.name: Shareefa

texts.en:
Shareefa  is 59 years old and the mother of one child. Shareefa has been running a business of milk selling for the last 10 years. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only breadearner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has three buffaloes and one cow. 

This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history. Now she has asked Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married  parent of eight children, Anita works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Anita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 47 years old and married, with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, soap, rice, shampoo, and groceries.

Annabel has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Annabel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, soap, rice, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Veonica

texts.en: Veonica is applying for a loan of $800. She will use the loan to buy sugar, coffee, candles, slippers, and other items to sell. She opened her kiosk two years ago with a working capital of $250. She is a hard working woman; sometimes she is doing mobile business (based on the market day) and she brings her goods to sell in a few places. She is earning a good income and she happy to get the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, candles, slippers, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 24 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for plowing her rice fields.

Analyn has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for plowing rice fields.

loans.name: Nobat

texts.en: Nobat is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. For about 5 years she has been in the business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in high demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan from the Kashf Foundation for 40,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. In this way, Nobat would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Sobeea

texts.en: Sobeea is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of two children.  She has been running a business of trading cloth for the last year. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Sobeea requested from Kashf Foundation a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good, quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 29-year-old woman. She has been in the business of making ladies' bags for many years. She makes bags in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good-quality bags. She earns enough money to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business, Asia contacted Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase leather covers and zippers in a large quantity, to cater more customers without delay. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her sales, which ultimately, will help in generating more cash. 

Asia dreams of expanding her business. It’s her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase leather covers and zippers in a large quantity.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von is 35 years old and is a married woman with two children in Takeo Province. She is a factory laborer and her husband, who is with her in the photo, is a Tuk-tuk (motorcycle) driver. Both of them can earn $10 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to buy a new Tuk-tuk for her husband to provide service to clients. In the future, she hopes she can run a small business as a retailer at home.

loans.use: to buy a Tuk-tuk for her husband to provide a transportation service to clients.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Roque forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas hacen la encuesta de los 50 indicadores para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar e ir mejorando sus vidas.
La Sra. Dominga, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con niveles medios y que debe seguir esforzando y por medio de su trabajo ir mejorando su estilo de vida y el de su familia. Ella es costurera y tiene un pequeño taller que con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar y salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia de esa forma. Es muy trabajadora y por sobre todo tiene el ánimo de seguir creciendo y superarse.
La Sra. Dominga solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas e hilos que le permitirá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y creciendo para mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The San Roque group is part of a poverty eradication program in which women survey the 50 indicators that determine the status of their lives, and work to improve their lives accordingly. Ms. Dominga displayed a poverty level of two in her latest survey (average levels, in other words) and that she should continue to be confident, and through her work improve her lifestyle and her family's as well. She is a seamstress and has a small workshop that she was able to get off the ground with much hard work and helped her family get ahead in this way. She is very hardworking and above all, she has the courage to continue to grow and excel.

Ms. Dominga requests this loan to purchase fabric and thread to allow her to continue with her work as she has been doing, and grow and improve her life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for sewing

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 33-year-old mom with an only child. Farming is the main source of income in their village. For a living, she owns and manages a farm, planting and harvesting coconut and other crops for sale and family consumption.  Her husband works as a construction worker. In order to buy organic fertilizer, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit.  She hopes to have an abundant harvest, to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean earns a living from selling goods in her village while her husband works overseas. For five years, Jean has earned well and sustained the business. She had also bought some home improvements like appliances with her revenue.  To add inventory capital, she is taking a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more used clothes to resell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be lack of a good cooking facility. She will use the Kes 14500 loan to buy a gas cooker. This will enable her family of four to cook efficiently. She hopes that in the future she will live a happy life. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.  Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen is 52 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, bread, chips, noodles, etc. Belen has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns income from coconut farming. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, bread, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Belma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Belma works hard to support her family.

She has a hollow block-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Belma is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cement, sand, and gravel for her hollow block-making business.

Belma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cement, sand, and gravel for her block-making business.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita works hard to support her family. Carmencita is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Carmencita has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future Carmencita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a married women, and her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. Previously she obtained a Kiva loan for her husband’s business improvement. He earns a good amount of income to help with their household expenses through his business. Currently she is applying for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase new tires and spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un is a 62-year-old married woman with one child in Takeo Province. She is a farmer, her husband is a driver, and her child is a factory laborer. All of them can earn $11 per day. She would like to apply for a loan of $500 to buy a pig to breed. This loan helps her in getting more profit as well as in getting a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a pig to breed

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Yorn is 51 years old, a married woman with one child in Takeo Province. She is a scarf weaver, and her husband, who is with her in the photo, is a Tuk-tuk (motorcycle) driver. They can each earn $7 per day. Now she would like to apply for loan of $1000 to buy farmland to build a house.

loans.use: to buy farmland to build a house.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Moustapha

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mouhamadou, un jeune de 27 ans, travaille comme poseur de pare-brise. Métier qu’il pratique depuis 4 ans ; il était vendeur de pharmacie auparavant. Il a changé de métier parce que voyant que cela ne lui apportait pas beaucoup d’argent. Il a ouvert un atelier où il pratique. Seulement, pour maximiser son bénéfice, il aimerait bénéficier d’un crédit pour acheter la marchandise dont il a besoin pour travailler et la stocker sur place et ne pas avoir à se déplacer à chaque fois. Il ouvre à 8h et ferme vers 18h. Mouhamadou est célibataire : il se prend en charge pour la nourriture et la location de sa chambre. 
Le crédit semble avoir un impact positif sur lui car il a pu acheter presque tout son matériel, outillage de travail grâce à ce dernier.
Mouhamadou a comme ambition de développer son activité, avoir une grande entreprise et se faire connaitre à travers le pays.
texts.en:
Mr. Mouhamadou, a 27-year-old young man, works as a windshield fitter, a trade he has been practicing for four years. He used to be a pharmacy vendor beforehand. He switched trades because of the little money it brought in. Mouhamadou opened a workshop where he works. To maximize his profits, he would only like to benefit from a loan to purchase the goods he needs for his work and to stock them locally, so as not to have to make repeated trips. He opens his shop from 8 AM to 6 PM. Mouhamadou is unmarried, and he covers his own food and rent costs. 

Loans seem to have a positive impact on him, since he was able to purchase nearly all his supplies and equipment for work, thanks to loans. His ambition is to develop his business, to own a large company, and to be known throughout the country.

loans.use: to purchase windshields as inventory for his business repairing vehicles

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic 48, is married with six children and is engaged in a buy and sell fish business. Now she plans to add vegetables for resale within her locality, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fishe (fresh and dried) and a variety of vegetables as additional goods to offer. She believes that with this loan, together with hard work and fortitude, her business will grow continuously.

loans.use: to buy volume of fishes and variety of vegetables use to be sell

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. She always wanted to organize her own business. One year ago she began her own business selling food items. Her working capital was small when she began her business. Thanks to her hard work and patience little by little she has developed her business. She sells sugar, pasta, salt, sausage, candies, milk products, etc. She is going to increase her working capital. 

Guljahon is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy food items for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en: Lolito, a father of five children provides repair services in their village to make a living. For many years, he earned well to provide for his family. He needs to buy spare motor parts and accessories needed for his shop in order to improve the services.  With the micro finance loan of GDMPC, his business will be sustained. In the future, he wants to build an improved repair shop for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to buy spare motor parts and accessories needed for his shop

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she grows crops for sale. She describes her family's challenge as a lack of enough water storage facilities. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit her four family members. She hopes that in the future she will economically sustain her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. 

She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water storage facilities. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit four family members. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her life. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a 40 year old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 13 years. He describes himself to be innovative and aggressive. He operates a retail business where he sell fruits and also operates a farm where he grows crops . He describes his challenge to be lack of water pump for pumping water to his farm. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water pump and pipes to enable him pump water to his farm to enable him maximize production. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water pump and pipes

loans.name: Shakuntala

texts.en: Shakuntala is a 33-year-old vigorous lady; she has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has asked Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 8th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen has been successfully running a business of hand embroidery with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Previously with the help of a Kiva loan she purchased raw material for the expansion of her business. Now she is applying for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase spools of threads, packs of sequins, pearls, and glittering materials for embellishment. She then would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand of her customers. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children. It’s her third loan cycle and she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, packs of sequins, pearls, and glittering materials

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell dried coconut meat business. Charito is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Charito has sustained her business activities through the past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: Carmencita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishnet and maintenance for her fishing boat. Carmencita has been in this business for 20 years. She also earns income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishnet and maintenance for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel lives runs a general store selling goods in her local community and has been doing this for three years. She was determined to improve the business because she wants to provide her children a better education. She is taking a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods. She plans to expand her store in the future in order to gain more income for the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water storage facilities. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility. This will enable her family of six members to store sufficient clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future she will be economically and socially sustain her business and family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Meet Alice, a farmer living in the Kitale area of the North Rift in Kenya.  This area is known for poultry farming. She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school.  She has been farming for 15 years, and her primary income comes from the sale of milk, maize, and vegetables. She enjoys farming as it gives her good returns. The challenge she has is that during drought periods, farming is not profitable.
Alice said that she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because Juhudi helps small-scale farmers accumulate wealth and acquire farming assets. During the training session, she learnt that Juhudi Kilimo provides asset financing to its clients at a lower interest rate. This loan will enable her to purchase an additional dairy cow, which will add more milk production and thus help her in paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Melinda is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF in order to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Meet Rehema who lives and does farming in Kitale, an area with a high regional output of maize. She has three children, and has been farming for two years. Her income source comes from the sale of milk, eggs, and maize. Besides farming, she has a retail business. In farming, she enjoys milking cows and selling the milk to her neighbors. She has challenges of cutting grass for zero grazing, and also drought seasons. Rehema chose Juhudi Kilimo, because she has seen her neighbors acquire financial support from Juhudi and develop by acquiring agricultural assets. Her highest expense is school fees. This loan will enable her to purchase poultry, which will bring in more egg production. This will help her pay school fees for her children and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is requesting a loan of $800 to buy eggs, chocolates, biscuits, oil, and other things to sell.  She has a kiosk that she opened with her own working capital of $ 1.500 a year ago. She is earning a good income from her business and she sometimes sells around the base on market day. This is her first loan offered from TRM and she hopes to repay her loan on time in order to get the next loan.

loans.use: to buy eggs, chocolates, biscuits, oil, and other things to sell

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Yim is a 48-year-old, married woman, with four children, at Takeo Province. She is a farmer. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, is a construction laborer in Thailand, and her two children are laborers. All of them can earn $23 per day. Now she would like to apply for loan of $1,500 for buying a hand tractor. This loan will help her to increase her income, as well as her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor.

loans.name: Nekruz

texts.en: Nekruz was born in 1992. He is not married and lives with his parents in the Northern part of Tajikistan. Nekruz is a student of the Polytechnic University of Tajikistan.  He studies at the fourth course level. Nekruz studies at the Faculty of Engineering. Nekruz studies well and has a dream to be the best specialist. His parents have not enough money to pay for his tuition. That’s why he is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Musayamhuja

texts.en:
Musayamhuja is a hardworking man. He is married and has two children. He has a 22-year-old son and a 15-year-old daughter. Musayahuja works as a cashier in IMON, and he is one of the best employees of IMON. Musayamhuja always strives for the well being of his family. His wife is a housewife and that’s why Musayamhuja is the breadwinner of his family. 

Musayamhuja’s son is a student of the Tajikistan State University Politic and Business School. He studies at the magistracy. Musayamhuja must pay for the education of his son but he does not have the money. He is asking for a loan of 1,100 USD with this aim. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition

loans.name: Kotakegne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTAKEGNE est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TINGOLE, commune de TINGOLE préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de savon artisanal (Kabakourouni), et du pain. Les femmes du groupe KOTAKEGNE sont à leurs deuxièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente FATOUMATA la première personne à partir de la gauche n’a pas été à l’école. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenues sans succès, et à la suite d’une formation reçue par FAFA (une ONG nationale intervenant dans le développement rural) elle fait actuellement la fabrication de savon artisanal (gabakourouni). Elle compte acheter 30 kg de beurre de karité, 3 litres d’huiles de palme, et 3 gros paquets d’Omo chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire de Fana. Ainsi, elle les transformé en savon de qualité. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte chez elle en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 12. 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera utilisé pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The group KOTAKEGNE is composed of married women, who average 40 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of TINGOLE, in Commune de TINGOLE, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, artisanal soaps (Kabakourouni), and bread. 

The women of the group KOTAKEGNE are on their second solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, FATOUMATA, who is the first person at the left in the photo, did not go to school. After having attempted several kinds of revenue-generating work without success, she then got training from FAFA (a national NGO involved in rural development).

She is currently making artisanal soap (gabakourouni). She intends to purchase 30 kg of shea butter, 3 liters of palm oil, and 3 big packets of Omo from wholesalers at the Fana weekly market. She processes the ingredients into quality soaps. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying cash at her house. She plans on making a profit of 12,000 francs CFA per month that will be used for her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making artisanal soaps

loans.name: Christylen

texts.en:
Christylen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials such as wood, paint, nails, etc.

Christylen has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Christylen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as wood, paint, nails, etc

loans.name: Deivyd Duván

texts.es:
Deivyd Duván de Bogotá, tiene 19 años, vive con los padres Luis Eduardo y María, también con los dos hermanos Andrea y Nicolás Alexander, trabaja en como Empacador solo 4 horas, por lo consiguiente el sueldo es proporcional al trabajo.
Actualmente pasa a 3 semestre del programa Arte Gráfico y publicitario, con lo cual se ahorra lo de los transportes diarios, lo cual se le complicara el estudiar en la sede de Teusaquillo por el aumento que estos gastos de transporte le implican.
Al finalizar la carrera desea especializarse en fotografía publicitaria y convertirse en el mejor fotógrafo de este medio de comunicación, 

El convenio con kiva le sería de gran ayuda ya que estudiaría en una sede donde le queda retirado del lugar donde vive, a si que le gasto en transportes y en el pago de las mensualidades aumentaría mucho, el agradece si le pueden colaborar con el subsidio de kiva ya que el valor en el pago de las mensualidades seria más bajo.
texts.en:
Deivyd Duván, of Bogotá, is 19 years old.  He lives with his parents, Luis Eduardo and María, as well as with his siblings Andrea and Nicolás Alexander.  He works only four hours as a bagger, with a salary in proportion to his work.  Currently he is passing into the third semester of the Graphic Arts and Advertising program, so he is saving on his daily transportation.  When he switches to the Teusaquillo campus that will become more complicated due to the increase that these transportation expenses mean for him.

Upon finishing his program of studies, he hopes to specialize in advertising photography, turning himself into the best photographer in that format of communication.

The agreement with Kiva would be a huge help to him because he would be studying at a campus far from where he lives, so the transportation expenses and the monthly payments would increase a lot.  He is grateful if they can collaborate with him with the Kiva subsidy, because the amount of the charges on his monthly payments would be lower.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's registration

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TINGOLE, commune de TINGOLE préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de beignet, et de charbon de bois. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leurs quatrièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente SOUMBA la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de beignet de haricot. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de grain de haricot, et 40kg de beurre de karité avec les paysans du village. La vente se fait en espèce au marché journalière du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 22 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera en partie injectés dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of married women, who average 43 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of TINGOLE, in Commune de TINGOLE, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in beignets and charcoal. 

The women of the group DANAYA are on their fourth solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, SOUMBA, who is the first person standing at the right in the photo, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of bean beignets. She intends to purchase a sack of beans and 40 kg of shea butter from peasant farmers of the village. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying cash at the village's daily market. She plans on making a profit of 22,000 francs CFA per month that will in part be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making beignets.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TINGOLE, commune de TINGOLE préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font de la restauration, et le commerce d’arachide et de céréales. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leurs troisièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente DJENEBOU  la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de cacahouètes depuis 5 ans, chose qu’elle a hérité de sa mère. Elle compte acheter 1 paquet de sachet plastique chez les boutiquiers du village, et 1 sac d’arachide non décortique avec les paysans du village. Ainsi, elle le décortique, et le transforme en cacahouète de qualité. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte chez elle, et en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 10 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera en partie injectés dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of married women, who average 47 years of age and three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of TINGOLE, in Commune de TINGOLE, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in peanuts and grains. 

The women of the group BENKADI are on their third solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, DJENEBOU, who is the first person standing at the right in the photo, is uneducated. She has been a vendor of peanuts beignets for five years. It is something passed down to her from her mother. She intends to purchase a packet of plastic bags from village shopkeepers and a sack of unshelled peanuts from village farmers. So, she shells the peanuts and processes them into a quality product. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying cash at her home. She plans on making a profit of 10,000 francs CFA per month that will in part be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Sam At

texts.en:
Sam At is 42 years old, married and lives in Cheung Prey, Batheay, Kampong Cham province. She is a widow now and has three children who are living with her. Sam At is the only breadwinner of her family. She is engaged in farming and works as a day laborer for additional income, and she spends the remaining time of the year working in a garment factory.

One of her children just finished high school and wanted to continue his education in the field of architecture and civil engineering. Due to the family’s financial shortage, Sam At is experiencing difficulties to pay for her son’s tuition fees, so she is asking for a loan to help her cover the costs of his studies and to buy the materials needed to support her son's education. Sam At is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via the program Kiva that allows poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to help her cover the costs of school and to buy the materials needed to support her son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber and other materials.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is married with three children, and operates a motorcycle repair shop for a living. For many years in this service, Allan has earned well to provide for his family, and is able to send his children to school. Allan is happy to say that this helps his family a lot. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy additional spare parts for motor repair. In the future, he wants to have a better living for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for motor repair.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TINGOLE, commune de TINGOLE préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, et de charbon de bois. Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leurs cinquièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MARIAM  la première personne à partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 25 kg de sel, 20 kg de noix de néré, 10 kg de noix de dah, 10 paquets de cube Maggi, 15 kg d’oignon, 10 kg de gombo séché chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire de Fana. La vente se fait à en détaille et en espèce a une clientèle mixte chez elle et au marché du village. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 33 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera injectés dans l’élevage de petit ruminant.
texts.en:
The group BADEGNA is composed of married women, who average 44 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of TINGOLE, in Commune de TINGOLE, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in condiments and charcoal. 

The women of the group BADEGNA are on their fifth solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, MARIAM, who is the first person at the left in the photo, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase 25 kg of salt, 20 kg of néré nuts, 10 kg of dah nuts, 10 packets of Maggi cubes, 15 kg of onions, and 10 kg of dried okra from wholesalers at the Fana weekly market. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying cash at her home and at the village market. She plans on making a profit of 33,000 francs CFA per month that will be invested in raising small ruminants.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as salt, nuts, onions, and okra.

loans.name: Hau Men Ana Group

texts.en: Bendita is one of the members from Hau Men Ana Group. The words "Hau men ana"  in the local language, means" Hope." She is taking the loan to add to her own working capital, in order to buy some additional supplies such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and bread. She is a hardworking woman. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $ 30.00 dollars.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and bread.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena, 33 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She has been selling recycled materials in her village for almost two years. Due to insufficient funding, she requests a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase plastic bottles, scrap materials, old newspaper, and steel to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand more of her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bottles, scrap materials, old newspaper, and steel to sell.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah lives in a small town in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rainforest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane, and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Jeremiah is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for fifteen years now, and they are currently growing maize, sugarcane, and vegetables on their farm. Jeremiah is excited about beekeeping, because it will provide him with honey for medicinal use.

This is Jeremiah's first loan with Honey Care, and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farming. Jeremiah's hope for the future is to start a small business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in a small town in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rainforest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane, and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

David is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 23 years now. They are currently growing maize, wheat, vegetables, bananas, fruits, and they are practicing dairy and poultry farming. David is looking forward to beekeeping, because the bees will help in pollinating his crops, provide him with honey for medicinal use, as well as earn him some income.

This is David's first loan with Honey Care, and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to take care of his family. David's hope for the future is to start a small business to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa (shown in photo) is 21 years old, single and lives with her parents and sisters in a suburb of Phnom Penh.  Her father is a motokangbei taxi driver.  In the past, they were commonly known as "tuktuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "motokangbei" by government authorities.

Santa is now a third year student in Phnom Penh City, majoring in English literature.  In addition, she is also an assistant English teacher for a private school.  She asks for a loan to pay for her school fees and she hopes she will have a good job when she finishes her study.

loans.use: To pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Editha has been in this business for 10 years now.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en: Cherrylyn is 24 years old and is engaged in the junk shop business.  According to her, she only earns about 500 PHP.  She really wants to increase her income everyday but due to insufficient capital she has had, she’s not able to meet her desired income.  in order to address her situation, she decided to request for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital to be used in purchasing junk products such as plastics and bottles.  Hopefully, her requested loan will be granted so she can grow her business of buying and selling recycled materials.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital in purchasing junk products such as plastics and bottles

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 53 years old and the widowed mother of eight children.

Belinda works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell.

Belinda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.  Belinda aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport  business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and rsising livestock.  Elisa is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Leonisa works hard to support her family.  She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Leonisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her sewing machine.

Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, and cement blocks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Patricia Lisseth

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece Patricia junto a su dos hijas.
Patricia de 22 años de edad,  es la mayor de 5 hermanos, creció sin un padre que velara por ellos y  como su madre salía a vender todos los días, Patricia desde pequeña se encargó del cuido de sus hermanitos procurando que siempre tuvieran comida y estuvieran limpios. Estaba estudiando de 15 años de edad cuando se acompañó, pero siempre supo que solo trabajando es que se sale adelante. Su esposo, es empleado en una quesera ubicada en la comunidad. Actualmente viven en una casa heredada por su madre, ahí vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 y 6 años de edad. 

Siempre se ha interesado por la crianza de cerdos y ya lleva 7 años dedicándose a la crianza de estos animales. Con la ayuda de Dios y mucho esfuerzo han salido adelante y siempre obtiene ganancias con la venta de algún cerdo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir un chiquero, pues donde tiene los animales el piso es de tierra y se hace lodoso, que es un ambiente dañino para el animal pues se puede maltratar o enfermar.

Sueña con llegar a tener su propia granja porcina y así vender cerdos constantemente para de esta manera establecerse económicamente y darles una digna calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the photograph, Patricia appears with her two daughters.

Patricia is 22 years old. She is the oldest of five siblings. She grew up without a father to watch over them, and as her mother went out to sell every day, Patricia, ever since she was very young, was responsible for the care of her little siblings, seeing that they always had food and were clean. She was in school at the age of fifteen when she married, but she always knew that only by working could she advance. Her husband is employed in a dairy located in the community. They now live in a house inherited by her mother. She lives there with her husband and their two children, ages 5 and 6.

She has always been interested in raising pigs, and she has already spent 7 years raising these animals. With the help of God and much effort, they have advanced, and she always obtains earnings from the sale of any pig.

The loan that she is applying for is to construct a pigpen, since the floor in the place where she has the animals is made of earth and it gets muddy, which is a harmful environment for the animals, since it can harm them or make them sick.

She dreams of having her own pig farm and thus selling pigs constantly so that in this way she can establish herself economically and give a dignified quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to build a pigpen, since the place where she has the animals now has a dirt floor and it gets muddy.

loans.name: Maritza Emperatriz

texts.es:
Maritza de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, actualmente está divorciada, tiene 4 hijos los cuales dos de ellos van a la escuela y viven a su responsabilidad, los otros dos están casados.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde varios años, lo aprendió de su madre ya que ella le ayudaba, ahora trabaja sola y vende su ropa en los cantones más cercanos a la comunidad y su horario en días de comercio es de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde.

Con el préstamo ampliara el negocio y otra parte para pagar un crédito en otra institución, mejorara su  calidad de vida, ya que tendrá más ganancias porque compra más ropa para su venta.

Los sueños es que sus hijos terminen la escuela y que puedan seguir estudiando, para que sean profesionales; el préstamo le ayudará porque va a invertir en compra de ropa y las ganancias las invierte en educación de sus hijos y seguir comprando más.
texts.en:
Maritza, who is 45 years old, went to school through the second year of high school. She is now divorced. She has four children, of whom two go to school and live in her care, and the other two are married.

She has sold clothing for a number of years. She learned from her mother, since she helped her. Now she works alone and sells her clothing in the cantons closest to the community.  Her schedule on business days is from six in the morning to three in the afternoon.

With the loan she will expand her business and use part to pay off a loan at another institution. She will improve her quality of live, since she will have more earnings because she will buy more clothing to sell.

Her dreams are that her children finish school and be able to continue their studies so that they can have careers. The loan will help her because she is going to invest in the purchase of clothing, invest the earnings in the education of her children, and continue buying more.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell and to pay off a loan at another institution.

loans.name: Amazonas Ii Group

texts.es:
