La A.C. “AMAZONAS II” iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Efrena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: ropa de bebe, taller de satrería, venta de verduras, servicio de taxi, tienda de carne, taller de edredones, pollerería, venta de herramientas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Efrena es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar y que ella al casarse decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo que realizan en su grupo que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank, “Amazonas II” will begin its nineteenth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional office. It is composed of nine members and guided by a board of directors, of which Señora Efrena is the president. The members have various businesses such as baby clothing, a tailor shop, vegetable sales, a taxi service, a butcher shop, a quilt shop, a poultry store, and tool sales. 

The loan that they will receive will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs where Señora Efrena is a member. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for nine years, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. 

She has a business selling clothing, and she says that this was a family business that she decided to carry out independently when she got married. The loan that she is receiving is to increase her capital for the purchase of wholesale clothing, which she will acquire in the markets of the city of El Alto and later sell in her sales space. This work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married with three children.
 
When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the work that they do in her group that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Edwin Joel

texts.es:
Edwin de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen una hija que estudia primer g rado.

Él se dedica a reparar y activar celulares, lo aprendió por si solo, también se dedica a reparar bicicletas
y tiene su negocio en su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una motocicleta,  ya que se le hace más fácil el traslado para ir a traer su equipo pues también hace entregas a domicilio.

Su deseo es que su negocio crezca y tenga más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en: Edwin, 37, went to school until ninth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. They have a daughter who is in the first grade. He works repairing and activating cell phones, which he learned on his own. He also repairs bicycles and his business is in his home. He is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle, since it will make it easier for him to transport his equipment, as he also does deliveries. His wish is for his business to grow and to have more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a resident of Mauswagon, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 school-aged and 6 adult children. She is 55 years old and engages in hog raising. This has been going for 5 years already. She joined in Paglaum Cooperative last 2002. She earns Php 3,000 per month doing this type of work. Recently, she reached out to PMPC to purchase piglets and hog pellets. Carmelita's net profit will be used to provide for the daily expenses of her children's schooling and basic commodities.

loans.use: to purchase 2 piglets and hog pellets.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and married with three children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from vending food.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, aged 44, is married and a mother of three children who live with her and her spouse in Chloung, Kracheh province. She earns a living through farming rice and cassavas in her village. She has great support from her spouse and is able to make approximately USD 5.00 per day.

Sophy wants to help her daughter pursue her university degree, but she has inadequate capital. That's why she is asking for a loan to help her daughter, Dalish, who is studying in the Faculty of Nursing Sciences and majoring in laboratory, cover her tuition fees. Her ambition is to finish her studies and have a well-paid job later so she can help her parents when they are older. Sophy and her daughter are very grateful for the loan funded via programs like Kiva to allow poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to cover tuition fees.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima was born in 1994. She is single and lives with her parents. Fotima is a second course student at Khujand State University. There, she studies in the department of Tajik philology. Fotima is a good student and receives good and excellent marks. 

Fotima's parents are poor and unable to pay for her tuition. Therefore, Fotima is requesting a loan to pay for her education costs. In the future, Fotima wants to be the best teacher.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 68 years old and lives in Tabo-o Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children who are now in adulthood. 
For their means of living, Lydia has been engaged in managing a small carenderia business for 10 years already and earns approximately PHP 8,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 2 sacks of rice, 5 kilos of beef, 5 kilos of meat, 5 kilos of dressed chicken, 5 kilos of fish, spices, seasonings, 10 cases of soft drinks and other ingredients for the food she’s going to sell in her carenderia business. 
Lydia has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future Lydia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beef, meat, dressed chicken, fish, spices, seasonings and soft drinks.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 44 years old and lives in Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has two children.

Luciana has a store that sells goods and dry goods and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan for additional capital to buy goods and dry goods to sell.

Luciana has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to build a bigger store for her products.

loans.use: to buy goods and dry goods to sell

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Roselda

texts.en:
Roselda is 37 years old and married with three children.

Roselda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Roselda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Roselda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en: Zuhra is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has seven years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Zuhra is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a Kashf Foundation loan of 50,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, oils, sugar, grains, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, oils, sugar, grains, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Cely

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Cely works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods retail business in the Philippines, and earns additional income by selling personal products. Cely is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell to customers.

Cely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 33 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 38 years old, married and lives at Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter and the wage that he gets from carpentry work is not sufficient to meet their needs. From her desire to earn an income on her own, she takes in and raises pigs in their backyard. She's been doing this for 5 years already. In 2012, Raquel became an active member of Paglaum MPC and enjoys the benefits given by the cooperative.
Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy additional feeds. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additonal feeds for pigs.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en: Nargiza was born in 1983. She is married and has 3 children. Nargiza is very hardworking woman. She is a woman who has ‘golden hands’. She is a sewer and sews very wonderful dresses. Nargiza never has been busy with business. Now, she is going to organize her own business with sewing. She took part in a course called ‘To get Ahead’ for women's organizations and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine and an embroidery machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an embroidery machine for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 50, lives in Dao, Pagadian. She is married and has a child.                

Josephine is a farmer and grows corn for a living. She has been a farmer for the past six years. Additionally, Josephine has been a PMPC member for one year. Josephine is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Sisa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice retail. Sisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Sisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a smartphone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Muath

texts.en:
Muath is 24 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan, with his five siblings and mother. His father is deceased. 

Muath currently works in the design sector. He is also working towards his bachelor's degree in finance. Muath is in his fourth year and is only one step away from graduation. With a college degree, Muath will be able to find a better job after graduation and earn more money to support his family. 

Unfortunately, Muath's family has been facing a financial crisis since his father's death. Therefore, Muath is not able to pay his upcoming tuition fees. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to cover his education costs.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming tuition fees

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Meet Justus, who resides in Kisii land. He is married and has four children, all of school-going age. He has been farming for over 20 years. He produces and sells milk, bananas and maize. In addition to farming, he has a retail business. In farming, Justus enjoys the benefits he gets out of it.

Justus said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because the services they offer are tailor-made to assist small-scale farmers, and he wants to advance in farming. During the training, he learned that MFIs help farmers to know how to utilize a loan facility. 

Justus's highest expense is school fees. This loan will enable him to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production and bring in more income, which will help him pay his children's school fees and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 59 years old and lives in Dao-an San Miguel ZDS. She is married and has 4 children.                    

Antonieta has a shop that sells grocery products and RTW. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan to buy grocery products and RTW (Ready-to-Wear).                                                                        

Antonieta has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Antonieta hopes to expand her business to the neighboring town.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and RTW (Ready-to-Wear)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is 63 years old and lives in Dipolog-Katipunan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is already a widow with three kids. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since June 2010. Being a member of Paglaum MPC, she maintains her records as a member in good standing. Recently, she asked Paglaum MPC for financial assistance so that she can have additional capital to purchase pigs for hog raising.With the help of Paglaum MPC, she hopes that this will help her expand her business. She is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for hog raising.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Riza works hard to support her family.

Riza has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Riza is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle that she uses for her motorcycle transportation business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Disdada

texts.en:
Disdada joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2012 and appreciates the programs, services and continuing education of the Co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She sells food for her living.

Disdada is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900. This loan will be used to purchase ingredients for food production. Disdada dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food vending.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en: Hadeel is 19 years old. She lives in a rented house in a section of Jordan called Irbid with her five siblings and her parents, who work as teachers. Hadeel is studying for a Bachelors degree with a major in Nursing. She is in her first year. She is planning to find a better job after her graduation and to earn a better income in order to support her family. But because of the financial crisis that her family has been facing, she was not able to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is 21 years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid. Her parents are deceased. Alaa is studying for a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in Class Teaching, and she is in her first year. 

After her graduation, Alaa is planning to find a better job and to earn a better income in order to support herself. But because of the financial crisis she has been facing, she hasn't been able to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 
Gloria has worked in farming, particularly rice production, for ten years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per cropping with this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase three sacks of fertilizer, chemical spray, and to pay for labor for rice production. Gloria has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of fertilizer, chemical spray, and for labor.

loans.name: Mun

texts.en:
Mun, 41 years old, lives in Ou Kambot, a peaceful village of the Chrey Vien commune, Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham province. She was gifted with one child who is enrolled in a local school. Mun and her husband are the breadwinners for the family, operating 1-1/2 hectares of land for rice cultivation. They want to help their child to be educated at a higher level.

Mun decided to take out her second loan when she needed additional working capital to buy a plow for her rice fields. This machine will help her manage her farming work on time and reduce some operating costs incurred by paying for plowing fees. She hopes to provide for the daily needs of her family. Mun expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a plow for her rice fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ten piglets and barn renovation costs

loans.name: Ceasar

texts.en:
Caesar is 27 years old, married and a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. He earns a living through fruit vending to sustain the needs of his family.

Caesar has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privilege of being a member of the Cooperative. Now he is applying a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional kilos of a variety of fruit to sell. Through this, Caesar hopes to increase his income so that he may be able to generate more savings for his children's college education. 

Caesar deeply wishes to maintain his status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy aditional kilos of a variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a scale.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is 60 years old and lives in Dr. Rizal, Katipunan Zamboanga Del Norte. She is already a widow with three kids. She has been a member since May 2013. After hearing about the services of Paglaum MPC, she didn't hesitate to join. She maintains her records as a member in good standing. Recently, she ask Paglaum MPC for financial assistance to purchase feed for her pigs. And with Paglaum MPC, she hopes that this will help her expand her business. She is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for pig feed.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en: Tariq is 21 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his seven siblings and his parents. Tariq is currently studying for his Bachelors Degree majoring in Graphic Design. He is in his first year. He is planning to find a better job after his graduation and to earn a better income in order to support his family. But because of the financial crisis his family has been facing, he wasn't able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
Genevie is 30 years old, and married with three children. They live in Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She raises pigs in their backyard  while her husband is a tricycle driver. 

Raising pigs is a good business; aside from earning money, she also enjoys doing it. Genevie is in her second year with PMPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy materials to repair her house. Their family income will be used to pay off the loan. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. Someday she wants to build a concrete pig pen to easily maintain more sanitary conditions, and to send all her children to college. Genevie wants her family to have a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beer, wine, sodas, spirits, water and juice

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with seven children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell.

She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from clothing sales.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Gultamze

texts.en:
Gultamze is a 25-year-old married woman from the village Khajalia. She lives with her husband, four-year-old son and mother-in-law. Gultamze's mother-in-law receives monthly assistance from the local government. 

Gultamze and her husband are farmers and work very hard. They grow mandarins, nuts, and maize. They offer their customers fresh and high quality produce and are able to sell their yield for a good price. 

Gultamze is requesting a loan to start another business. She is requesting 3,150 GEL to purchase a tractor for her husband so he can provide contractor services. Gultamze believes that this business will be lucrative and provide her family with an important source of income. Gultamze and her husband rely on the goodwill of lenders and are awaiting your support.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Lucia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lucia de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja es corralero, tienen cinco hijos los cuales todos viven con ellos y 3 de ellos estudian segundo, quinto y octavo grado y con su pareja se encargan de sus hijos.

Lucia sea dedica a los oficios domésticos desde que nació su primer hijo.

Necesita el préstamo para el mejoramiento de la vivienda, quiere quitar el techo, poner puerta e instalar energía eléctrica, mejorará su calidad de vida; porque ya no tendrá estrés por el calor y se sentirá segura al tener puertas.

Sus sueños es  seguir mejorando la casa, ya que desea construir una habitación y que sus hijos terminen la escuela y que se preparen  para ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en: Lucia is 31 years old and went to school up until the sixth grade. She's in a couple and her partner is a ranch-hand. They have five kids, all of whom live with them. Three of the kids are in school, in second, fifth, and eighth grade and she and her partner take care of the children. Lucia has devoted herself to housework since the birth of her first child. She needs the loan to improve the house, as she wants to remove the roof, install a door and electricity. Quality of life would improve since she would no longer be stressed by the heat, and the doors would make her feel safer. Her dream is to continue improving the house, since she wants to build a room and for her kids to finish school and prepare themselves to be somebody in life.

loans.use: To improve the home by removing the roof, installing a door, and installing electricity

loans.name: Juan Luís

texts.es:
Juan de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato y está casado y su esposa realiza los oficios domésticos y no tienen hijos hasta el momento.

Es comerciante de verduras y también se dedica a la ganadería desde hace unos 10 años, aprendió el negocio de su padre, ya que aún realiza esos trabajos; además trabaja en un gasolinera el cual le queda a unos 3 metros de su casa, el horario es de  cinco de la mañana a una de la tarde y de dos de la tarde a nueve de la noche.

Con el préstamo comprara un sistema de riego, ya que lo necesita porque siembra maíz y maicillo.

En un futuro cercano pretende tener hijos, que el negocio se mantenga o que aumente con las ganancias que pueda generar.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 26 years old, went to school through secondary school. He is married and his wife takes care of the domestic tasks. Up to now they have no children.

He sells vegetables, and he also has been raising livestock for some 10 years. He learned this business from his father, since he still does this work. In addition, he works at a gas station, which is some three kilometers from his house. The schedule is from 5 in the morning to1 in the afternoon and from 2 in the afternoon to 9 at night.

With the loan he will buy an irrigation system, since he needs it because he raises corn and sorghum.

In the near future, he wants to have children and maintain his business or increase it with the earnings that it can generate.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation system, which he needs because he raises corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old, happily married and a resident of Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through fishing.

She has been a member of PMPC for four years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase materials for her fishing business.

Nenita deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Roel

texts.en: Roel has been providing motor transportation in her village for more than six years, earning well for the family. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for motorcycle repairs. His wife does the household work and at the same time, sells cosmetic products to earn extra income for the family. Recently, he took a new loan to buy new tires in order to replace the old used one. He plans to save the revenue generated from his service business for the education of his two children.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 22 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his five siblings and his parents. Mohammad is currently working as an accountant at a supermarket and at the same time studying for his Bachelors Degree majoring in Civil Engineering. He is in his fourth year and is one step closer to graduation. He is planning to find a better job after his graduation and to earn a better income to support his family. But because of the financial crisis his family has been facing, he wasn't able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay college fees for the upcoming semester at the university

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato,  está soltero y tiene un hijo que estudia noveno, en su casa vive con una prima; pero solo su hijo depende  él.

Se dedica al destazo de cerdos, tiene dos años desempeñando este negocio, pues lo aprendió de su familia, anteriormente se dedicó a la venta de CD, el destazo lo realiza en su casa y dos miembros de su familia su prima y tía trabajan desde las seis de la mañana.

El préstamo lo utilizara, para la reparación del portón de su casa, ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones y lo que le sobre para comprar cerdos para destazarlo, se siente satisfecho ya que tendrá mucha mayor seguridad.

Espera que su hijo se prepare y que en un futuro sea un profesional y seguir manteniendo su negocio y con las  ganancias comprar más animales para el destazo.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 45 years old, went to school through high school. He is single and has a son who is in 9th grade. He lives in his house with a cousin, but only his son depends on him.

His work is butchering pigs. He has been in this business for two years, because he learned it from his family. Before this, he sold CDs. He does the butchering at his house, and two family members, his cousin and his aunt, work from six in the morning.

He will use the loan to repair the gate of his house, since it is in bad condition, and with what is left he will buy pigs to butcher. He feels satisfied, since he will have much greater security.

He hopes that his son will study hard and that in the future he will have a career, and that he will continue maintaining his business and with the earnings buy more animals to butcher.

loans.use: to repair the gate of his house.

loans.name: Enrequieta

texts.en:
Enrequieta is from Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 72 years old and is happily married with four kids. To generate income, she has a small sari-sari (convenience) store business with an attached eatery.

In 2010, Enrequieta applied for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Hearing all the benefits, she did not hesitate to become a member. She maintains her status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Enrequieta asked for financial assistance of 10,000 PHP to buy ingredients for her businesses. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. 

She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: José Ándres

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, jornalero padre de 12 hijos,estudio hasta tercer grado, las condiciones económicas de su familia no le permitieron seguir estudiando, pero eso no fue obstaculo para seguir adelante ha tenido muchas dificultades para mantener el sustento diario de su numerosa familia, junto con su esposa han trabajado arduo para garantizar a su familia las condiciones básicas y que a sus hijos no les faltara lo mas necesario.
José Trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y frijol, esta labor la hace en la época lluviosa ya que en el verano se dedica a la elaboración de teja artesanal como jornalero; teja elaborada de una especie de mezcla entre barro y otros tipos de tierra y luego la teja es ¨quemada¨ en hornos que ellos mismos construyen. José trabaja en las tejeras desde muy pequeño, su padre fue quien le enseño el oficio, en la zona es de las actividades productivas predominantes, en la elaboración de teja también trabajan 4 hijos de él, el resto estudia.

Con el crédito comprara los materiales que se necesitan para la elaboración de teja, este año se ha propuesto poner su propio negocio de teja y no estar dependiendo de si le dan o no trabajo, junto con sus hijos lo establecerán y ven que hay mercado para este rubro. 
En este momento no cuenta los recursos económicos necesarios y  por ello ha decidido solicitar el préstamo.

Su sueño es poder tener  bien fuerte su negocio de teja, donde haya  trabajo asegurado y sobre todo que sea sostenible en el tiempo, garantizando el sustento para su familia.
texts.en: Jose is a 45 year old day laborer and father of twelve children. He attended school until the third grade, because his family's finances did not allow him to continue his studies. However that hasn't prevented him from getting ahead. Providing for his large family's daily needs has entailed many difficulties, and he has worked hard with his wife to guarantee that his children don't lack for basic necessities. Jose works in agriculture, growing corn and beans. This job is done in the rainy season and in the summer his job is making artisanal tiles as a day laborer. The tiles are made with a mixture of clay and other types of earth, then the tiles are "burned" in ovens that they build themselves. Jose has worked for tile businesses since he was very young, and his father is the person that taught him the trade. It's one of the predominant economic activities in the area, and four of his children also work in tile manufacturing. The rest of his children are in school. With the loan he will purchase materials necessary for tile production, and this year has set the goal of setting up his own tile business and not have to depend on being hired. He will establish it with his children and they see a market for this type of business. Currently he doesn't have the necessary financial resources and that's why he has decided to request the loan. His dream is to really strengthen his tile business so he can have a guaranteed job that's sustainable in the long term, and thus guaranteeing support his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials necessary for making tiles

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 37 years old and married with three children.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell.

She has been running her general store for three years and earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Mercy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Jenepher's Group

texts.en:
Jenepher’s group has two group leader farmers and is located in Chwele District. The group leader farmers in this group represent a total of 27 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Jenepher is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised.
							
Jenepher is a reliable member of the community.  She is married with 10 children. Jenepher is 47 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support her family.  In addition to this, Jenepher is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group and prayer group.  She described her harvest last year as excellent. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue with the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Jenepher’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2009 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to learn new farming methods.  As an active member in her community, Jenepher also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member.  Jenepher plans to use future profits from the harvest to send children to school and buy a cow. J enepher’s life has also improved because she is in good health.  														
Jenepher and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Muhtasar

texts.en: Muhtasar was born in 1971. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Muhtasar lives with her family in a rural area. She began her own business dealing with animal husbandry 12 years ago. Muhtasar has three cows. Little by little, she developed her business. Muhtasar’s business is the main source of her family's income. She wants to buy one more cow and feed for cattle. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a cow and feed for her cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a cow and feed for cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Rosa Nelis

texts.es:
Rosa de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, tiene tres hijos quienes están estudiando su esposo es carpintero, ya tiene cuatro años de trabajar en la carpintería.

Ella tiene 8 años de trabajar en una empresa. Antes trabajaba en comerciales, también se dedicó al comercio de frutas y verduras.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar arena, cemento, hierro y bloques para levantar el muro y la pared que le hace falta a su casa. Será satisfecha una necesidad  que su casa requiere de esta construcción que se bien el invierno y es más perjudicial para ella y su esposo.

Desea, que su casa tenga las opciones necesarias, para vivir en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and has 3 children who are currently in school.  She herself only completed 2 years of high school.  Her husband is a carpenter and has worked in carpentry for 4 years.  She has been working at a company for 8 years.  Before this, she worked in sales and sold fruit and vegetables.

The loan she is asking for is to buy sand, cement, iron, and cement blocks so she can build two walls (one weight-bearing and one not) that her house is in need of.  This will meet a great need because winter is coming, which is a harsh time for her and her husband.

She hopes that her house can have the features necessary for them to live in ideal conditions.

loans.use: buy sand, cement, iron, and cement blocks so she can build two walls in her house.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia is 39 years old and married with six children. 

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Remia has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing 5,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Remia is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of clothing

loans.name: En Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado En Progreso lo conforman mujeres de Ciudad del Este, están en su 5º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres Urbanas; son muy unidas y trabajadoras y mediante la ayuda entre todas van fortaleciendo el grupo donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y  ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de todas han ido mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Nanci es la presidenta de este grupo, quien es muy entusiasta y siempre pone su mejor esfuerzo en el trabajo que tiene, el cual es una peluquería que con mucho esfuerzo ha ido mejorando y hoy ya tiene un buen lugar donde dar el servicio a sus clientes. Su sueño es poder tener un local más grande y también poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá aumentar más la cantidad de cosas que ofrece en su salón para seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called “En Progreso” and is made up of women from Ciudad del Este.  They are in their fifth cycle of the Committee for Urban Women and are united and hardworking and strengthening the group where they are all committed to help one another get ahead.  They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey, where they are all working to help their poverty situation.

Nanci is the group’s president, is very enthusiastic, and always puts forth her best effort in her work, a beauty salon which she is constantly improving.  Now she has a good location where she can serve her customers.  Her dream is to set up a larger area and also provide jobs for others.

She is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics so she can increase her inventory or products and continue to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Niño está en su ciclo 4° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir por debajo de los indicadores mínimos, por lo que deben esforzarse un poco más y sumado a las capacitaciones podrán lograrlo.
Una de ellas es la Sra.  Ramona, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene ventas de ropa usada y a la vez es limpiadora, se destaca ella por ser una persona muy sacrificada que con mucho esfuerzo está ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo a la vez que quiere ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas usadas para la venta, ya que le está yendo muy bien y quiere seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño” group is in its fourth cycle of the Committee for Women, where they are participating in the elimination of poverty survey.  Six of them are below the poverty line, which is below the minimum level of indicators, so they must work a little harder and improve their capabilities in order to do so.

Ramona is one of the women and she showed a level one on the poverty scale in the recent survey but is improving her situation through her work and effort.  She sells used clothing and also provides cleaning services.  She is a very hardworking lady who is helping her family though her work and wants to improve her living conditions.

She is asking for this loan to invest in used clothing to sell.  Things are going well for her and she wants to continue to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is a single entrepreneur. She owns a van and provides transportation services in her village to earn a living. She has an employee who manages the transportation business. It helps their family a lot.  

The vehicle needs repairs and maintenance so that Maria Elena can improve her services. With the micro finance loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), she will be able to pay for vehicle maintenance costs. 

In the future, she wants to acquire a new vehicle to use for the expansion of her services.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance costs

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Being a hardworking mother, Elvie helps her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a high production. She is 47 years old and has four children. Due to the hardships of living, she and her husband aim to expand their rice plantation in order to have a higher production. To make this attainable, she is asking for a loan of 23,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the maintenance of her rice crops. Through patience and hard work, she believes that they could obtain a plentiful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the maintenance of her rice crop production.

loans.name: Denis Ivan

texts.es: Denis, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Desde muy pequeño adquirió experiencia con sus padre de hacer lazos y hamacas con cabuya. esta actividad la realiza en su casa como negocio propio desde hace 10 años. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar materia prima como la cabuya para hacer los lazos y hamacas, y con una parte del préstamo va comprar unos materiales como canaletas para terminar el techo de su casa. Su plan es ampliar el mercado para su negocio y generar mas ingresos.
texts.en: Denis is 22 years old, single and lives with his parents and siblings in Choloma, Cortes.  He learned to make lassos and hammocks when he was very young.  He does this from his home as a business and has had it for 10 years.  He has decided to ask for a loan of 12,000 Lempiras to buy supplies and also some gutters so he can finish his roof.  His plan is to expand his business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 51 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school. 

Myrna is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Myrna has been farming rice for 25 years.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Majdeldeen

texts.en: Majdeldeen is 22 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his three siblings and his parents. Majdeldeen is currently studying for his Bachelors Degree, majoring in Accounting. He is in his fourth year and is one step closer to graduation. He is planning to find a better job after his graduation and to earn a better income in order to support his family. But because of the financial crisis his family has been facing, he wasn't able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de Mujeres está en el 4to ciclo, son un grupo muy emprendedor y que fueron creciendo de apoco, así son todas las señoras muy emprendedoras y quieren seguir creciendo por lo que cada día se esfuerzan más y más.
Evangelina es costurera, trabajo por medio del cual ayuda a su familia, tiene mucha clientela ya que su trabajo siempre gusta a sus clientes, y de esa forma es que se está abriendo camino. Siempre esta con mucho trabajo y tiene pedidos, es por eso que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres de Mujeres” and is in its fourth cycle.  It’s a very entrepreneurial group that grew slowly.  All of the ladies are very enterprising and want to continue to grow and they strive more each day.

Evangelina is a seamstress and works to help her family.  She has many customer and they always like her work.  She is opening doors this way and always has lots of work and orders, so she is asking for this loan to buy fabric and thread so she continue working and striving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia Antonia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de accesorios de cocina como hornillas y respuestos para cocinas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de accesorios de cocina.La socia solicita el credito para comprar repuestos y hornillas para cocinas.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonia continues to work in her kitchen accessories business and sells things like burners and spare parts for stoves.  She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and gets ahead through this business.  Her dream is to expand her business and is asking for this loan to buy spare parts and burners.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy parts.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 46 years old, happily married and a resident of Ozamis-Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City, Philippines. She earns a living through food vending. She has been a member of PMPC for one year and ten months, and she enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase materials for housing. Lolita deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase materials for housing.

location.town: Ozamis-Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en: Zaldy, a father of two, operates a service-based business providing transportation in his community to make a living. The main source of his family's income comes from his transportation services. Zaldy's wife is the one to take care of their children. This young man wants to provide his children a better education. Recently, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover motorcycle maintenance costs. In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle to use it for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been farming rice for 23 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jeanalyn

texts.en:
Jeanalyn is 24 years old and married with one kid. She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines, and she is borrowing 4,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Jeanalyn has been raising ducks for five years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 22 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his three siblings and his parents. Ahmad is currently studying for his Bachelors Degree, majoring in Finance. He is in his third year. He is planning to find a better job after his graduation and to earn a better income in order to support his family. But because of the financial crisis his family has been facing, he wasn't able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Алмакан - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алмакан занимается полеводством, стартовав 31 год назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Имеет очень большой опыт в сельском хозяйстве и благодаря упорному труду Алмакан, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1,50 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алмакан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку семян фасоли для посевных работ, а также удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Алмакан планирует вложить в покупку скотины, Алмакан в будущем намерена заняться также животноводством и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники для дома.
texts.en:
Almakan is 54 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising three children.  Almakan has a secondary education and is involved in agriculture, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business 31 years ago with an initial capital of 5,000 som (KGS) and she is now an experienced farmer.  Thanks to many years of hard work, she currently owns 1.5 hectare  (3.7 acres) of land on which she grows beans and corn annually, for domestic use as well as for resale.  She makes a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Almakan has turned to the Bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan to buy bean seeds for sowing, and fertilizers to prepare the soil.  She plans to use the earnings from her loan to buy some livestock.  In the future, she would like to expand her activity and get involved in animal husbandry.  She is also planning to save enough money to buy some home appliances.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa Arely

texts.es:
Rosa de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, actualmente está acompañada, su pareja es empleado, tienen dos hijos que viven con ellos y el mayor estudia primer grado y con su compañero son los responsables de mantener a su familia.

Actualmente, es empleada en una oficina jurídica en la que lleva desempeñando el cargo más de un año; para desplazarse a su trabajo lo hace en bus y se tarda 25 minutos y su horario es de 8 a:m a 12 y de 1 a 5 de la tarde.

Necesita el préstamo, para gastos personales específicamente para pagar una operación de vista para su madre, ya que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para pagarla y gracias al crédito se le facilitaran las cosas.

Seguir dándole educación a sus hijos y que su madre ya no tenga problemas visuales.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old and was in school up until high school.  She is married and her husband works.  They have two children who live with them, the oldest of which is in 1st grade.  She and her husband are responsible for taking care of their family.

Currently, she works at a legal office and has been there for more than a year.  It takes 25 minutes for her to get to work by taking the bus and she works from 8 am to 12 noon and then 1 pm to 5 pm.

She is in need of this loan due to personal expenses, specifically so she can pay for her mother's eye surgery.  She doesn't have the money to pay for it and is thankful that this loan will be able to help.

She hopes that she will continue to be able to put her children through school and also that her mother will be able to overcome her vision problems.

loans.use: pay for her mother's eye surgery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods for his repair shop and another computer so he can obtain greater profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Iroda

texts.ru: Эту молодую швею зовут Ирода. Ей 21 год. Она еще не замужем и живет с родителями в городе Турсунзаде. Ирода после окончания школы получила среднее специальное образование и начала свое швейное дело. Уже 4 года как она занимается данной деятельностью и помогает родителям обеспечивать семью.Ирода целеустремленная девушка. Она хочет расширить свое дело и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. Ирода на сумму кредита собирается купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, чтобы принимать больше заказов и увеличить доходность своего дела.
texts.en:
This young seamstress is named Iroda.  She is 21 years old, not yet married, and lives with her parents in the city of Tursun-zoda.  After graduating from middle school, she got her high school education and started her own sewing business.  She has already been in this line of work for four years and helps her parents provide for their family.  

Iroda is a goal oriented young woman.  She wants to expand her business and it was with this goal that she applied for a loan.  Iroda is planning to use the loan to buy a new, modern sewing machine so that she will be able to take more orders and improve the profitability of her business.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine in order to develop her sewing business

loans.name: Kimiyakan

texts.ru: Кимиякан 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей, двое детей находятся на заработках в России, поддерживают родителей материально. У Кимиякан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кимиякан занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кимиякан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 25 овец, 3 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кимиякан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кимиякан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Kimiyakan is 54 years old and married.  She and her husband have three children, two of whom are currently working in Russia as migrant workers and helping their parents financially.  Kimiyakan has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business 14 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to years of hard work, she now owns 25 sheep and three goats.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and she is taking a loan to buy some sheep and increase her livestock headcount.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 46 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marcelina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marcelina has been farming rice for 20 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura is 24 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Manzura graduated school in 2008, and she organized her own business in animal husbandry to earn money. Later, she entered the Tajikistan Technology University. Manzura studies correspondence, and she is one of the successful students. She is also a hardworking business lady. Manzura does not have enough money to pay her tuition, so she is asking for a loan to pay tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and cows.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six group leader farmers in Chwele District with Alice selected as the Kiva representative. Alice has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 79 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Alice is married and has eight children. She is 60 years old and is known as hardworking. She is active in her community in groups such as the prayer group. Alice has been a farmer for 37 years. Alice described her harvest as good last year but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Alice first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Alice joined One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member. Alice plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Alice’s own life improved because she was able to save money.

Alice and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Bibicha

texts.ru: Бибича жительница района А.Джоми. Ей 59 лет. Она замужем за Кароматулло. Кароматулло пенсионер. Бибича считает, что ни что не поздно начать и хочет открыть свой бизнес в сфере торговли фруктов и овощей. Бибича насчитанная женщина она нашла лавку для торговли. Бибича собирается закупать фрукты от рынка Фаровон города Душанбе и перепродавать на рынке родного района. Бибича верит, что она сможет начать бизнес и далее ее продвигать. Но у нее не хватает немного средств, чтобы купить первый товар, по этой причине она просит кредит, с надеждой на то, что ей помогут. Она нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en:
Bibicha is a resident of the A. Jomi region.  She is 59 years old.  She is married to a man named Karomatullo.  He is retired.  Bibicha thinks that it's never to late to open her own business in selling fruits and vegetables.  Bibicha is a very purposeful woman and she has found a place for her store.  She is preparing to buy up fruits at the Farovan bazaar in Dushanbe and resell them at her local market.

Bibicha believes that she will be able to start her business and keep it moving forward.  However, she doesn't have the means to buy her first inventory, and so she is requesting a loan with the hopes that people will help her.  She needs this support.

loans.use: to buy an inventory in order to start a fruit sales business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more beverages for her refreshment shop.

loans.name: Nuriat

texts.en: Nuriat is a hardworking married woman with six children who used her previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She is a farmer who grows maize and tomatoes. She also has cows where she gets milk to sell to supplement her income. She is determined to educate her children to a level of self-dependency but is limited by inadequate capital and weather changes that reduce her profit margin. Nuriat intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Vit

texts.en:
Vit, age 25, lives in Trapeang Tuem village with her spouse. She doesn’t have any children yet, but she plans to have one soon. Vit is involved in agriculture cultivating rice and various types of crops to sell in the local markets. She also works as a day laborer to supplement her income for her family. From her current businesses, she is able to generate approximately USD 4 per day.

As of now, Vit needs financial support in order to improve the water and sanitation for her entire household. She realizes that all these play an important role for healthy living conditions. The loan will be used to build a hygienic latrine. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Vit is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: Fifteen years ago, a hardworking woman by the name of Mutabar began her business by growing agriculture products with the aim of earning an income. She always wanted to provide her children with good living conditions and a higher education. Mutabar, for 15 years, has been running her business well. She grows potatoes, wheat and carrots. Mutabar likes to work in her land. She also has an animal husbandry business. She earns a living in this way and gives a good education to her son and daughter. She is going to make a sowing for the new season but she does not have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. She awaits your support and, in advance, thanks you for your help.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Ron

texts.en:
Ron is a 32-year-old villager and a married father of two who lives in a rural area of Siem Reap province. Being the breadwinner of his family, Ron has been involved in agriculture, especially farming rice and raising pigs. He also works as a paid laborer for additional income. His wife helps him earn income by selling a variety of grocery products from their home.

Ron would like to improve his living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen less smoke from wood or charcoal. He is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate different from its general loans. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a kind-hearted woman. She was born in 1967. She is married and has four children. Two of them are non-adults, and two of them are adults. Sakina lives with her husband and children in a rural area. She is a hardworking woman. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 27 years. She has great experience, and she works with pleasure. 

Sakina’s sons work in Russia. They are going to be married. Sakina is going to repair her house for her sons' return. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy building materials for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace gives thanks for the help of her Kiva loans. She has developed herself since she got the previous loan. Now, she comes to you asking for a new loan of KSh 20,000 to buy chairs and tables for her business.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu gives thanks for the support from Kiva and Yehu. She appreciates the assistance. Now she comes to you requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more mangoes, passion fruit and oranges to make juice to sell.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, passion fruit and oranges

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki appreciates the Kiva loan that helped her to purchase cosmetic products for her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy shampoo, treatments, body lotions and creams to sell to get more income.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, treatments, body lotions and creams to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, vita, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives in Yeghvard with his 20-year-old daughter. He is a farmer with many years of experience of running a farm. He keeps livestock of 15 oxen, 3 cows and 85 calves. Karen works hard to run his farm in a sustainable way and to earn income for his daughter's living.
 
Karen has now requested this loan to be able to purchase a calf and forage for feeding his livestock. The loan will be a huge support for this hard working farmer, and will help him to increase the livestock and improve his living conditions.

As this is Karen's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding his livestock

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos 47 años de edad, es gricultor de toda la vida, por desgracia sus padres no pudieron ayudarle para que estudiara, ya que pasaban por muchas necesidad, sumado a esto; que la escuela más cercana estaba a más de tres kilómetros de su casa, lo que complico más su situación. Hoy está casado, su esposa se encarga de realizar los oficios del hogar, tienen cinco hijos de los cuales, dos terminaron la educación media, y dos más están estudiando.
 Carlos desde la edad de catorce años, inicio a trabajar junto con su padre y sus hermanos, en la agricultura, ahí aprendió todo lo nesesario para el cultivos de maíz y frijol, las cuales hasta hoy en día continua practicando, gracias a que su padre, lo formo para que fuera una persona honesta y responsable. A los veinte años decidió acompañarse, con la que hoy en día es su esposa, y con la que ha procreado cinco hijos. Con quienes siembran 28,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol, ya que de esta actividad aseguran los ingresos del próximo año, gracias a la producción que resulta al final de cada ciclo de cada cultivo. Su jornada de trabajo inicia a las 5:00 A.M todos los días.
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos bueyes, con los cuales piensa iniciar a trabajar este año, para preparar los 28,000 metros cuadrados que produce cultiva cada año. Y a la vez tendrá otra fuente de ingreso, ya que podrá, trabajarles a otros agricultores de la zona.
El sueño de Carlos y su esposa, es poner  una pequeña tienda en su casa, y así no depender directamente solo de la agricultura, además como todo padre tenía la intención de ayudarles a sus hijos, para que estudiaran en educación superior, lastimosamente los ingresos no han sido los suficientes, pero tiene la fe que muy pronto si la producción en este año, es buena el próximo año podrá a estudiar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 47 years old and has worked in agriculture all his life. His parents unfortunately couldn't help him so that he could study, since they had a lot of needs, and on top of that, the closest school was more than three kilometers from his house, which made the situation even more difficult.Today he is married, and his wife takes charge of doing the household work. They have five children, of which two have finished high school and two more are still in school. 

Carlos began working in agriculture at the age of 14 alongside his father and brothers. He learned everything about growing corn and beans, which he continues to do, thanks to his father, who taught him to be a honest and responsible person. At the age of 20 he decided to get married, to the woman who is now his wife and with whom he has five children. They sow together 28,000 square meters of corn and beans, and this work ensures their income for the following year, thanks to the produce that results at the end of each growing period. His workday begins at 5:00 AM every day. 

The loan will be used to buy two oxen, with which he plans to begin working this year, to prepare the 28,000 square meters that produce his crop every year. And he will also have a new source of income, since he will be able to hire them out to other farmers in the area. 

Carlos and his wife dream of starting a little store out of their house. That way they wouldn't be directly dependent only on agriculture. Also, like all parents, he had the intention of helping his children to study higher education, but unfortunately their income has not been enough. He has faith that soon, if this year's yield is good, the following year he can send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy two oxen

loans.name: Sandra Elisa

texts.es:
Sandra de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, dejó la escuela porque se casó, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, tiene 4 hijos, uno ya está casado y los otros 3 estudian en la escuela, y nadie mas vive con ellos. 

 Sandra trabaja como cocinera en una iglesia donde atiende a niños, que asisten a reforzar sus conocimientos educativos, tiene 2 años de desempeñar este trabajo. pero desde que tenía 11 años se dedica a vender frutas, tamales, ropa, ya que tenía 7 años cuando murió su padre y su madre, la mandaba a vender para sacar adelante a sus hermanos, y vendía en los caseríos vecinos. Su trabajo está a 30 minutos de su casa por lo que tiene que caminar para llegar a este, ella comienza sus labores a las 8:00 AM y termina a las 5:00 PM y ningún familiar se involucra en su trabajo. 

El crédito que esta solicitando es para mejorar la vivienda , ya que su familia va creciendo y necesita una habitacion mas, con este comprará 800 ladrillos, 20 bolsas de cemento, 3 quintales de hierro, arena y piedra.

Sandra sueña en  preparar a sus hijos en una carrera universitaria, comprar un terreno y dejarles un espacio para cada uno de sus hijos, el préstamo ayudará en poder construir la habitacion que necesita, además sueña con pagar su crédito puntualmente.
texts.en: Sandra is 39 years old, went to school until the seventh grade, and left school because she got married. Her husband is a mason and she has 4 children. One of her children is already married and the other three are in school, and she only lives with them. Sandra works as a cook in a church that serves children who come to reinforce their academic learning. She's worked in this job for two years. However she's been selling fruit, tamales, and clothes since she was 11 years old because she was 7 when her father passed away and her mother sent her to sell to support her siblings, and so she sold at nearby houses. Her job is 30 minutes away from her house so she has to walk to get there, and she begins work at 8:00 AM and finishes at 5:00 PM. None of her family members is involved in her work. The loan she's requesting is to improve her house, since her family is growing and needs one more room. With this loan she will purchase 800 bricks, 20 bags of cement, 3 hundredweights of iron, sand, and rocks. Sandra dreams of preparing her children with a university degree and purchasing a plot of land to leave a space for each of her children. The loan will help her build the room she needs and she dreams of paying her loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase 800 bricks, 20 bags of cement, 3 hundredweights of iron, sand, and rocks

loans.name: Bobo

texts.en:
Bobo is a kind man from a rural area, and he and his wife have 3 children. The only source of his family income is from farming, and he grows mainly carrot, potatoes and wheat. His lovely wife helps him with growing vegetables. Bobo has a lot of experience in this field because as a child he helped his parents to grow vegetables. He has additional income from animal husbandry. His family didn't have a lot of money and that’s why he didn’t continue his education in any university.  

Last season he didn’t get a good harvest and income, so now he needs your support. His son is going to Korea to find a job, and Bobo is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy an air ticket for his son to Korea. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for his son to Korea

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.en: Muhiddin is a hardworking man. He was born in 1964 in a village which is located in the north part of Tajikistan. He is married and has a daughter. His parents died when he was young, so his uncle raised him. Muhiddin lives with his wife, daughter, and uncle. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. He has great experience and skills. He feeds cows and sells milk and kefir to local people of his village. He is going to increase the number of his cows. He is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy cows. This loan will help him to increase business and maximize profit. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood to repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off the loan he currently has with CrediCampo and to pay for an unexpected expense related to the motorcycle accident he had

loans.name: Iris Carolina

texts.es:
Iris de 35 años de edad, es una persona muy conocida en la zona, es profesora. Está casada y tiene una hija que tiene de edad 2 años, su esposo posee un negocio de venta y reparación de celulares y a la ves él está a punto de graduarse de ingeniero civil. 
 Es una familia muy unida, trabajadora, ellos participan en los eventos de la iglesia del lugar donde viven.

Ella trabaja en una escuela cerca del pueblo desde hace 4 años, como maestra es muy respetable con los alumnos de su clase y con los demás de la escuela y con sus compañeros de trabajo.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar un crédito que adquirió con un familiar, este dinero que presto era para mejorar la casa comprando las ventanas y unos acabados y afinados de las puertas. 
Ella menciona que en el futuro, seguirá trabajando con la institución para optar por otro crédito, ya que todavía hacen falta algunos detalles a la casa, para terminarla como ella quiere.
texts.en:
35-year-old Iris is very well known in the area. She is a teacher. She is married and has a two-year-old daughter. Her husband owns a business which sells and repairs mobile phones, and he is also about to graduate from a civil engineering degree.

Their family is very close-knit and hard-working. They participate in local church events.

She has worked in a school near the village for four years as a teacher. She is well respected by her students, other pupils at the school, and her work colleagues.
