The loan she is requesting is for paying off a loan from a family member. The money she borrowed was for improving her house by purchasing windows, some door finishes, and door polish.

She says that in the future she will continue working with the institution to get another loan in order to finish her house the way she wants, since there are still some details missing.

loans.use: to pay off a loan from a relative

loans.name: Luís Alexander

texts.es:
Luis de 31 años de edad, es una persona que su nivel académico llego hasta el bachillerato, motivo por el cual sus padre no podían sostenerle sus estudios y él decidió que trabajaría para ayudar a sus padre;  comenzó trabajando en una comercial durante 4 años, luego se salió y hoy tiene un empleo que tiene de estar trabajando como despachador de combustible 8 años. 

Se acompañó y tuvo un hijo que hoy en día tiene 12 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando.
Su esposa trabaja en la tortilleria que está situada en su casa, también por encargo vende en el mercado; son una familia muy unida y trabajadora a la vés conocida por toda la comunidad donde vive.    
La esposa del señor se ha dedicado a la venta de tortilla, porque no conseguía trabajo y comenzó a conseguir dinero prestado hasta que llego un día y logro de hacerse de su propio negocio.
Cuando vende tortilla en el mercado, ella tiene que trasladare de una distancia de 2 km ½ para poder vender. Ella vende desde la 9:00 hasta las 12:00 de medio día, y luego se retira para su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos quintales de maíz, un chimbo de gas, pagar una pequeña deuda y por ultimo comprar algunos materiales que ocupa su hijo en la escuela.
Menciona que tiene metas cortas y metas largas, unas de las metas corta es que su hijo pueda terminar sus estudios, y la meta larga es poder tener mejor su casa , para que su familia se sienta bien.
texts.en:
31-year-old Luis completed high school. His parents could not support his studies and he decided that he would work to help his parents. He began by working in retail for four years, and then he left and now he has had a job working as a gas station attendant for eight years.

He found a partner and they had a son, who is now twelve years old and studying. His wife works in a tortilla factory located in their house and also sells her products in the market. They are a close-knit and hard-working family, who are well-known by the entire community.

The wife makes a living by selling tortillas, because she could not find work and she started to borrow money until one day she managed to set up her own business.

When she sells tortillas at the market, she has to travel two and a half kilometres. She sells her products from 9:00am until noon, and then she goes home. 

The loan Luis is requesting is for purchasing two quintals of corn and a gas cylinder, paying off a small debt, and purchasing some school supplies. 

He says that he has short-term and long-term goals. One of his short-term goals is for his son to be able to finish his studies, and his long-term goal is to be able to improve his house so that his family can be in good health.

loans.use: to purchase two quintals of corn and a gas cylinder, pay off a small debt, and purchase some school supplies

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea de 47 años de edad, se dedica a la prestación de servicios como promotora de salud en su comunidad.
Ella se creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban arduamente a la agricultura y ganadería su familia era formada por 3 hermanos quienes ayudaban en las tareas agrícolas de su hogar, mientras que ella con su madre se dedicaban a los oficios domésticos, y por las tardes se dedicaba a estudiar en el centro escolar de su comunidad.

Luego realizo sus estudios de educación media a la edad de 24 años. Su compañero de vida, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, son padres de 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, luego ella aplico para un trabajo en la unidad de salud ya que existía una oportunidad laboral  y satisfactoriamente el trabajo se le fue otorgado y realizando esta actividad en su comunidad lleva 6 años.  Además, dedica su tiempo libre a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar, mientras que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y cuenta con una experiencia de 35 años realizando esta actividad productiva, que le ha servido para dar el sustento diario a su familia.


El préstamo será invertido, para comprar un cerdo y una vaca,  ya que su esposo cuentan con la experiencia en el cuido de estos, y tienen suficiente comida para alimentar estos dos animales,  los cuales a un futuro llevan a cabo su ciclo de reproducción y podrán aumentar su producción económica mediante la venta de cerdos y lácteos producido por el ganado y su familia podrá tener una mejor nutrición.

 
Los sueños que la señora tiene, para un futuro son los de tener más ganado de ordeño en un corral  y una granja de cerdos, lo va  a lograr con ayuda de otro crédito y su esposo y el involucramiento de sus hijos y las ganancias de este las utilizara para dar les lo mejor y apoyar los en sus  estudios hasta que puedan graduarse como unos profesionales de éxito en el ramo de la salud.
texts.en:
Andrea, 47, works as a healthcare promoter in her community. She was raised by her parents, who worked hard in agriculture. She has three brothers who worked in the fields, while she and her mother took care of the household chores. She went to school in the evenings. When she became 24, she took some additional courses at the intermediate level.

Her life partner works in agriculture. They have three children who go to the community school. Andrea applied for a job at the local healthcare center and fortunately got it. She has been working there for six years. During her free time, she takes care of the household chores, while her husband works in agriculture. He has been doing this for thirty-five years and this is how he has been able to provide for his family.

Andrea will use this loan to buy a pig and a cow. Her husband has good experience with farm animals and they have enough feed to keep them in good shape. In the future, they will hopefully reproduce and help them increase their income by selling the piglets and the dairy products. At the same time, the family will have access to good-quality food.

Andrea’s dreams are to have more milk cows, a pen and a pig farm. She will achieve her goals with an additional loan, and the help from her husband and children. With the profits, she will support them with their studies so that they can become Healthcare professionals.

loans.use: to buy a pig and a cow.

loans.name: Analene

texts.en: Analene  is a 44 year old married woman who lives in Misamis Occidental with her family.  Her husband is a farmer and she helps him by raising pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for three years, earning more income to supplement her husband's income.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional piglets.  She plans to expand her piggery in order to generate more income for a better  future of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 37year old single Ugandan woman with four children living in Fort Portal.  She has been hardworking business woman, operating a retail shop and a bar since 2004 to fight poverty and she also earns money from farming.  She hopes to construct a permanent house on her plot despite being challenged by customers who don't pay her on time.  Agnes is intending to use the loan to buy more stock  for her shop to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cartons of fashion slippers.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman was born in 1979.  She is married and a mother of 3.  Eman has been running her mini market for 2 years.  Her husband has a restaurant.  She started her project after she noticed the financial crisis her husband has been facing.  So she decided to support him in covering their children's needs. 

Now she needs to restock the merchandise her mini market with new food products as it is now out of products.  But she doesn't have enough money to do so.  For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to restock the merchandise in her mini market with new food products

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Sandra de 36 años de edad estudió hasta séptimo grado, dejó la escuela porque se casó, su esposo es albañil tiene 4 hijos, uno ya está casado y los otros 3 estudian en la escuela, y nadie mas vive con ellos. 

Sandra trabaja como cocinera en una iglesia donde atiende a niños que asisten a reforzar sus conocimientos educativos tiene 2 años, de desempeñar este trabajo pero desde que tenía 11 años se dedica a vender frutas, tamales, ropa, tenía 7 años cuando murió su padre y su madre la mandaba a vender para sacar adelante a sus hermanos, y vendía en los caseríos vecinos. Su trabajo está a 30 minutos de su casa por lo que tiene que caminar para llegar a este, ella comienza sus labores a las 8:00 AM y termina a las 5:00 PM y ningún familiar se involucra en su trabajo. 

El crédito será invertido para mejorar la vivienda por que la  familia es mas grande y necesita una habitacion mas, con este comprará 800 ladrillos, 20 bolsas de cemento, 3 quintales de hierro, arena y piedra.

Sandra sueña en preparar a sus hijos en una carrera universitaria, comprar un solar y dejarles un espacio para cada uno de sus hijos, el préstamo ayudará en poder construir la habitacion que necesita, además sueña con pagar su crédito puntualmente.
texts.en:
Sandra is 36 years old. She went to school through the seventh grade and left school because she got married. Her husband is a bricklayer and she has 4 children. One is already married and the other 3 are in school. Nobody else lives with them. 

Sandra works as a cook in a church. She serves children that go there to reinforce their education. She has been doing this job for 2 years, but since she was 11 she has worked selling fruit, tamales, and clothes. She was 7 when her father died and her mother would send her out to sell to get her siblings ahead. She would sell in the nearby communities. Her job is 20 minutes from her house and she has to walk there. She starts work at 8:00 AM and finishes at 5:00 PM and no family member is involved in her work.  

The loan will be invested in home improvement because the family is bigger and needs another room. She will buy 800 bricks, 20 bags of cement, and 3 quintals of iron, sand and stone.

Sandra dreams of her children getting a college education, and of buying some land and leaving some to each of her children. The loan will help her be able to build the room she needs. She also aspires to paying her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy 800 bricks, 20 bags of cement, and 3 quintals of iron, sand and stone.

loans.name: Andres De Jesús

texts.es:
Andres de 67 años de edad no tiene ningun grado de estudio, ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos economicos y eran de la idea que el estudio no servia para nada lo unico que ayuda es el trabajo. Él esta casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa, ya todos sus hijos estan acompañados por lo que la unica persona que depende de él es su esposa.

Actualmente se dedica a sembrar maiz y frijol y lo ha hecho desde que era niño, porque su padre lo andaba en el campo para que él aprendiera el oficio, tiene que trasladarse de un canton al otro aproximadamente tiene que recorrer cerca de 3 kilometros para llegar hasta la milpa, ademas de eso es pastor evangelico y tiene 19 años de estar dirigiendo una iglesia. Se levanta muy temprano para ir a trabajar en la milpa y luego de la 2:30PM hasta las 6:00PM esta en la iglesia junto a su esposa.

El préstamo será invertido en hacer un nuevo edificio de la iglesia, ya que por el momento donde funciona la iglesia la casa es de adobe y ademas es muy pequeña y cada dia va aumentando  numero de personas que la visitan, tambien cabe recalcar que no es muy segura por que ya tiene varios años de que la construyeron 

Sus sueños, son tener una mejor vivienda de la que ahora tiene y poder tener un vehículo para trasladarse a la iglesia con su esposa, porque los dos son personas de abansada edad, ademas sueña con ver terminado el edificio de la iglesia que es la mejor herencia que puede dejar a sus hermanos en Cristo.
texts.en:
Andres is 67 years old. He has no education, because his parents were of low income and they had the idea that education wasn't useful for anything and the only useful thing is work. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. All of his children are married so his only dependent is his wife.

Right now, he grows corn and beans. He has done this since he was a child because his father would have him in the fields so that he would learn the trade. He has to go from one canton to another and has to travel approximately 3 kilometers to get to the cornfield. In addition, he is an evangelical pastor  and has been leading a church for 19 years. He gets up very early to go to work in the cornfield and later from 2:30 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. he is at the church with his wife. 

The loan will be invested in making a new church building. The place where the church is now is made from adobe and it is also very small. Every day more people visit. It is also work noting that it isn't very safe because it was built several years ago.  

His dreams are to have a better house than the one he has now and to be able to have a vehicle to go to church in with his wife, because they are both elderly. He also dreams of finishing the church building, which is the best inheritance he can leave his brothers in Christ.

loans.use: to buy a new church building.

loans.name: Siguitemason Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUITEMASON est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TINGOLE, commune de TINGOLE préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, et de charbon. Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASON sont à leurs troisièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente NENE la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter 50 kg de riz, et des condiments chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte et en espèce dans son mini restaurant au bord du goudron. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 12 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Siguitemason group is made up of married women with an average age of 46 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tingole, Tingole commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell prepared food, condiments and charcoal. The women of the Siguitemason group are on their 3rd group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their high customer demand.

Nene, the women standing on the left, did not go to school. She now runs a restaurant. She is planning to buy 50 kilos of rice and some condiments from the wholesalers at the weekly market. She makes her sales for cash to a varied clientèle in her mini-restaurant located on the roadside. She expects to make a monthly profit of 12 000 francs which will be used to cover the children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado en la escuela, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como frijol y maíz, tienen tres hijos de los cuales uno trabaja en la ciudad, uno que no estudia y ayuda a su padre en los trabajos del campo y la última que estudia  octavo grado. En su hogar solo vive su esposo y sus hijos.


Manifiesta que con el financiamiento, pagara la elaboración de una  puerta para su casa. Con ello su casa tendrá una mejor presentación, vivirá más segura con sus hijos.

Lucia tiene como sueño hacer una fosa séptica, tener su servicio sanitario bien formal para evitar problemas de salud para su familia y sus vecinos, por otra parte pretende ampliar su casa. Agregándole un corredor en la parte posterior para tener más espacio.
texts.en:
Lucia is 54 years old and completed only first grade at school. She is married; her husband works sowing basic grains such as beans and corn. Lucia has three children. One works in the city; one is not studying but helped his father with his work in the field; and the youngest is in eighth grade. Lucia lives with her husband and children.

Lucia tells us that, with this loan, she will pay for a door to be made for her house. With this door, the house will look better and Lucia can live more securely with her children.

Lucia's dream is to install a septic tank and have a good sanitation system so that her family and neighbours will not have health problems. Lucia also wants to put an extension on her house, adding a hall at the back to have more space.

loans.use: to pay to have a door made for her house.

loans.name: Wilikoumado Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WILIKOUMADO est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TINGOLE, commune de TINGOLE préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, de tubercule, de charbon, et de jarre. Les femmes du groupe WILIKOUMADO sont à leurs deuxièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente MAH la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche n’a pas été à l’école, après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenues sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de jarre.  Elle compte acheter 20 jarres chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait chez elle et au marché du village en espèce a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20 000FCFA par mois, qui sera en partie injectés dans l’élevage de chèvre et le reste pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Wilikoumado group is made up of married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tingole, Tingole commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell prepared food, condiments, tubers, charcoal and jars. The women of the Wilikoumado group are on their 2nd group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their high customer demand.

Mah, the women standing second from the left, did not go to school. Having tried her hand at several revenue-generating activities without success, she now sells jars. She is planning to buy 20 jars from the wholesalers at the weekly market. She makes her sales from her home and at the village market for cash to a varied clientèle. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20 000 francs, part of which will be used for her goat-breeding business and the rest to cover the children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy jugs.

loans.name: Genaro Antonio

texts.es:
Genaro de 60 años de edad se graduo de bachiller contador, esta soltero y vive junto a su papa,  ya que su madre murio hace un año. El trabaja para la alimentacion de su padre, ya que este no puede trabajar por su edad y las nulas oportunidades de empleo.

Genaro tiene 2 años de estar dedicado a vender frutas, verduras y recargas telefonicas, ya que antes estuvo empleado en un turicentro, pero por la enfermedad de su madre dejo de trabajar, para cuidarla y  cuando su madre fallecio ya no pudo encontrar trabajo, todos los dias carga su carreta con la venta,y se ubica en la plaza de la comunidad durante todo el dia para atender a sus clientes.


El prestamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para aumentar los inventarios de su negocio de frutas y verduras, lo que vendra a favorecer a sus clientes, para tenerlos satisfechos y ofrecerles mayor variedad de productos, y asi tambien  sus ingresos se veran incrementados.para asegurar su subsistencia y la de su papá. 
Genaro planea trabajar muy duro, para crecer con su negocio y comenzar a instalar una tienda, para atender otras necesidades de sus clientes, y superarse para tener una vida mas comoda.
texts.en:
Genaro is 60 years old and completed high school. He is single and lives with just his father, as his mother died a year ago. Genaro works in order to feed his father, who cannot work due to his age and the lack of job opportunities.

Genaro has been selling fruits, vegetables and phone top-ups for two years. He used to work in a park but, because of his mother's illness, he left this job to look after her. When his mother died, Genaro was unable to find work. Every day he takes his cart out and sets up stall on the community square. He works there all day, tending to his customers.

This loan from "CrediCampo" will be used to increase stock at Genaro's fruit and vegetable business. This will be good for his customers, as they will be satisfied and he can offer them a greater variety of stock. His income will also increase and support Genaro and his father.

Genaro plans to work very hard in order to expand his business and to begin setting up a shop so that he can look after his customers' other needs. He can then do better and live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to increase stock at his fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’DINKORO, commune de KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de poisson fumé, d’oignon, de the et de la galette. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente BINTA la première personne à partir de la droite n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de poisson fumé. Elle compte acheter 2 cartons de poisson fumé chez les grossistes à Konobougou. La vente se fait en en détaille et en espèce chez elle a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of N'Dinkoro, Kerela commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell smoked fish, onions, tea and flans ("galettes"). The women of the Benkadi group are on their 2nd group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their high customer demand.

Binta, the women standing on the far right, did not get an education. She now sells smoked fish. She is planning to buy 2 boxes of smoked fish from the wholesalers in Konobougou. She makes her sales from her home, for cash, to a varied retail clientèle. She expects to make a monthly profit of 25 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is a 52-year-old married woman and a resident from the Prey Chhor district of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of seven children, two of whom are employed and the remaining children help An in her farming business. For the past 30 years, An has been working on her land as a farmer. She grows rice and sells in local markets.

An is borrowing a loan in the amount of $350 to be used to buy goldsmith tools for her son who currently works in this occupation and is in need of materials to sustain his business. An is very thankful to all lenders for their loan support and hopes that this loan will better their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy goldsmith tools for her son.

loans.name: Edoe

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris l’électronique, après sa formation il a ouvert sa propre boutique où il fait la réparation d’appareils électroniques et la vente d’antennes paraboliques, beaucoup de gens lui font confiance à cause de la qualité de ses services. En ce moment il a besoin de quelques matériaux pour son commerce, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour pouvoir acheter des accessoires et des antennes paraboliques.
Il est marié et père de famille.
texts.en: Edoe trained in electronics and, after his education, opened his own shop where he carries out repairs of electronic equipment and sells satellite dishes. Many people trust him because of the quality of his services. He is currently in need of a few items for his business and is therefore asking WAGES for a loan so that he can buy accessories and satellite dishes. He is married and a father.

loans.use: to buy electronic accessories and satellite dishes.

loans.name: Mirna Yamileth

texts.es:
Mirna de 26 años de edad, estudio segundo año de bachillerato general, es acompañada, su esposo trabaja en el cuerpo de agentes metropolitanos ( CAM , tienen 2 hijos de los cuales el primero tiene 7 años y estudia tercer grado y en segundo que tiene tres años que aún no estudia. Con ellos solo viven sus hijos.

Mirna solo tiene una pensión de red solidaria como ingreso, por otra parte su esposo que le proporciona dinero también para los gastos del hogar. Anteriormente, trabaja como doméstica en la ciudad ahí trabajo 3 años.


  El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar madera para construir su casa, 12 cuartones, 6 libras de clavos, 500 varas para sostener la teja y 300 tejas porque están ampliando más la vivienda. El financiamiento ayudara a tener más protección, más seguridad, será satisfecha la necesidad de pagar mano de obra que le ayuden a construir rápidamente su vivienda y no estar en la interperie expuestos al frio, al sol o cualquier u otro peligro.

Su sueño es salir a trabajar, con las ganancias  de su trabajo, poder construir una casa más adecuada que la que hoy están construyendo. Ayudar a sus hijos a que se formen académicamente, inducirlos por el mejor camino y que sean exitosos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mirna is 26 years old. She is in her second year of a general bachelor degree. She is married and her husband works in the Metropolitan Agents Corp (C.A.M, in Spanish). They have 2 children. The oldest is 7 and in third grade. The second one is three and not in school yet. They live alone with their children. 

Mirna only has a Solidarity Network pension for income. Her husband also provides money for the home. Previously, she worked as a maid in the city for three years.

The loan she is asking for is to buy wood to do construction on her house. She will buy 12 wooden beams, 6 pounds of nails, 500 rods to support the roof and 300 tiles because she is adding on to her home. The loan will help her to have more protection and more security. She will be able to pay for the labor costs to help her build quickly and not be exposed to the cold, the sun or any other danger.  

Her dream is to go out and work and with her earnings be able to build a better house than the one she is building now, as well as help her children be educated and put them on the right road to be successful in the future.

loans.use: para comprar 12 wooden beams, 6 pounds of nails, 500 rods to support the roof and 300 tiles, as well as to pay for labor, because she is adding on to her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de SINIKADJAN, commune de KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de céréale, de savon, de chaussure, d’ustensile et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente AMI  la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assis n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’ustensiles en plastiques. Elle compte acheter 10  seaux d’eau et 6 grosses tasses en plastiques avec son argent chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, à une clientèle mixte chez elle et parfois ambulante. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 11 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera injectés dans l’élevage de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women with an average age of 36 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Sinikadjan, Kerela commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell products including cereals, soaps, shoes and utensils. The women of the Benkadi group are on their 1st group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their high customer demand.

Ami, the women sitting second from the left, did not get an education. She now sells plastic utensils. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 buckets and 6 large containers from the wholesalers at the weekly market. She makes her sales from her home and occasionally on the streets to a varied retail clientèle for cash. She expects to make a monthly profit of 11 000 francs which will be invested in her business raising small ruminants.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en: Ameera was born in 1962. She is a married mother of seven children. Her husband has retired from the military. Ameera has been running her mini market for the past four years. She started her project after she noticed the financial crisis her husband has been facing. So she decided to support him in covering their children's needs. Now she needs to buy merchandise for her mini market as it is now out of products. Btu she doesn't have enough money to restock it. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her mini market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions and small plastic bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Venny

texts.en:
Venny is 50 years old and married. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been operating a produce business since 2004. She earns additional income from a dairy and welding.

Venny requested a loan, which she will use to buy maize and cassava to sell.  This loan will enable her to have enough stock despite the challenge of price fluctuations.

loans.use: to purchase maize and dry cassava to sell.

loans.name: Nafan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NAFAN est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de SINIKADJAN, commune de KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de céréale, de condiment, de savon, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe NAFAN sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente KOUDJE la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pâtes alimentaires (macaroni). Elle compte acheter 1 carton et demi de pâte alimentaire avec son argent chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, chez elle. à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 9 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera réinjectés dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group NAFAN is composed of married women, who average 43 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of SINIKADJAN, in Commune de KERELA, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, soap, and general goods. 

The women of the group NAFAN are on their first solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, KOUDJE, who is the first person standing at the right in the photo, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of pasta (macaroni). She intends to purchase with her money 1½ box of pasta from wholesalers at the weekly market. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying cash at her home. She plans on making a profit of 9,000 francs CFA per month that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies

loans.name: Amé

texts.fr: Amé revendeuse de pains depuis 2008 est mère de 03 enfants scolarisés. Elle revend au bord du goudron et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des pains afin de revendre aux clients. Elle espère avec le profit faire développer son activité et assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Amé, a bread vendor since 2008, is a mother of three children, who are in school. She makes her sales at the roadside and is requesting an initial loan to purchase some bread in order to resell to customer. With the profits, she hopes to develop her business and ensure her children are educated.

loans.use: to purchase bread

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta  cuatro grado de nivel académico,  está acompañado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, son padres de dos hijos, uno de ellos está en el instituto el otro está trabajando con él.

Se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 20 años,  que él decidió apartarse y formar su familia  y trabajar mucho en la agricultura pero fue herencia que el papá le dejo porque fue el que le enseño este trabajo;  pero también Wilfredo tiene otra fuente de ingreso en la casa que es un molino, ya que en la zona son pocos molinos y hay una buena cantidad de personas al rededor que iban a moler muy lejos y él decidió ponerlo para que así tuviera ese ingreso la familia el trabajo de la agricultura está a una distancia de 35 minutos.  Él viaja  a pie y lo hace solamente con ayudantes ya que la esposa se queda moliendo en el molino y el hijo se va a estudiar.

Con el préstamo solicitado lo ocupara para sacar los cultivos para prepararlos y llevarlos a la casa. El préstamo le mejorara mucho ya que ahorita no cuenta con lo económico,  para pagar quien le ayude a sacar los cultivos y también pagara maquina quien le desgrane el maíz para tenerlo listo en la casa para el consumo y para sacarlo al  mercado  

Los sueños es seguir cultivando  para que nunca le falte el maíz en su casa y para tener ingresos en la familia y poner su hijo en la universidad también con las ganancias quiere repararle la casa al molino,  para que la gente que la visita no se esté asoleando en el verano y en tiempo de lluvia no se moje
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 45 years old, and has a fourth grade education.  He is married, and his wife is a homemaker.  They are the parents of two children.  One of their children is in school, and the other works with Wilfredo.  He started working in agriculture 20 years ago, when he decided to leave home, start his family and focus on his agricultural work.  He learned how to do this work from his father.  

Wilfredo also has another source of income in his home, which is a mill.  In the region, there are very few mills, and many people had to travel very far to do their grinding.  Seeing this, he decided to open one so that he could have the additional income for his family.  Where he does his agricultural work is about 35 minutes away from his home.  He travels there on foot, and does so only with his helpers as his wife stays at home working the mill, and his son goes to school.  

With the requested loan, he will harvest his crops to prepare them and bring them home.  The loan will help him a lot as he currently does not have the finances to pay people to help him harvest his crops, and to pay for the machinery that shucks the corn so he can have it ready to use at home and to sell in the market.  

His dreams are to be able to continue growing his crops so that he will never be without corn in their house, to have an income for his family, and to be able to put his son in college.  With his earnings, he wants to repair the building where his mill is in so that the people who come to use it can avoid the sun in the summer, and do not get wet during the rainy season.

loans.use: pay for labor to harvest his crops, prepare them and bring them home.

loans.name: Kotognongontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONGONTALA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de SINIKADJAN, commune de KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de sel, de galette, et de gâteaux. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONGONTALA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente ROKIA la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assis n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de sel depuis 2 ans. Elle compte acheter 150 kg de sel et du sachet plastique avec son argent chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce, chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera injectés dans l’élevage de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The group KOTOGNONGONTALA is composed of married women, who average 43 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of SINIKADJAN, in Commune de KERELA, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, salt, galettes, and cakes. 

The women of the group KOTOGNONGONTALA are on their first solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, ROKIA, who is the first person sitting at the left in the photo, is uneducated. A vendor of salt for two years, she intends to purchase with her money 150 kg of salt and some plastic bags from wholesalers at the weekly market. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying cash at her home. She plans on making a profit of 20,000 francs CFA per month that will be invested in raising small ruminants.

loans.use: to purchase salt

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’DINKORO, commune de KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, de potasse, de savon, de gâteau, et de la patte d’arachide. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente FATOUMATA la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de de gâteau. Elle compte acheter 33 kg de farine boulangère, 10 kg de sucre, 10 litres d’huiles, du bicarbonate et des sachets plastiques chez les grossistes à Fana qu’elle  transforme en  gâteaux de très bonne qualité. La vente se fait en en détaille et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 11 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera injecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DJGUISSEME is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of N’DINKORO, in Commune de KERELA, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in catering and do commerce in condiments, potash, soap, cakes, and peanut butter. 

The women of the group DJGUISSEME are on their second solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, FATOUMATA, who is the second person standing at the left in the photo, is uneducated. A vendor of cakes, she intends to purchase with her money 33 kg of baker's flour, 10 kg of sugar, 10 liters of oil, bicarbonate, some plastic bags from wholesalers in Fana. She then will make very good quality cakes. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying cash at her home and sometimes by going door to door. She plans on making a profit of 1,000 francs CFA per month that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making cakes to sell

loans.name: Djguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de SINIKADJAN, commune de KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de pagnes, de charbon, d’habillement, de beurre de karité, de gâteau, et de beignet de haricot. Les femmes du groupe DJGUISSEME sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente KADIATA  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de de pagne. Elle compte acheter 6 puces de pagnes avec son argent chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, à une clientèle mixte chez elle et parfois ambulante. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 23 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera injectés dans l’élevage de chèvres.
texts.en:
The group DJGUISSEME is composed of married women, who average 35 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of SINIKADJAN, in Commune de KERELA, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), charcoal, clothing, shea butter, cakes, beignets, and beans.

The women of the group DJGUISSEME are on their first solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, KADIATA, who is the second person standing at the right in the photo, is uneducated. A vendor of 'pagne' cloth, she intends to purchase with her money 6 inches of the cloth from wholesalers at the weekly market. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying cash at her home and sometimes by going door to door. She plans on making a profit of 23,000 francs CFA per month that will be invested in raising goats.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Varujan

texts.en:
Varujan is married, and has one child. He lives in Vardavank village of Kapan region with his mother, wife, and child. Varujan's wife works at a local library. His mother, with Varujan's help, runs a farm. He keeps 20 chickens, three cows, and five calves. Varujan sells the gathered milk and meat to local wholesalers and earns income for his family's living. 

Varujan requested a loan, which he will use to purchase a cow and forage for the livestock. The loan will allow him to increase his agribusiness and earn more income for his family. Varujan has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, was unable to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that his agribusiness is successful and able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Varujan has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, onions, oil, and peppers.

loans.name: Ana Adela

texts.es:
Ana de 62 años de edad, estudio hasta  sexto grado, es viuda el esposo falleció hace 20 años y le quedaron los 5 hijos a ellas tres varones y dos mujeres , con ella solo viven tres hijos.

Ana se dedica a los oficios domestico y les ayuda a los hijos a la siembra de maíz esto lo hace desde que quedo viuda, decidió dedicarse a la agricultura para enseñarle el trabajo a los hijos  que le quedaron a ella muy pequeños . Hoy ella solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  ya que los hijos no la dejan que ella trabaje porque si ellos están grandes ya ellos van a ayudarle a ella y una de las hijas viajo para estados unidos con mucho sacrificio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla y cerdos para estar entretenida en la casa cuidando los animalitos engordarlos y luego venderlos y obtener ganancias esto mejorara su estilo de vida.
  
Los sueños que tiene,  es siempre seguir adelante ayudándole a sus  hijos en los trabajos y tenerlos en los buenos caminos y que sigan trabajando en la agricultura y que Dios le de vida para estar trabajando
texts.en:
Ana is 62 years old, and has a sixth grade education.  She is a widow, whose husband passed 20 years ago.  She was left with five children, three boys and two girls.  Only three of her children live with her.  Ana is a homemaker, and helps her children growing corn, which she has done since she became a widow.  She decided to work in agriculture as a way of teaching the trade to her children since they were still very young when her husband passed. 

Now, she dedicates herself to housework because her children do not allow her to work because now that they are older, they are helping her and one of her daughters, who sacrificed a lot to travel to the United States.  

The loan that she is seeking will be used to purchase a heifer and pigs, so that she can stay busy by taking care of them, fattening them and later selling them.  Through this, she can make some earnings to improve her living conditions.  Her dreams are to continue helping her children in their work, always keep them on track, to have them continue working in agriculture, and for God to give them life so they can continue to work.

loans.use: purchase a heifer and pigs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert used the previous loan to buy shoes and clothes to sell. A 30-year-old hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda with five children, he went into selling shoes and clothes in 2006, together with banana farming to earn extra income. He hopes expand his business into new markets and educate his children in spite of the high costs of goods. Robert is asking for a loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 50-year-old single hardworking female with children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She does farming for self-employment, and she also earns from a retail shop business. Her vision is to construct a very good house for her family and buy more land for farming, but she is challenged by weather and seasonal changes. Jane intends to use the loan to buy more stock for her shop to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline, 35, is a married Cameroonian with seven children. The oldest is fourteen and in secondary school and the youngest is two years old. She has been in this business for over two years, which makes her experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her turnover by over fifty percent.

loans.use: to buy fowl feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Overflowing Group

texts.en:
This group is called Overflowing, and it consists of three members who live in the same area at Dansoman-Accra. The group are into the sale of porridge, assorted soaps, rice, beans and oil. They are asking for a total loan amount of GHS 2200 from ID-Ghana (Kiva's partner) to improve their businesses.

Rhainatu, a 33-year-old married woman, has three children and has been working selling porridge for ten years now. She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume in order to increase her profit and earn more capital. She has requested a loan to purchase beans, millet and sugar to prepare porridge to sell to her customers. 

Rhainatu hopes to expand her business to live comfortably. Together with her group members, she is very excited and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase beans, millet and sugar to prepare porridge to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina appreciates the support of the Kiva loan she received. She managed to improve her business to a greater level. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy 40 seats for her seat-hiring business. In addition to this, she does a business of selling juice to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy 40 seats for her seat-hiring business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 38 años de edad, vive en El Capulí, es trabajador y responsable en lo que hace, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, 1 niño de 11 años y dos niñas de 3 y 16 años de edad.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizante para cultivar cereales, principalmente cebada, esta actividad la viene realizando ya desde hace más de 12 años atrás y requiere el préstamo para ampliar su producción y venta de la cebada. Su meta a futuro es poder comprar y administrar su propia finca para darles una mejor vida a su esposa y a sus hijos.
texts.en: Carlos is 38 year old man who lives in El Capulí. He is hardworking and responsible in what he does. He lives with his wife and their children. They have one boy who is 11 years old and two girls who are ages 3 and 16. He needs this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant grains - mostly barely. He began this work more than 12 years ago and needs this loan to increase his production and sale of barely. His goal in the future is to be able to buy and administer his own farm to give his wife and children a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and grain seeds such as barely.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es un hombre de 31 años de edad vive en Santa Barbara, Sucumbios, es trabajor y muy responsable, sus principales actividades a que se  dedica son: la agricultura y compra venta de terneros. El necesita el préstamo para adquirir más terneros y luego venderlos,  ya que por el momento la agricultura principalmente la de cultivo de tomate de árbol, cuya demanda ha ido disminuyendo ya no le es rentable, en cambio que en la comercializacion de terneros le genera mayores ganancias y en corto tiempo. Sus metas a futuro es tener siempre terneros para comercializar y mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en: Jorge is a 31-year-old man who lives in Santa Barbara, Sucumbios. He is hardworking and very responsible. He primarily works in agriculture and the sale of calves. He needs this loan to acquire more calves and will later sell them. For the moment, his primary agriculture work is growing tomate de árbol [edible fruit native to Ecuador]. Demand has decreased and it is no longer profitable. On the other hand, the sale of calves has generated more profits and in a short time. His future goals are to always have calves to sell and to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to acquire more calves to sell.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
En un barrio muy popular de San Lorenzo, vive Leonardo, él tiene 30 años de edad y por el momento trabaja en la siembra de palma africana. Su esposa, se encarga de la atención en la tienda que tienen en el barrio 12 de octubre. Leonardo desde muy chico ha sido muy querido por todos quienes lo conocen, por su humildad, y sencillez.
Leonardo está solicitando este préstamo, para comprar una nueva balanza, embutidos, leche, queso, yogurt y otros productos para la tienda.
Leonardo se describe como una persona emprendedora y con ganas de continuar sus estudios.
Dice, que la gente le pide con mucha frecuencia estos productos principalmente para el refrigerio de los niños en las escuelas.
texts.en:
Leonardo lives in the very popular area of San Lorenzo. He is 30 years old and is currently a farmer who cultivates African palms. His wife manages a store that they own in the October 12th neighborhood. From the time he was a boy, Leonardo has been well-liked by everyone who knows him because of his humility and his straightforwardness.

Leonardo is requesting this loan so that he can buy a new scale, cured meats, milk, cheese, yogurt, and other products for his store. He describes himself as an enterprising person who desires to continue his studies. Leonardo says people frequently ask for products that are used mainly to serve as snacks to the children in school.

loans.use: to buy a scale, cured meats, and dairy products.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es una mujer de 23 años de edad, vive en San Gabriel, es alegre y responsable.
Recientemente inicio su negocio de venta de ropa por catálogo, este negocio le resulta rentable ya que hay gran demanda de los productos que ofrece. Ella necesita el préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo y poder ampliar su negocio mediante la adquisición de mercadería, este negocio le ayuda mucho para continuar con sus estudios universitarios. Su meta es terminar los estudios en la Universidad, y debido a que este negocio le ha resultado rentable continuar con él y alcanzar independencia laboral.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 23-year-old woman who lives in San Gabriel. She is cheerful and responsible.

Jessica recently started her business of selling clothes through catalogs. This business has yielded profitable results since there is great demand for the products she offers. She needs this loan so that she can increase her operating capital and expand her business by acquiring merchandise.

This business will be a great help in allowing her to continue her university studies. Her goal is to finish her coursework at the university. Since her business is profitable, Jessica can continue with it and become independent in her work.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spare ribs, fish and meat to increase her sales.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y también realiza trabajos como ayudante de albañil.

Ella tiene experiencia en la crianza de cerdos y engorde de pollo, ella no tiene otro negocio el esposo trabaja en la agricultura siembra de maíz  y frijol.

El crédito será invertido, en la compra de materiales de construcción como son: cerámica, pegamento, separadores y el resto pagara el saldo de otro crédito que  posee. Este préstamo, le ayudara, para terminar de arreglar el corredor y una habitación, ya que con un credito pasado le puso cerámica a la sala, poco a poco va terminando de arreglar su casa.

Su sueño es seguir mejorando la vivienda y trabajar muy fuerte para darles  el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, she is married and has six children.  Her husband works in agriculture, and also does work as a mason's assistant.  She has experience raising pigs and fattening chickens, but does not have any other business.  Her husband works planting corn and beans.  

The loan will be used to purchase construction materials like: tiles, glue, dividers, and the rest will be used to pay off the balance of another loan that she has.  This loan will help her finish fixing the hallway in her home and a bedroom. With a previous loan, she laid tile in the living room, and little by little she has been fixing the house.

Her dream is to continue repairing her home, and working hard to provide her children with educations.

loans.use: purchase tiles, glue, dividers, and to pay off the balance of another loan that she has.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive en Cuyan, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 niños de 9, 7 y 2 años de edad y una niña de 14 años, es muy responsable y amorosa con su familia. Junto con su esposo cuidan de una finca de un colegio de la zona, del cual reciben un sueldo mensual que no les alcanza para sobrellevar los gastos del hogar, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de emprender el negocio de compra y venta de terneros solicitando  anteriormente un préstamo en FODEMI, con el cual adquirió sus primeros terneros para la venta, ahora ella necesita un nuevo préstamo para adquirir más terneros y poder tener mayores ingresos para poder educar de una mejor manera a sus hijos.  Su sueño es poder comprarse una casa y tener estabilidad para su hogar.
texts.en: Elsa is a 33 year old woman who lives in Cuyan. She is married and has 4 children, 3 boys ages 9, 7, and 2, and one 14-year-old girl. She is very responsible and loving with her family. Together with her husband, Elsa cares for a farm in the area. They receive a monthly salary for this, but it does not cover their home expenses. Because of this, Elsa saw the need to start a business buying and selling calves, for which she previously requested a loan with FODEMI. She used the loan to get her first calves to sell. Now Elsa needs a new loan to get more calves and to be able to have greater income to give her children a better education. Elsa's dream is to be able to buy a house and have stability in her home.

loans.use: to buy calves and then sell them.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a Cameroonian aged forty-three, married with five children. The oldest is fifteen and in secondary school while the youngest is four and in primary school. Jean has been in this business for the past twelve years which makes him very experienced, stable, and his business profitable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase his profit by fifty-five percent.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs ( biscuits, groundnut oil, sugar, Maggi cubes, salt, etc.) for resale

loans.name: Jesús Del Rosario

texts.es:
Jesús de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado y está casada, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura, tienen dos hijos menores de edad quienes aún no estudian, ambos son los responsable de mantenerlos. Doña Jesús aprendió el oficio de corte y confección mismo que ahora práctica y es a eso que ella se dedica desde hace siete años, Rosario también sabe hacer trabajos de manualidades y su lugar de trabajo es su casa.

Jesús está solicita un préstamo a la institución, para instalar la energía eléctrica en casa de su madre. 

Jesús  planea seguir por mucho tiempo con el negocio, para que no le falte nada a sus hijos, y que algún día sean gente de bien para la sociedad, el préstamo será de gran beneficio ya que es servicio muy importante hoy en día, su madre estará muy satisfecha con este servicio que se ha vuelto muy útil en la actualidad.
texts.en: Jesus, 25 years old, studied up to seventh grade and is married. Her husband works in agriculture. They have two young children who are not studying yet and are under their care. Jesus learned the activity of seamstress and she has been working in it for seven years. Jesus del Rosario also knows how to make handcrafts and her work space is her home. Jesus is requesting a loan from the institution to install electric power at her mother's house. Jesus plans to continue with her business for a long time so that nothing is lacking to her children, and they can be good people for the good of society. The loan will be very beneficial since this is a very important service nowadays. Her mother will be very satisfied with this service which has become very useful currently.

loans.use: to install electric power

loans.name: Gisa

texts.en:
Gisa, now a father of five, is doing well in his farming business. He has managed to repay his previous loan before the due date. He has managed to cultivate a bigger piece of land owing to the proceeds of the previous season. 

Gisa has been advanced a third loan of Kes 100,000, which he will use to hire machinery for farming, get planting seedlings and other inputs.  

He will use the increased proceeds from the larger piece to diversify in livestock trade as well as pay school fees for his children. He hopes to grow his business to a commercial venture.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and purchase of fertilizer.

loans.name: Eliud's Group

texts.en:
Eliud’s group has eight group leader farmers and is located in Matete District.  The group leaders in this group represent a total of 75 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Eliud  is pictured on the right of the group with his hand raised.
							
Eliud  is married and has eight children.  He is 46 years old and is known as friendly and hardworking.  He is active in his community in groups such as the prayer group.  Eliud  has been a farmer for three years.  Eliud  described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  							
Eliud  first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Eliud  joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader.  As an active community member,  Eliud  plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.
Eliud ’s own life has improved because he has more profits from his harvest and has more farm training.
  							
Eliud  and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Thy Will Group

texts.en:
Maaba is the representative of this group called 'Thy Will'. Her group is located in Dansoman-Accra. She makes her home here in Dansoman with her husband and child. 

The group sells soft drinks, cooking oil, sachets of milk powder, phone call credits, plantain chips, vegetables, fish, meat, kenkey (a specialty made of fermented cooked maize) and cloth. 

Maaba is excited to be taking her first loan from ID-Ghana and hopes they will do business with ID-Ghana for very long time. She has had her business for three years, starting with a little money her husband gave her which she used to buy two crates of soft drinks to sell to customers. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to increase her inventory by purchasing different soft drinks to sell to customers in front of her house. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to provide for her family, thus helping her husband. She wants to own a big drink spot and have all her family together in better conditions. 

The group members will need a total amount of GHS 2300 to buy enough supplies and serve customers better.

loans.use: to purchase different soft drinks to sell in front of her house

loans.name: George's Group

texts.en:
George is a member of this group in Busia District.  He is pictured here in a group of 8 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 81 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  George has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

George is married and has 8 children.  He is 60 years old and is known as friendly and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and burial committee.  George has been a farmer for 20 years.  George described his harvest as poor last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  				

George first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  George joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and get new farming methods. George plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  George’s own life was improved because he has more profits from the harvest and has more farming training. 							

George and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from the One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to allow him the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Abisaki

texts.en:
Abisaki is a 40-year-old lady from Kakamega county who is married to Christopher, a civil servant.  They have five children, ages 13, 9, 7, 4 and 2.

She operates a retail shop business that she has had for the last eight years.  She earns an income of KES 20,000 per month. She has now applied for KES 15,000 as her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she intends to use to expand her business. The profits will be used to educate her children and part of it to repay the loan.

She has a dream of expanding to be a whole seller in this sector.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of sugar, boxes of soap and sweets to resell to her clients.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 19 years old and lives in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education so he started working, at first as a street hawker, and now he has a grocery store. He opened it one year ago and sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni and many other items.

Mahmoud is requesting this youth loan to purchase a display refrigerator and shelves, which will allow him to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to be the most well-known market in his town. 

Mahmoud is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a display refrigerator and shelves, which will allow him to increase his stock.

loans.name: Akashi

texts.en: Akashi thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support.  She is again requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase conditioners, hair braids, weaves and shampoo for her business.

loans.use: to purchase conditioners, hair braids, weaves and shampoo

loans.name: Dinora Del Rosario

texts.es:
Dinora de 43 años de edad,  estudio sexto grado, ya que en ese momento no pensaba que el estudio le serviría. hoy en día desea haberlo hecho, actualmente está acompañada y su esposo es empleada de construcción, sus hijos ya todos están acompañados por lo que nadie depende de ella. 
Dinora actualmente, es costurera tiene muchos clientes en su comunidad. Esto lo aprendió de niña ya que su madre hacia el mismo trabajo, se dio cuenta que era un buen oficio del cual podría mantenerse y mantener a su hogar; pero también tiene un molino que ha comprado con mucho esfuerzo, que también obtiene un dinero extra para sus gastos, como el negocio lo tiene en su casa no tiene un horario establecido, se levanta muy temprano a atender el molino y hacer el desayuno para que su compañero de vida salga a trabajar y atiende los clientes de trabajos de costura que le llevan a su casa.

El préstamo será invertido en comprar una refrigeradora, ya que tiene pensado poner una tienda pues por lo del molino llega mucha gente y piensa que vendería bastante.
Dinora sueña poder tener una mejor vivienda de la que ahora tiene, comprar un molino más grande que pueda atender más clientes, de esa forma tener mayores ingresos económicos, está segura que con la ayuda de Díos y su esfuerzo podrá hacer realidad sus sueños. Agrádese la oportunidad de CREDICAMPO por el  crédito. Este le ayudara como un impulso para trabajar más.
texts.en:
Dinora is 43 years old, and studied up to sixth grade because at the time, she did not think that going to school would benefit her, but now she wishes she had finished.  She is married, and her husband works construction.  All of her children are already married, and they no longer depend on her.  

Currently, Dinora is a seamstress, and she has many customers in her community.  She learned this craft as a young girl, since her mother also worked as a seamstress.  She realized that it was a good career that would allow her to support herself and her household.  She also has a mill, which she was able to purchase after a lot of effort.  The mill allows her to earn extra money for her expenses.  Since the business is in her home, she does not have a fixed schedule.  She wakes up very early to tend to the mill, make breakfast so that her husband can leave for work, and attend to her tailoring customers that come to the house.  

The loan will be used to purchase a refrigerator, as she is planning on opening a store because many people come for the mill, and she thinks that she would be able to sell a lot of products.  Dinora dreams of being able to have a better home than the one she currently lives in, and purchase a bigger mill that can serve more customers, allowing her to earn a greater income.  She is sure that with God's help and her efforts, she will be able to realize her dreams.  

She is grateful for the opportunity that Credicampo has given her with this loan.  The loan will be an extra motivation to work more.

loans.use: purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman lives in Yerevan with his parents and two brothers. He studies at the university and currently is in his fifth course of study. He studies hard so he can become a good veterinarian and find a job. Unfortunately, Arman is now facing financial difficulties so it is very difficult for him to pay for his university tuition. He has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition and continue his studies there.

Arman will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Godfrey's Group

texts.en:
Godfrey is a member of this group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 37 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Godfrey has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. (The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.) Godfrey and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for growing ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Godfrey is married and has 10 children.  He is 47 years old and is known as hardworking.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group.  Godfrey has been a farmer for 10 years.  He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Godfrey first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Godfrey joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member.  Godfrey plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Godfrey’s own life has improved because he was able to feed the family.  			
		
Godfrey and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a Cameroonian aged thirty seven and married with four children, the oldest is sixteen in secondary school and the youngest is three. He has been in this business for over a year now which makes him experienced. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase his profit by fifty percent.

loans.use: to buy equipment to repair vehicle tyres

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a married woman and the mother of six children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.   She with her husband has done agricultural work for many years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. Her son also assists her in growing the various crops by watering for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seed, insecticide and pesticide, Rubina applied a loan of Rs. 60000. This will help her to grow more crops, which ultimately help in generating more cash. It’s her 7th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seed, insecticide and pesticide

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of this group in Busia District. She is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left. The group leaders represent a total of 71 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Elizabeth has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Elizabeth is married and has 6 children. She is 38 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and the savings group. Elizabeth has been a farmer for 10 years. Elizabeth described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  		

Elizabeth first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.
