Elizabeth joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and get new farming methods to help her earn enough to feed her family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member. Elizabeth plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Elizabeth’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest and was able to feed her family.

Elizabeth and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Dickson's Group

texts.en:
Dickson is a member of this group in Busia District. He is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 55 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Dickson has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left. Dickson and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Dickson is married and has 9 children. He is 66 years old and is known as a friendly and reliable farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and the prayer group. Dickson has been a farmer for 12 years. Dickson described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Dickson is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Dickson joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Because he is an active community member and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Dickson has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Dickson's life because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training and was able to feed the family. In the future, Dickson hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and invest in a business.  							

Dickson and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Okumu's Group

texts.en:
Okumu’s group has 7 group leader farmers and is located in Busia District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 74 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Okumu is pictured on the right of the group with his hand raised. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.								

Okumu is 49 years old and has been a farmer for 30 years. Okumu works as a farmer to provide for his 9 children. The community and other farmers know Okumu as a reliable experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community such as the men's group and the burial committee.		

Okumu is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Okumu joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Okumu plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Okumu’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest and was able to feed his family.  							

Okumu and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Héctor Alexander

texts.es:
Héctor de 34 años de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato,  está casado su esposa se dedica a los trabajos de ordenanza; son padres de  3  hijas de 18, 17 y 4 años de edad y que actualmente se encuentran estudiando.

Él se dedica a la venta de ataúdes funerarios y también trabaja con un vehículo haciendo viajes,  tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este oficio; comenta que los dos trabajos  le generan una buena  fuente de ingreso para él y  su familia desde hace varios años. Él aprendió este oficio cuando un amigo lo recomendó para que pudiera trabajar y desde entonces se ha dedicado a este oficio que hoy en día lo maneja a la perfección. Su zona de cobertura es todo el departamento, comenta que tiene muchos clientes.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar de 2 a  3 ataúdes,  para su negocio. El préstamo le permitirá tener más variedad para su clientes, ofrecer un mejor servicio de calidad y de eso obtener mayores ganancias que las empleara en su negocio.  

Desea ampliar más su negocio, tener un local más amplio y tener más personal de trabajo, mejorar su condición de vida para él y su familia, vivir cómodamente en una casa y que sus hijas sigan estudiando que logren sacar una carrera universitaria y también tener su propia flota de auto buses para el trasladar personas, con la ayuda del crédito lograra incrementara sus ganancias y comprar más productos y ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Héctor is 34 years old, and studied until high school.  He is married, and his wife does administrative work.  They are the parents of three daughters, ages 18, 17 and 4.  Currently, all three are in school.  He works selling funeral coffins, but he also has a job as a driver.  He has been doing this work for 6 years.  He states that both jobs have generated a good income for him and his family for many years.  He learned this trade when a friend recommended him for the job, and since then he has been dedicated to this job that he manages perfectly.  He covers the whole county, and has many customers.

The loan that he is seeking will be used to purchase 2 to 3 coffins for his business.  The loan will allow him to offer more variety to his customers, offer better quality service, and through this, make a higher profit which he can reinvest in his business.  

He wishes to expand his business, have a bigger retail space, hire more employees, improve his family's living conditions, live comfortably in a house, for his daughters to continue going to school and graduate from college, and have his own bus fleet to transport people.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to increase his earnings, purchase more merchandise and expand his business.

loans.use: purchase 2 or 3 coffins.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato; porque sus padres se preocuparon por él y Oscar aprovecho la oportunidad, esta casado y su esposa tiene una tienda en su casa, sus hijos están con ellos, estudian  solo el de 4 años aun no.

Él actualmente, tiene un taller de estructura metálicas y lo ha hecho desde que era niño, luego estudio el bachillerato en mecánica general lo que le sirvió,  para tener su propio taller de estructuras metálicas. Él solo se dedica a esto ya que tiene varios empleados y él supervisa  los trabajos pues le salen trabajos hasta la capital.  Distancia ni horario de trabajo no tiene pues donde sale tiene que ir, su hijo mayor le ayuda.

El  préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar material de trabajo, como hierro, acidos, etc. pues en este momento tiene varios cliente y el efectivo que tiene no le alcanza para cubrir todos los trabajos, ademas piensa en invertir unos $150.00 en la tienda de su esposa.

En el futuro, él tiene los sueños de tener una vivienda digna, en la cual puedan vivir sus hijos y poder darles el estudio necesario para que ellos puedan tener un mejor trabajo del que él tiene, poder tener mas grande el taller del que ahora tiene y tener un vehículo mejor para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Oscar, 37, studied until high school because his parents were concerned for him and Oscar took advantage of the opportunity. He is married and his wife has a shop in their house. His children live with them and they all study except for the 4 year old.

Now he has a metal shop, work which he has done since he was a child. Later he studied general mechanics in high school which enabled him to have his own metal shop. This is his only job because he has various employees and he supervises the work as he receives work from as far as San Salvador.  He doesn’t have a schedule or distance he travels for work because wherever there is work he has to go. His eldest son helps him.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase work material such as iron, acid etc... At the moment he has various clients and the money he has isn’t enough to cover all the work orders. In addition, he’s thinking about investing $150.00 in his wife’s shop.

For the future, he dreams of having a decent home in which his children can live and that he can provide them with necessary schooling so that they have better jobs than his, to have a bigger workshop than he has now and to have a better vehicle for work.

loans.use: to purchase work materials such as iron, acid etc...

loans.name: María Yesenia

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable en el hogar. Actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres suyos, con su hijo. Su esposo que viene de los Estados Unidos, por 2 meses a construir una fosa en su casa. María se dedica a los oficios domesticos dentro de ellos, hacer la alimentacion y cuidar a su único hijo. En su tiempo libre le ayuda a vender a su mamá, ya que tiene una tienda de productos varios.
Con el crédito se le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda construir una fosa para aguas negras, ya que tiene problemas de salud, por no tratar este tipo de desechos, y es por eso que tiene la necesidad de construirla.

Su sueño es tener bien equipada su casa y mejorar grandemente su salud.
texts.en:
María, age 31, is a person who is very responsible in her home.  Currently she lives with her son in her parents’ house.  María works around the home, doing the household chores such as feeding and caring for her only child.  In her free time she likes to help her mother with sales, because she has a store with a variety of products.  

For two months her husband, who comes from the U.S., has been building a septic tank at their house. This loan will be helping the client to build a tank for sewage.  She has health problems due to not treating the waste water, and because of this they need to build one.

Her dream is to have her house well-equipped and to greatly improve her health.

loans.use: To build a septic tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, soft drinks, etc. to resell at her business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel de 42 años de edad, es un hombre muy emprendedor, ya que tiene un negocio de venta de ropa. Actualmente vive con su esposa, que le ayuda a vender y con su hijo de 3 años de edad, que aun no se encuentra estudiando.
Don Miguel, antes de dedicarse a vender ropa, vendía frutas y verduras, después vio que era rentable la venta de ropa, y sacó un financiamiento para comenzar a vender, y hoy tiene la necesidad de aumentar su negocio por que le va muy bien.
Con el crédito se le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda invertir en mas productos como: blusas, camisas, pantalones, short y ropa interior, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y así poder darle una mejor educación y alimentación a su hijo.

Su sueño es seguir creciendo con el negocio y tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very enterprising 42-year-old man. He has a business selling clothing. Currently, he lives with his wife, who helps him sell, and his 3-year-old some who has not started studying yet. 

Before selling clothing, Mr. Miguel sold fruit and vegetables. Later, he saw that selling clothing was profitable, so he took out a loan to begin to sell. Now he needs to increase his business because it is going well.

The loan will help Miguel to be able to invest in more products, such as blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, and underwear. This will help him to increase his income and be able to offer his son a good education and food.

His dream is to continue growing his business and have more income.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, and underwear.

loans.name: Sayra

texts.en: Sayra is a 21-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She, along with her husband, has been in the business of making artificial jewelry for many years. The man shown in the photo is Sayra’s husband. The business has great potential for growth and Sayra is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Sayra requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase their net income and wishes to spend it on expanding their business.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of three group leader farmers in Busia District, with John selected as the Kiva representative. John has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.	

Farming inputs will be delivered to John and the 25 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will each be receiving an average loan of KES 5,349 (shillings).							

John is 23 years old and has been a farmer for two years. He works as a farmer to provide for his one child. The community and other farmers know John as a friendly and hard-working farmer. Other than farming, John is also involved in community organizations, such as the men's group and the savings group. John described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.							

John first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and he is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best fertilizer and seed prices and to earn enough money to feed his family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. 

John plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his child to school.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. John’s own life was improved because he has more farm training and was able to feed the family.  

John and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms. Nasreen is a 37-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his motorcycle rickshaw.  He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's vehicle. Nasreen wants to have better facilities for her children and it’s her dream that her children get a proper education.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Tashukra

texts.en: Tashukra is a 51-year-old married lady. She is very talented and excels in the work of stitching. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community as she has been doing it for many years. She has four children. Tashukra earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in different colors to meet up with the increasing demand. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eggs and potatoes to resell in distant areas

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is 23 years old. He recently got married. He lives with his wife in Balata Camp at Nablus with his family. His house needs a lot of improvement. 

Balata Camp is a Palestinian refugee camp established in the northern West Bank in 1950, adjacent to the city of Nablus. It is the largest refugee camp in the West Bank. 

Alaa’ applied to Ryada for this loan to build a ceiling and install doors and windows. This will help him to take a step forward, because he has a shortage of money to buy the materials he needs. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to build a ceiling and install doors and windows.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She supports six people in her family. She has a butchery and rental housing business. She has been in the business for five years and it has been profitable. 

Irene will be using the loan to open another butchery. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and build other rental houses. This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. 

Her future hope is to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: To open another butchery

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Muranga area of Central Kenya. She is married and has 5 children. She has been farming for 36 years. Her primary source of income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, tea, and vegetables. Besides farming, she also has a welding business. She enjoys farming the most because of the income earned. Her biggest challenge is getting laborers to work on her farm.

Mary chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because Juhudi has an interest in small scale farmers and helps them grow economically. During the training, she learned about loan management. This loan will help increase income and thus improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal, palm-nut, pepper and fufu.

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela, who is a 44-year-old married woman from the Abasha district, lives with her husband and school-aged daughter. The only source of the family's income is Bela's husband's job. He works as an artisan on private orders that generate 300 GEL per month. As you notice, this salary is hardly enough to meet all their basic needs and household expenses, so the family lives in poverty. For lack of economic resources, Bela was unable to learn a professional career. That's why she can't find any stable job. 

Bela decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Bela received the loan for repairing the place and to purchase raw materials for opening a cafe. She will serve clients herself and will get regular customers for good food and good service. The loan will greatly assist Bela and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: to open a cafe.

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
José de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, debido a que cuando estaba niño la escuela le quedaba lejos y sus padres no se esmeraron por que estudiara, está  acompañado desde hace 25 años, su compañera de vida solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos, de todos los hijos solo viven dos con el los dos están acompañados.

José tiene unos 35 años de dedicarse a la Agricultura, desde que tuvo fuerzas de trabajar y dominar los bueyes sus padres lo pusieron es así se dedicó a la crianza de ganado y a la siembra de granos básicos, el lugar donde trabaja  está  a medio kilómetro de su  casa por lo que le dedica cuatro horas diarias a sus cultivos y a sus vacas.

Con el préstamo solicitado a credicampo, comprara un solar donde piensa que es un lugar apropiado,  para construir en el futuro su casa. El terreno le costara más de lo que esta solicitando, pero venderá tres vacas para ajustar la compra,  con eso el cliente satisface la necesidad de hacerse de una opción para cuando sus hijos lo necesiten. 

 
José sueña en poder construir la casa a sus hijos, ya que con ellos han hecho grandes esfuerzos para salir adelante y sabe que son personas de futuro, ya no estudian pero conoce del espíritu de poder compartir buenos momentos de su vida.
texts.en:
José, 49, studied until second grade because when he was a child the school was too far and his parents didn’t go to a lot of effort for him to study. He has been with his life partner for 25 years. His life partner is a housewife. Two of their children live with them and the other two live with their families.

José has been working in agriculture for 35 years; since he was strong enough to work and control the oxen his parents gave him. This is how he got into cattle raising and staple crop cultivation. The place where he works is half a kilometer from his house so he works 4 hours a day on his crops and cows.

With the requested loan from CrediCampo he will buy a plot where he believes is the appropriate place to build his house in the future. The land costs more than what he is requesting but he will sell three cows to balance the purchase. With this the client satisfies the need to provide as an option for when his children need it.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: José Ismael

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad estudio hasta bachillerato, en la actualidad está casado, se dedica a pintura y enderezado. La familia está conformada por tres hijos una vive en casa, estudia el año social de enfermería, vive con ellos un pariente más (yerno). 

José  tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura, el desde que tenía 14 años de edad aprendió el oficio con un amigo de la familia que se dedicaba a eso, él fue quien le enseño para trasladarse de la casa al taller se tarda 110 minutos en bus, luego camina cinco minutos desde donde lo deja el bus, el horario de trabajo lo organiza el según la cantidad de trabajo que tenga.

 El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar herramientas y materiales para el taller, pues con eso espera que el negocio vaya creciendo.
J
osé sueña que su hija, luego de culminar sus estudios encuentre un empleo, en el que pueda poner en práctica sus conocimientos de enfermera.
texts.en:
José, 41, studied until high school and now he is married and works in painting and bodywork. The family is comprised of three children, one lives at home and studies nursing, a son-in-law lives with them too. 

José has a bodywork and painting shop. Since he was 14 years old he learned this trade from a family friend who worked in this trade. He was the one who taught him how to get from his house to work which took 110 minutes by bus, and then a 5 minute walk from the bus stop. He organizes his works schedule according to the amount of work he has.

He will use the loan to purchase tools and materials for the workshop. With this he hopes the business grows.

José’s dream is for his daughter, after finishing her studies, finds work in which she can put into practice her nursing skills.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials for his bodywork and painting shop.

loans.name: Sara  Beatriz

texts.es:
Sara de 27 años de edad, es una joven y con muchos sueños, estudió hasta noveno grado, tiene 6 años de estar casada, su esposo es empleado en una distribuidora que se encuentra en la ciudad. Acaba de dar a luz a su segunda hija  a la cual le brinda todos los cuidos necesarios.

Sara siempre fue muy obediente con sus padres aprendió de su madre las labores necesarias para ser ama de casa, hace 7 años conoció a su pareja y se acompañaron, vivían en la misma casa de su madre hasta que unos vecinos, amigos de la familia le ofrecieron vivir en una casita que tenían desocupada y así formar un hogar junto con su esposo y sus hija.

Sara esta  solicitado el préstamo, para comprarle una refrigeradora a su mamá y así surtir más el negocio con bebidas y productos refrigerados. El negocio está ubicado en un centro escolar, es donde la mamá tiene el negocio.

Sara sueña con mantener siempre a su familia unida y de esta manera ir progresando para llegar a establecerse económicamente en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Sara is a young woman of 27 with many dreams. She went to school as far as the ninth grade and has been married for six years. Her husband is employed at a distributor in the city. She has just given birth to her second daughter, to whom she provides all the necessary care. She was always very obedient with her parents, and from her mother learned the work necessary to be a housewife. 

She met her partner seven years ago and they got together. They lived in the same house as her mother until the neighbors, friends of the family, offered them a small house to live in that was unoccupied, so that they could create a home with her husband and their daughter. 

Sarah has requested the loan to buy a refrigerator for her mother, and this way further stock her store with drinks and refrigerated products. The business is located at a school, and that is where her mother has the store. 

Sara dreams of always having a close-knit family, and of moving forward little by little, and succeeding in establishing herself financially in the community.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 5 group leader farmers in the Busia District with Edward selected as the Kiva representative.  Edward has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 54 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Edward is married and has four children.  He is 46-years-old and is known as a reliable and trustworthy farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group.  Edward has been a farmer for 18 years.  Edward described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Edward first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Edward joined One Acre Fund in order to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed family. Edward plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Edward’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest and was able to save money to feed the family.  							

Edward and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 50 years old and lives in Dansoman-Accra with her husband and her two children. She works a lot as she wishes to give her family a better quality of life.

Patricia makes a living by selling groceries. She has been in this business for 5 years. She is very friendly to her customers with whom she has formed good relationships. On this occasion, she is requesting her 4th loan amount of GHS 1,200. She will use the loan to buy biscuits, toothpaste, sugar, drinks, milk, soap, etc. Patricia is grateful to all the people who make this loan possible so she can continue with her goals and make her business grow. She is also very committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, toothpaste, sugar, drinks, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en: Ms. Mehnaz is a 36-year-old woman. She has five children. Her husband works in a factory. Strikes and electric load shedding were affecting the job of her husband and meeting the routine expenses of household became very difficult. The financial crisis compelled Mehnaz to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family and Mehnaz felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards, so she started working from home. Now it’s been seven years of stitching and she also stitches for boutique work. She is known in the community for her neat work. Mehnaz works hard to support her family. Now she requires a loan of 40,000 PKR so that she can better manage her clients' demands. She intends to buy a new machine, threads of different colors, scissors, pearls, etc. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy a new machine, threads of different colors, scissors, pearls

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making beignets

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk lives in Yerevan with his parents. His father is a doctor and Hayk himself works at one of the local stores. Hayk is a 4th year student at the university. He studies hard to become a good doctor like his father.

Currently, this family faces some financial difficulties so it is very difficult for Hayk to pay for his university tuition. Therefore, he has applied for this loan. Hayk and his family will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de siete hijos, uno de ellos ya se acompañó por lo que solo son dependientes seis, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta noveno grado, su pajera de dedica a la albañilería desde hace 20 años, sus hijos actualmente se encuentran estudiando el mayor de 16 años se encuentra cursando segundo año de bachillerato, otro cursa séptimo grado, los otros en grados más bajos.


Rosa se dedica a elaboración y venta de tamales desde hace 18 años. En el trabajo que actualmente desempeña quiere enseñarlo a sus hijas ese oficio, para que también vallan metiéndose en el negocio. Sus hijas se encargan de vender el producto con los vecinos de la misma comunidad.


El crédito será invertido, en la compra de un cerdo para la reproducción. El resto será invertido en los gastos de estudio e sus hijos.


Rosa desea estar bien de salud, para seguir trabajando fuerte y dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y que se preparen académicamente, para que estudien carrera universitaria, y así sean unos profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old and the mother of seven children. One of them is already married, so only six are her dependents. Rosa had the opportunity to study up to ninth grade. Her partner has worked in bricklaying for 20 years. Their children are in school. The oldest is 16 years old and in his second year of high school, another is in seventh grade, and the others are in the lower grades.

Rosa has worked making and selling tamales for 18 years. She wants to teach her daughters the work, so that they can also get into the business. Her daughters can be in charge of selling the product with the neighbors in their community. 

The loan will be invested in buying a pig for reproduction. The rest will be invested in her children and their school expenses.

Rosa hopes to be in good health, to continue working hard, and to give her children a better quality of life. She hopes to prepare them academically so they can study in a university program and be successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and invest in her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 56 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Samwel and they are blessed with two children, ages 15 and 12 years old.

Margaret has been running her business of animal sales for the past 24 years and she has applied for her first loan of 33,400 KES from VisionFund Kenya which will enable her to buy a water storage tank for collection of water during the rainy season hence, allowing her to spend enough time grazing her animals.

Her monthly income right now is 8,000 KES and she has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children, buy some more more livestock and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to be successful.

loans.use: To buy a water storage tank

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 42 years old and married. He has a retail shop and has been in this business for ten years now. Together with his spouse, they have been blessed with six children. His spouse also provides additional income. 

Reuben will be using this loan to buy more goods to sell in his shop, such as sugar, flour, rice, soap detergent, and cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

This is his fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he successfully paid his previous loans. His future hopes are to expand his business and to be successful.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale in his shop.

loans.name: Rakhat

texts.ru: Рахат 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 дочерей. Две старшие-студентки, младшая дочь-школьница. У Рахат - средне-специальное образование, закончила финансовый техникум. В настоящее время основной деятельностью Рахат является реализация товара в магазине. Супруг занимается перевозкой пассажиров по близлежащим селам. В магазине работает сама Рахат, а дочери помогают. Также семья Рахат параллельно занимается сельским хозяйством, в особенности полеводством. В собственности имеется 1,20 ГА земельной доли на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и морковь для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку семян фасоли для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Рахат планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату за обучение дочерей в колледже.
texts.en: Rakhat is 40 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. Two of her older daughters are college students, and the youngest is a school student.  Rakhat has a secondary-specialized education; she graduated from a financial college. At the present time, Rakhat's main business is selling goods at a store.  Her husband is involved in transporting passengers to nearby villages. Rakhat works at the store herself, and her daughters help.  Rakhat's family is concurrently involved in agriculture, specifically farming.  She owns 1.20 hectares of land, where she annually grows beans and carrots for the household consumption and sale.  The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Rakhat requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy bean seeds for sowing work and fertilizers for treating the soil. Rakhat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to pay for her daughters' college education.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 22-year-old married woman. 

For the past 3 years, she has been successfully running a business selling milk with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Her husband helps her by purchasing a large quantity of milk from the market, and then she sells it to the people of their community. Over time they have become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. They have a good client list and make enough to contribute to her family's income.

Recently Iram has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to purchase a large quantity of milk from the market along with some utensils such as bowls and pots to cater to more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of milk from the market along with some utensils such as bowls and pots.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. Doña Maria solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, age 50, has been making and selling tortillas from her home for several years. She works Monday through Sunday. Maria has many customers because she is a hardworking and friendly individual. With the revenue she generates, she is able to take care of the household expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and children.

Doña Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy corn by the quintal so that she can continue making tortillas. By generating more income, she will provide better financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson has a retail shop business in Emali town and it has been profitable. He is 46 years old, married, and together with his spouse, who is a farmer, they have been blessed with three children. 

He plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of retail goods for resale in his retail shop. These include rice, sugar, and wheat flour. This will enable him to get more income. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

This is his eighth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future, Peterson hopes to live a stable life and educate his children to high levels of education.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods for resale.

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is a taxi operator and has been in this business for five years. He is also a farmer. He is 50 years old, married, and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with one child. His wife also provides additional income .

He will be using the loan to service his taxi and keep it in good condition. He also plans to buy cattle feeds for his cattle. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to save more and educate his children.

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he repaid previous loans successfully. His Hope for the future is to own a fleet of cars, and thereby expand his taxi business.

loans.use: to service his taxi and buy cattle feeds.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 45-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a general and fruit-selling store in her community from last seven years. She offers various items and goods of daily use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. She is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide for her family. It’s her fourth loan cycle. 

Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of detergents, pack of salts, biscuits, vegetables, and fresh fruits in large quantities to meet the increasing demand in her store.  She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education, health, and food needs and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents, pack of salts, biscuits, vegetables and fresh fruits.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Ms. Shazia is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Shazia’s husband who is a driver by profession, and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving the rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. Passengers also wants to sit in a rickshaw that is properly maintained and cleaned. For this reason, Shazia has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her husband. 

He wants to buy new tires and new body for the Rickshaw. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and body for the Rickshaw.

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Tasneem is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of cattle sales and purchase for the past three years. She buys animals at low prices, raises them, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a member of this group of 3 One Acre Fund (OAF) group leader farmers in Webuye District. The group leaders represent a total of 30 individual OAF farmers who are not pictured here. Rosemary has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Rosemary is 40 years old and has been a farmer for 25 years. She works as a farmer to provide for her 11 children. The community and other farmers know Rosemary as hardworking and trustworthy. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community in the women's group and the savings group. Rosemary described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of OAF and the other farmers in her group.							

Rosemary first enrolled with One Acre Fund (OAF) in 2011 and is now preparing to be a OAF farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. She joined OAF in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods and obtain fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to spread the story about OAF farmers. Rosemary plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. She notes that working with OAF has led to many benefits for OAF farmers. Rosemary’s own life has improved because she now has more profits from the harvest and has been able to save money and feed the family.  
							
Rosemary and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund (OAF). OAF will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. OAF pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, OAF also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to them. With support from OAF and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 30 years old from Nakuru. He is married, and they are blessed with two children, ages eight and six years old.

He is in the motorcycle transport sector; a business he has been running for the last four years. He has applied for his second loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya to top up his savings and buy another motorcycle.

Isaac intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children, start a vegetable and fruits business for his spouse, and  pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya. His monthly income right now is KES 30,000.

In the future, he hopes to be financially stable

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 45 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. She has a maize mill business, and has been running it for eight years now. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family.

She will be using the loan to buy an electric motor for her maize mill business. This will enable her to serve more customers as well as get more income. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to support her family and repay her loan.

This is her fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her hopes for the future are to expand in her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy an electric motor for her maize mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new chicken-plucking machine.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a conservative person who prefer not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo. 

Fayza is a 51-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and three sons in a small simple house in the city. Fayza's husband works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. For the past ten years, Fayza and her husband have begun their own project, which is a chicken and dove farm. They raise chickens and doves and sell the meat to the local traders. 

Fayza took a USD loan from FATEN (Palestine for Credit & Development). This loan will help her and her husband to buy more chickens and doves for their farm. By taking this loan, the farm's productivity will increase and the family income also.

loans.use: to help her and her husband to buy more chickens and doves for their farm.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel de 56 años de edad  estudio segundo grada está acompañado, la esposa se dedica a los oficios doméstico.

Fidel se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 14 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño el papá ya que desde pequeño les enseño este trabajo, para que en un futuro se pudieran defender  trabaja cultivando café, esto lo hace 3 años la finca la  tiene cerca de la casa y otra parte las tiene en otro terreno, a una distancia de 15 minutos a pie, de su casa solo a esto se dedica con la ayuda de los hijos, que cuando vienen de estudiar le ayudan va saliendo adelante lo hace un horario de las 6. AM a 12 PM.

Fidel  con el préstamo buscara trabajadores para  sembrar árboles de café,  ya que los tiene que trasladar al terreno donde quiere que la finca crezca en un futuro, y lo demás lo utilizara para que le ayuden a sacar los granos básicos, para tenerlos listo en la casa y pagar  máquina que le desgrane el maíz, y también paga carro quien se lo lleve para la casa.

Fidel sueña en poder tener una finca productiva muy grande con mucho café, para poder sacar este producto al extranjero y que las  cosechas sean de muy buena manera, y así tener ingresos para que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y sean profesionales
texts.en:
Fidel is 56 years old and studied as far as second grade. He is married and his wife does domestic work. Fidel has worked in agriculture since he was 14 years old. His father taught him this work, as he taught the family when they were young so they would one day be able to fend for themselves by growing coffee. 

Fidel has been doing this for 3 years. He has his farm near to his home and another part of it on a plot of land which is 15 minutes away from his house on foot. This is the only work he does, with the help of his children, who help him when they get home from school. He works from 6am until 12pm. 

Fidel will use the loan to go and get workers to plant coffee bushes, as he will have to transport them to the plot of land where he wants to expand his farm in the future. He will use the rest to get help with harvesting the bulk grains so that he can have them ready at home, and to pay for the machine which shucks the corn and also pay for transporting it to his house. 

Fidel's dream is to have a very large productive farm with a lot of coffee so he can export this crop abroad. He hopes his harvests will go well so he will have enough income for his children to be well educated and become professionals.

loans.use: to plant coffee bushes.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Mrs. Naseem is a 43-year-old married woman, and running a business of milk-sale with her husband's support for 20 years. They have one buffalo, four cows, and two goats to sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. 

She looks after the cattle and performs the task of collecting milk from it, while her husband sells in the village on a daily basis. They have five children. They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing, and many other things of life. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

In order to improve revenues, they requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy one more buffalo to carter to more customers. They hope to have an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is 34 years old, married and supports a family of four, including three children who range in age from 14 to 5 years old. Her husband earns about KES. 20,000 monthly.  Maureen owns a grocery location and has been in this line of work for three years, earning an income of KES. 20,000.

She is requesting this, her first loan, for KES. 30,000 from Visionfund Kenya to buy additional items to sell in her store. The profits she earns will be used to educate her children.  Her dream is to own land and built a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items for her grocery store

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has a dressmaking business that she has been running for five years now. She is 50 years old and widowed with four children aged 10, 17, and 19 years old, and one married daughter who also supports her. Right now her monthly income is KES 30,000. 

She will be using the loan to buy more stock of sewing materials for making dresses. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to buy more sewing machines. She will also buy seeds for planting vegetables on her farm. 

This is Anna's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she hopes in future to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To increase stock of sewing materials.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de WEREKELA, commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, et de tubercule. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente FATOUMATA la personne au milieu dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de feuille de baobab en poudre. Elle compte acheter 5 sacs de feuille de baobab séché chez les grossistes à Konobougou. La vente se fait en en détail et en espèce à une clientèle mixte à Fana. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 11 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en: The Benkadi group is made up married women who, on average, are 45 years old and have four children. They all live in large traditional families in the village of Werekela, Guegneka commune, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through parentage, neighborhood and friendship ties. They run food-preparation businesses, selling grains, spices and vegetables for making sauces, soap and tubers. The women of the Benkadi group are on their second group loan. In the interest of meeting the enormous demand of their clients, they appealed to Soro Yiriwaso. The client Fatoumata, the person in the middle of the standing row, is not educated, and is currently a powdered baobab leaf saleswoman.She expects to buy five bags of dried baobab leaves at the wholesalers in Konobougou. Sales are made at retail for cash to a mixed clientele in Fana. She expects to make a profit of 11,000 francs CFA per month, which will be re-injected into her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices for making sauces.

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en:
Ms. Hajran is a 32-year-old married women. The man shown in the picture is her husband and doing a business of fruits selling. 

They are very happily doing their business of selling fruits, and manage to earn a reasonable amount of money to support their family. She is a loving mother of four children. She is responsible for their food, health, and education, and trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her husband's business. 

For the improvement of their business, she contacted Kashf Foundation, and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase sacks of apples, oranges, bananas, and other seasonal fruits in bulk from a wholesale market. This will help them meet the market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, oranges, bananas, and other seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Corazon De Rosario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE ROSARIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yolanda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de api, tejido de mantas, servicio de construcción, venta de ropa, venta de champoo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yolanda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de construcción; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al apoyar a su esposo en su trabajo, posterior a aprender las técnicas de construcción decide trabajar conjuntamente a él.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de herramientas de construcción) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Corazon de Rosario” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Yolanda is the president. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling sweaters, selling “api” (a traditional beverage made from corn), weaving blankets, providing construction services, selling clothes, and selling shampoo.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Yolanda. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who visited her at her house. Yolanda currently has a business in which she provides construction services. She has gained knowledge about this business since starting it so that she could help her husband with his work. Yoland eventually learned construction techniques, so she decided to work with him.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying construction tools. She will acquire them at the distribution stores in the city of El Alto and then put them to use at her workplace. By working in this manner, Yolanda is able to generate income for supporting her family. She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Yolanda said that she enjoys the loans and the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy construction tools.

loans.name: Wasef

texts.en:
Wasef is 19 years old and lives in Gaza. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni and many other items in his grocery store, which he opened one year ago.

Wasef is requesting this youth loan to purchase shopping baskets for customers, and shelves. This will allow him to increase his stock, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family. He hopes that he will be able to develop his business and increase his income.

Wasef is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase shopping baskets for customers, and shelves.

loans.name: Cristino Ramos

texts.es:
Cristino de 50 años de edad, tiene un nivel académico superior, es casado su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ha procreado dos hijos con su esposa ambos cursan bachillerato.

Cristino es empleado en  gobernación en una ciudad desde hace 22 años, ayuda a su esposa, su jornada de trabajo es de 8AM. a  4PM de lunes a viernes.

El necesita el préstamo para la compra de los útiles escolares de sus hijos tales como. Uniformes, cuadernos, zapatos, y otros.

Cristino sueña en seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que estos culminen sus estudios, y puedan en un futuro prepararse académicamente, y también  seguir siendo un buen cliente en credicampo.
texts.en:
Cristino is 50 years old and has a good level of education. He is married and his wife makes a living selling tortillas. They have produced two children who are both studying at high school.

Cristino has been a government employee in a city for 22 years. He also helps his wife and his working day is from 8am to 4pm, Monday to Friday.

He needs the loan to buy school items for his children such as uniforms, notebooks, shoes and other items. Cristino's dream is to continue to support his children so that they can finish their schooling and in future go on to further education. He also hopes to continue being a good customer with Credicampo

loans.use: to buy school items such as uniforms, notebooks and shoes.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe YEREDON est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de BOUMOUTOU, commune de KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de gâteau, de savon, d’oignon, de baigne, d’habillement, et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe YEREDON sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente AMINATA  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse d‘articles divers. Elle compte acheter 1 carton de boucle d’oreille, et 1 sac de collier chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce, chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20.000Fcfa par mois, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The group YEREDON is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of BOUMOUTOU, in Commune de KERELA, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, cake, soap, onions, 'baigne', clothing, and general goods. 

The women of the group YEREDON are on their second solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, AMINATA, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo, is uneducated. A vendor of various goods, she intends to purchase with her money a box of earrings and a bag of necklaces from wholesalers in Bamako. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying cash at her home and sometimes by going door to door. She plans on making a profit of 20,000 francs CFA per month that will be invested in raising small ruminants.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as earrings and necklaces, to sell

loans.name: Kekognouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KEKOGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de ZANGUENA  commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de chaussure, de savon, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe KEKOGNOUMA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente DJELIKA la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de chaussure. Elle compte acheter 14 paires de chaussures plastiques pour homme, et 41 paires de chaussures pour femme chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 19 500Fcfa par mois, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: The Kekognouma group is made up married women who, on average, are 32 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Zanguena, Guegneka commune, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through parentage, neighborhood and friendship ties. They run businesses selling shoes, soaps, and various other products. The women of the Kekognouma group are on their sixth group loan. In the interest of meeting the enormous demand of their clients, they appealed to Soro Yiriwaso. The client Djelika, the second person from the left, is not educated, and is currently a shoe saleswoman. She expects to buy 14 pairs of men's plastic shoes and 41 pairs of women's shoes at the wholesalers in Fana. Sales are made at retail for cash, from her home and sometimes on foot, to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a profit of 19,500 francs CFA per month, which will be used to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de ZANGUENA  commune de GUEGNEKA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, et le commerce de tubercule, de baigne, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente TENEDIE  la première personne à partir de la droite n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de beignet  d’haricot Elle compte acheter 22 kg d’haricot et 10 kg de beurre de karité chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice de 11 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: The Djiguisseme group is made up married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Zanguena, Guegneka commune, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through parentage, neighborhood and friendship ties. They run food-preparation businesses, and sell tubers, fritters, and various other products. The women of the Djiguisseme group are on their sixth group loan. In the interest of meeting the enormous demand of their clients, they appealed to Soro Yiriwaso. The client Tenedie, the first person from the right, is not educated, and is currently a bean fritter saleswoman. She expects to buy 22 kilograms of beans and 10 kilograms of shea butter at the wholesalers in Fana. Sales are made for cash, from her home and sometimes on foot, to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a profit of 11,000 francs CFA per month, which will be used to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make fritters.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter's motorcycle business is doing well and he has managed to pay off his second loan before the due date. He is also able to take care of his young family's basic needs. He learned about VisionFund through another customer, and is requesting a third loan for KES. 50,000, which he will use to repair his motorbikes.

His goal is to boost his savings, which will allow him open up a motorbike repair shop. He hopes to improve his family's living standards and attain financial stability.

loans.use: to repair his motorbikes

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is 21 years old; he lives in Gaza with his family. He opened a small workshop “painting wood” in 2010. He is satisfied with the income from his business, but he needs this youth loan to buy a new machine which will allow him to paint furniture with new designs. He wants also purchase wood which will allow him to increase his stock, and will lead to an increase in the number of clients, and his income. This will help him to improve financial conditions for his family.  

Jihad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new machine that will allow him to paint wooden furniture and also to purchase wood.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is 42 years old and lives in the town of Nakuru. She is married and blessed with three children aged 14, 10 and 2 years old. For the last 14 years, she has earned a living by selling green maize and fish and is requesting this loan for KES. 27,000 to buy some more items to sell. With her previous loan, Evaline managed to expand her business and her monthly income from KES. 10,000 to her current KES.14,000. She intends to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children, pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya and expand her business. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more green maize and fish for her food stall.

loans.name: Flor Dedalia

texts.es:
Flor de 28 años de edad,  manifiesta que solo estudio hasta séptimo grado,  es madre soltera tienen dos hijos de 12 y  9 años los cuales están estudiando y tiene casa propia.


Ella ha estado trabajando en un restaurante por seis años, debido a la necesidad de mejorar su vida y la de sus hijos no le queda muy lejos su trabajo a unos 20 minutos, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00am a 4:00 pm.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para cancelar una deuda en una institución y lo demás para construir una fosa séptica y el préstamo mejorara su vida, porque su necesidad es tener la fosa séptica para uso personal.


La cliente manifiesta que aparte de hacer la fosa séptica, es darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos  y lo lograra primero con la ayuda de Dios y credicampo.
texts.en:
Flor is 28 years old and says she only studied until Grade 7. She is the single mother of two children, 9 and 12 years old who attend school. They have their own house. She has been working in a restaurant for 7 years due to the need to improve her life and the life of her children. Also the restaurant is not very far away, about 20 minutes. Her schedule is from 8 am until 4 pm. 

The loan Flor is requesting is to pay off a debt with an institution and the rest of the money will be used to construct a septic tank. The loan will improve her life as it is necessary to have a septic tank for personal use. Flor manifests that besides building the septic tank, she can provide a better quality of living for her children. She can achieve this with the help of God and Credicampo.

loans.use: to cancel a debt and with the rest of the money construct a septic tank.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with one small son. Yousef is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. Two years ago, he opened a small electronic repair shop in the city. It is a good business and helps him to pay part of the family's expenses. 
Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his electronic repair workshop. By taking this loan, Yousef's production will increase and also his income. 
Yousef would like to take a bigger loan in the future and expand his business
Yousef appears in the photo working in his workshop

loans.use: to buy new tools for his electronic repair workshop

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en: Hamad is a 38-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife in a small, simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income.  For the past four years, he  has been working also on his own farm where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables, using greenhouses to insure good-quality crops and avoid the cost of solar power.  Hamad has requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy raw materials for building new greenhouses for his farm. By taking out this loan, Hamad will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for building new greenhouses for his farm.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31 years old, a married man from Deir el Balah city. He lives with his wife and one small son. Ahmad has a barber shop. it has been working for four years. It is a good business and he has his loyal customers. Ahmad would like to improve his barbershop and expand it.
 
Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve his barbershop by redecorating and buying new tools for his work. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his productivity and make his shop more attractive and modern. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to improve his barber shop by redecorating and buying new tools for his work.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 19-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Hana's father works as a trader in the local market. His business is good but the income is not stable. Hani is a university student where he studies information systems. He would like to earn a bachelor's degree and find a job to help his family meet their expenses. 
Hani took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Hani will be able to do his homework and write the reports using the special IT programs. 
Hani appears in the photo with his laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Naom

texts.en:
Naom is 36 years old and has a poultry business in Makueni town which has been profitable. She also has a salon business.

She plans to use this loan to buy more chicken feed for her poultry. She will also use part of the loan amount to expand her salon business by buying more salon equipment. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

In the future, Naom hopes to have a successful business that will increase her income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and also expand her salon business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 55 years old and from Nakuru. She is married to David, and they are blessed with two children, aged 18 and 14.

Grace is a farmer, which she has been for the last 14 years. To enable her to dedicate more time to working on her farm for higher yields and profits, she has applied for her first loan, 14,100 KES, from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a water storage tank.

Grace's monthly income right now is 8,000 KES. She plans to use the profits realized from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy a water storage tank

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi sells phone accessories and has been in this business for the last five years. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children. She also supports five people in her family with help from her husband. Her monthly income is KES 60,000 and she also runs a mobile money transfer business.

She will use this loan to buy more phone accessories to sell and expand her business. The items she will purchase include phone covers, phone batteries, chargers and earphones. She will also use part of the loan to expand her mobile money transfer business. She will use the anticipated profits to open more businesses.

This is her sixth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has repaid her previous loans fully. In future, Naomi hopes to be successful in her business, pay her employees good salaries and create more job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes is 62 years old and has a rental housing business. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She is married and together with her spouse she has been blessed with six children who are working, except the last-born. Her spouse, who is a businessman, also provides additional income. Her monthly income from her business is KES 40,000. She also has a knitting business.

She plans to use this loan to renovate her rental houses so that they can be in good condition. She also plans to use part of the loan amount to boost her knitting business. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to expand her rental business.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to have more rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses and also boost her knitting business.
