loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a widow, aged 54 years old, and a mother of two. She has been buying and selling clothes in Narok county, Kenya, for the last four years earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She learnt about Vision Fund through another customer.

She has borrowed a second loan of KES. 20,000 which she intends to use to purchase more clothing for the business. The anticipated profit will be used to pay college fees for her last-born child.


Her dreams is to improve her living standards and own her own residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo de 72 años de edad, no tiene un nivel académico muy avanzado, es casado su esposa vende pupusas para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar,  tienen hijos que aun depende de él.

Él es empleado del  ministerio de educación por muchos años, aparte de su trabajo junto a su esposa tienen una pupuseria.

El préstamo lo necesita mas que todo para la compra de los útiles escolares, el pago de matrícula, puesto que están cursando grados superiores la necesidad quedara satisfecha  porque lograra  cubrir muchas necesidad de su familia.


El cliente manifiesta que quiere un mejor futuro,  para sus hijos que sean unos profesionales y sacar adelante el negocio de su esposa y lograra su objetivo  con la ayuda de Dios y CREDICAMPO.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 72 years old, married and has children who are dependent on him. His wife sells pupusas (a Salvadorean traditional food) to help him with the household expenses. He does not have much education. He has been an employee of the Ministry of Education for many years. Apart from his job he and his wife have the pupusa business. 

The loan is necessary to buy school materials and pay for tuition, given that his children are attending University. The loan will satisfy much of the needs of the family. Eduardo manifests that he wants a better future for his children, to see them become professionals. He also wants to make progress with his wife's business. He will achieve his goals with the help of God and Credicampo.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and pay tuition for his children's educatiion.

loans.name: Martin's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of eight group leader farmers in Chwele District, with Martin selected as the Kiva representative. Martin has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and he is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to Martin and the 85 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will each be receiving an average loan of KES 5,349 (shillings).
							
Martin is 43 years old and has been a farmer for 36 years. Martin works as a farmer to provide for his ten children. The community and other farmers know Martin as friendly, hard-working, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community, in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Martin described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.
							
The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Martin’s first season with One Acre Fund. He first joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family, and send his children to school.  As an active member in his community, Martin also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Martin plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money, and can feed the family.
							
Martin and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. 

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase his harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory for her food business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is still in the tiger nut business, for which she's requesting more capital to buy tiger nuts for her business. She will buy GHS 1000's worth of tiger nuts to sell to customers. She has a wide range of customers since tiger nuts are loved  by everybody. She wants to give her customers better options and keep on having the economic resources to make her payments and give her family a better lifestyle.

Comfort used the previous loan to improve the variety of products she was offering her customers. This allowed her to improve her sales and earn better profits. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children

loans.use: To buy GHS 1000's worth of tiger nuts to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SINIGNESSIGUI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de BOUMOUTOU, commune de KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de condiment, de savon artisanal, d’ustensile en plastique et de couscous. Les femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente BINTOU la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’ustensile en plastique(tasses, louches, thermos, assiettes, cuillère, etc). Elle compte acheter 15 de tasses avec son argent chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 11 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The group SINIGNESSIGUI is composed of married women, who average 39 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of BOUMOUTOU, in Commune de KERELA, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, artisanal soap, plastic utensils, and couscous. 

The women of the group SINIGNESSIGUI are on their second solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their goods as cited above.

This client, BINTOU, who is the second person sitting from the right in the photo, is uneducated. A vendor of plastic utensils (tubs, ladles, thermos, plates, spoons, etc.), she intends to purchase with her money 15 tubs from wholesalers at the weekly market. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying cash at her home and sometimes by going door to door. She plans on making a profit of 11,000 francs CFA per month that will be used for family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase plastic tubs

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 43 years old and from Nakuru. She is married to Nicholas, who is a businessman, and they have six children ages 24, 20, 19, 16, 12 and 7 years old.

She operates a business selling fish and vegetables and has been doing this for the past 14 years. She has applied for her second loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy more stock for this business.

Her monthly income at present is KES 20,000, and her intention is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay the school fees for her children, pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to expand her business further.

In the future, Pamela hopes to open more fish and vegetable stalls in her area.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mukuria

texts.en:
Mukuria is 41 years old and he sells cows, sheep and goats to butchery businesses. He also supplies meat to other places such as hotels. He has been in this business for 11 years and it has been profitable. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with four children.

He will be using this loan to buy cows and thereby be able to supply the meat to his customers. He will use the income to pay school fees for his children.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and in future, Mukuria hopes to be successful in his business and be able to provide improved basic education for his children as well as provide sufficient food and healthcare for his children.

loans.use: To buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 8 group leader farmers in Busia District, with Francis selected as the Kiva representative.  Francis has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 95 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Francis is married and has 9 children.  He is 53 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Francis has been a farmer for 23 years.  Francis described his harvest as not with One Acre Fund last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Francis first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Francis joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, send children to school and earn enough to feed his family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Francis plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future and buy a goat.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Francis’s own life was improved because he has more farm training and was able to feed the family. 
 							
Francis and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Oscar Anibal

texts.es:
Oscar de 30 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, esta acompañado y su esposa trabaja de ama de casa y actualmente cuida dos niños los cuales son sus hijos que están pequeños todos ellos dependen de el.


Él es empleado ya tiene cinco años de trabajar en una empresa eléctrica,su trabajo le queda bien cerca su horario es de 6 am a 4:30 pm.


 El préstamo mejorara su vida porque le permitirá terminar de construir su vivienda, comprara lamina antes que empiece el invierno la necesidad quedara cubierta porque tendrá su casa terminada.

El sueño es seguir mejorando su casa, y que su familia viva en mejores condiciones y lograra su objetivo con la ayuda de Dios y seguir trabajando con credicampo.
texts.en:
Oscar, 30, studied until the 9th grade. He has a wife who currently works as a housewife and raises their two young children who depend on the living he earns. 

He has been employed by an electrical company for five years. His work is going well and his hours are between 6 am and 4:30 pm.

The loan he is requesting will improve his life because he will finish building his home. He will buy sheeting for the roof before the start of the winter to cover his house and make it a finished home. 

His dream is to keep improving his home so that his family can have better lives. He will achieve this goal though the help of God and his continued work with CrediCampo.

loans.use: to construct a roof for his home.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 44-year-old married woman doing a business of selling milk for the last 15 years. She has two cows and two calves. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to let her lead a decent life.

She has seven children and she is very motivated to provide her family a beautiful life with good food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support from Kashf. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to have an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more revenue.

loans.use: To purchase one more cow

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is 34 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nabila’s husband who is a driver by trade and provides transportation services using his donkey cart. He has been driving a donkey cart for many years to meet the family expenses, but now he requires a new cart. 

For this reason, Nabila has requested a loan from Kashf Foundation of PKR 50,000 for her husband. He wants to buy a bigger sized cart. This will help him to provide better transport service to his customers. Nabila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a bigger sized cart.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NIETA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de BOUMOUTOU, commune de KERELA préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, de la couture, le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de sel, de savon, d’oignon, d’habillement et d’essence. Les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente BINTOU la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de drap et rideau. Elle compte acheter 1 rouleau de popeline, et 4 rouleaux de fil à coude avec son argent chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. Ainsi, elle les transforme en drap et rideau de qualité. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte, et parfois sous commande. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 10 500Fcfa par mois, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The group NIETA is composed of married women, who average 45 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of BOUMOUTOU, in Commune de KERELA, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and tailoring, and they do commerce in grains condiments, salt, soap, onions, clothing, and gasoline. 

The women of the group NIETA are on their second solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

This client, BINTOU, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo, is uneducated. A vendor of bed sheets and curtains, she intends to purchase with her money a roll of poplin and 4 rolls of thread from wholesalers at the weekly market. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying cash at her home and sometimes by special order. She plans on making a profit of 10,500 francs CFA per month that will be used to cover her children's education costs.

loans.use: to purchase the supplies for sewing clothing

loans.name: Omar Alexander

texts.es: Omar es un hombre de negocio y luchador tiene la edad de 35 años y apenas alcanzo a estudiar hasta el 4º grado de educación básica. Por los escasos recursos económicos en los que se vivia. Él decidió emprender su propio negocio, ha querido salir adelante luchando y trabajando arduamente se ha dedicado a la venta de panes con pollo que cada día se levanta muy temprano a vender  desde las 9:00 am a 4:00 pm de la tarde, ademas ha decidido invertir en queso, pues es algo que le da muy buenas ganancias, ha decido invertir en mas Pollo y sodas. Lucha incansablemente por tener una mejor vida y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas que día a día se le presentan. Él aun no tiene hijos pero lucha por un hermano de 18 años, que se encuentra estudiando. Quiere que él sea un hombre de provecho y pueda tener un trabajo digno que les permita salir adelante juntos. Sueña en un futuro ver su casa re modelada y una tienda en ella,pues así no tendrá que salir y tener su propio negocio en la vivienda.
texts.en: Omar is a hardworking entrepreneur. He's 35 years old and studied only to the 4th grade level because of the scarcity of economic resources in his life. He decided to start his own business because he wanted to get ahead by working hard. He has been very dedicated to selling chicken sandwiches. He gets up very early to sell from 9 am to 4 pm. He is applying for this loan to buy cheese because it gives him a good profit. He has also decided to invest in more chicken and sodas for his business. He has been working tirelessly for a better life and meeting basic daily needs. He still has no children but supports his 18 year old brother who is in school. He wants his brother to have advantages and get a decent job that will allow them to progress together. He dreams to have his house remodeled to contain a store so he can sell in his own home and not go out in order to sell.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, chicken, and sodas for his sandwich business.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
Ana de 42 años de edad, es una señora entregada a los oficios del hogar, está felizmente casada, su esposo trabaja en la tercera brigada de infantería de la ciudad, ahí se desempeña como músico, profesión que lleva varios años ejerciendo. 

Ana lleva nueve años trabajando como cocinera en la escuela, inició como voluntaria de parte de los padres de los estudiantes y como ejercía muy bien su oficio decidieron contratarla; al principio ella solo se dedicaba a cuidar de sus padres, pero cuando fallecieron decidió buscar una labor.

El préstamo solicitado, es para construir una fosa de aguas negras, pues de momento solo tienen una letrina. Han pensado que con un servicio lavable, se les facilitaría hacer sus necesidades básicas de una forma más cómoda.
Ana sueña con tener una vivienda grande y bonita y ver que su hija se supere,  para que llegue a formar un hogar digno de una buena familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old, a woman who is devoted to her housework. She is happily married. Her husband works in the 3rd Infantry Brigade of the city where he is a musician, a professional he has done for several years. Ana has worked as a cook in a school for 9 years. She started out as a volunteer on behalf of the parents of the students. As she did such good work they decided to hire her. Originally she only cared for her parents, but when they passed away she decided to look for work. 

The loan Ana is requesting is to construct a septic tank as at the moment they only have an latrine. She thinks that having a septic service will make the basic necessities more convenient. Ana dreams of having a large and beautiful house so that it becomes a dignified place for a good family. She also wants to see her daughter get ahead

loans.use: to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick  is a member of this group in Busia District.  He is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  (The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.) The group leaders represent a total of 70 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Patrick  has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for growing ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Patrick  is married and has five children.  He is 36 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Patrick  has been a farmer for 12 years.  He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  							
Patrick  first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Patrick  joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, send his children to school and earn enough to feed his family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Patrick  plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Patrick ’s own life has improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family. 

Patrick  and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: To gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Yolanda De Jesús

texts.es:
Yolanda de 70 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, es madre de tres hijos, una vive con ella en su casa y los demás trabajan fuera, no tiene quien depende de ella, ya que los hijos todos son ya mayores. 

Tiene un negocio propio, que es una tienda donde vende todo lo relacionado a la cocina, ya tiene más de diez años de dedicarse a la actividad, ella siempre se sintió atraída por los negocios por lo que decidió iniciar por su propia cuenta, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de comida en un comedor que era de su propiedad, el negocio lo tiene en su casa, por lo que atiende desde que amanece hasta que anochece.   


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más productos para su tienda, como arroz, detergentes, azúcar, artículos de uso personal, etc. Le ayudara en que tendrá mejores y más ingresos, al disponer de más productos para sus clientes.  

Su  propósito, es mantener el negocio e ir creciendo las ventas y la clientela, tener una estabilidad mejor, espera que el negocio le de los  resultado esperados, con lo que le ayudara a poder tener su propio capital de trabajo, las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliación del negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 70 years old. She studied through the third grade. She is married and the mother of three children. One lives with her in her house, and the others work outside of the house. Her children are all grown, and none depend on her. 

Yolanda has her own business. She owns a store where she sells everything related to the kitchen. She has already had the store for ten years. She was always attracted to businesses, so she decided to open her own. She does not have any other activities. Before this store, she sold food out of her own diner. The diner was in her house, so she worked it from dawn until dark. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy more products for her store, such as rice, detergents, sugar, personal items, etc. It will help her to have better income and be able to offer more products to her clients.  

Yolanda's goal is to maintain her business, to continue increasing her sales and clients, and to have greater stability. She hopes the business will give her these results, which will help her to have her own working capital. The earnings will be invested in paying her bills and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store, such as rice, detergents, sugar, personal items, etc.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra is a 38-year-old married woman and has a business of livestock sales and purchase on small scale for the past many years with her husband, who is shown in the photo. She sells the livestock in the local market at a profit. Her business is good enough to let her lead a decent life. She is the mother of three children who are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is Sughra's third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of Kashf. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy more livestock. She hopes to have an increase in her livestock sales which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: María Irma

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad, realizó sus estudios hasta noveno año de secundaria, está felizmente casada, su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado (bovino). Tenía 2 hijos a los que quería mucho, pero por razones de la inseguridad con que se vive en el país uno de ellos está muerto, él trabajaba de motorista en un bus interurbano, era muy esforzado y trabajador. El otro Hijo se encuentra en Estados Unidos y desde allá se mantiene comunicado con su familia y también les ayuda económicamente.

María aprendió bien el oficio de la panadería recibiendo clases en la ciudad, viajaba todos los días aproximadamente 30  minutos en bus para asistir a la enseñanza, una vez aprendió bien el oficio trabajó 5 años en una panadería de la ciudad;  pero viajar  le resultaba muy cansado y caro así es que decidió abrir su propia panadería en su comunidad, las cosas le resultaron muy bien y el negocio crecía, pero entonces fue que sucedió la tragedia que acabó con la vida de su hijo menor y a raíz de esto hizo dejo  a un lado toda responsabilidad pues se encontraba emocionalmente destrozada para continuar con el negocio.

Ya han pasado dos años de la tragedia y ella ya se encuentra mejor, quiere reiniciar su vida y es por eso que ha solicitado el préstamo,  desea abrir la panadería nuevamente y de esta manera mantenerse ocupada. Para esto necesita comprar los insumos básicos como manteca, harina, esencias, azúcar, levadura etc.  Con esto lograría obtener ganancias y darle un sentido a su vida.

El sueño de María es que su hijo que se encuentra en Estados Unidos, llegue a alcanzar el éxito, pues él es su principal razón de vivir.
texts.en:
Maria, 51, studied until she was in the 9th grade. She is happily married. Her husband earns his living buying and selling livestock (cattle). She had two children whom she loved. As a result of the insecurities prevailing in her country, one of her sons has died. He worked as an inner-city bus driver. He was very hardworking and industrious. Her other son is in the United States. From there, he remains in touch with his family and also helps them financially.

Maria learned the art of baking by taking classes in the city. She traveled every day by bus for about 30 minutes to attend the school. Once she learned the trade, she spent 5 years working in a bakery in the city but transportation was very tiring and expensive so she decided to open her own bakery in her community. Things were very good and her business grew. Then came the tragedy of her youngest son's death that caused her to put her business to the side because she was too emotionally shattered to continue working.

It has been two years since the tragedy. She is doing better and wants to restart her life which is why she applied for the loan. She wants to open the bakery again and keep busy. For this goal, she will need to buy basic supplies such as butter, flour, cooking oils, sugar, yeast, and more. She will earn a living and give meaning to her life. 

Maria's dream is to see her son be successful in the United States because he is her main reason for living.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (butter, flour, etc.) to help her reopen her bakery.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Ms. Salma is 34 years old and married. She has been running her beauty parlor for the last 11 years. She is very expert in her field, which is why she is famous in her community. She not only provides services to her clients but she also provides training to her students.

She has three children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with their support. Now she requested a loan of Rs 50,000 to purchase the latest equipment, hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.use: To purchase equipment, hair care products, skin products and creams in large quantities

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es:
Blanca de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 20, 12 y 6 años de edad, vivió acompañada durante 6 años de edad, luego que su esposo emigro hacia los estados unidos la dejo, pues él se acompañó en dicho país con otra señora. Sus hijos viven con ella en la casa y el mayor le ayuda pues trabaja en una panadería, de la ciudad y los dos pequeños estudian en la comunidad. Procede de una familia de 9 hermanos quienes se crecieron con sus padres trabajando en la agricultura y en diferentes oficios del hogar.
Blanca trabaja en las artesanías (elaboración de hamacas de seda), desde que se acompañó ella aprendió a elaborar hamacas, también paga a diferentes personas de la comunidad para que le tejan las hamacas y luego venderlas en la ciudad.
Antes trabajo con su hermana mayor en la panadería que posee en la ciudad, hoy en día también desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de lociones de donde obtiene ingresos económicos para dar el sustento a sus hijos.

Blanca está Solicitando un crédito en credicampo, para la compra 100 libras de hilo de seda el cual están valorado en $450 de las cuales ella tejera para tener sus hamacas y poder venderlas en la ciudad.

El resto lo necesita para la compra de tela para hacerles los uniformes a sus hijos que estudian en la comunidad. Con crédito  incrementara sus ventas y así lograr mayores ingresos que le permitan darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Blanca sueña con apoyar a sus hijos, que sigan estudiando y así lograr un mejor nivel académico, además con sus ahorros en los futuros meses, si todo sale bien ampliar su negocio donde obtenga ingresos económicos para la familia.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 39, has studied up to the fourth grade in the community school. She is a single mother with three children, ages 20, 12, and 6. She lived with a partner for six years, but after her husband immigrated to the United States, he left her, and began living with another woman there. Her children live with her in the house and the oldest helps her, as she works in a bakery in the city, and the two little children are attending school in the community. She comes from a family with nine children who grew up with their parents, working in agriculture and helping at home.

Blanca works in handicrafts, making silk hammocks—something that she learned when she had a partner—and she also pays different people in the community to weave hammocks that she sells later in the city. She worked with her older sister in a bakery that she owned in the city, and for the past ten years she has sold lotions, generating income in order to support her children.

Blanca is requesting a loan with CrediCampo for the purchase of 100 pounds of silk, valued at $450, from which she will weave hammocks that she can sell in the city. She needs the rest to purchase fabric to make uniforms for her children who are attending school in the community. With the loan, she will increase her sales and thus generate more income that will allow her to give her children a better quality of life.

Blanca dreams of supporting her children so that they will continue studying and thus reach a higher academic level. Additionally, if everything goes well in the months to come, she would like to use her savings to expand her business, which would generate income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase 100 pounds of silk thread, and fabric for uniforms.

loans.name: Amar

texts.fr:
Amar est chauffeur de profession, qui a appris le métier avec l’appui de son oncle qui lui a remis son véhicule pour qu’il se perfectionne. Après plusieurs années, il s’est acheté un véhicule d’occasion pour en faire un taxi, et le conduit lui-même. Il travaille de 6h du matin à 20h et n’accepte pas de le confier à qui que se soit quand il est au repos. C’est pour acheter un nouveau moteur, qu’il sollicite ce crédit. 
Amar est marié et père de deux enfants. Il nourrit sa famille grâce aux revenus de son activité
Amar veut avoir d’autres véhicules à sa disposition et construire sa maison.
texts.en: Amar is a driver by profession, who learned the profession with the support of his uncle who gave him his vehicle so that he could improve himself. After several years, he bought himself a used vehicle to make it into a taxi, and drives it himself. He works from 6 in the morning to 8pm and does not trust his taxi to anyone when he is resting. He is requesting this loan to buy a new motor. Amar is married and father to two children. Thanks to the income from his business he feeds his family. Amar wants to have other vehicles available to him and build his house.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm oil and vegetables such as cassava, potatoes, yams, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Sabasaba Group

texts.en:
Emilie is a woman who has devoted her time to businesses. Her business is showing very good progress. She runs her businesses at a good business center, which is characterized by a high business volume. 

Emilie, who is aged in her early forties and is a mother of one son and a daughter, is married. She manages a beauty salon and also a rental house, which is a house left over from her father after he died. Emilie and her brother together decided to modify it and make it available for renting. 

Emilie runs her activities from the same house. She wakes up early in the morning to start her journey to her business place, 10 km, and she reaches it at 8:30 a.m. After opening, Emilie runs her business up to twelve hours a day. She is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is her seventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Emilie will use this loan to buy building materials for her new business place, a café.

She used her previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, to repair and modify her father's leftover house with new materials. Emilie, in order to avoid public buses disturbance, bought a business car. She managed to earn a profit, which she used to build a house, buy house furniture and an electric stove. She dreams of opening a poultry business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Sabasaba", which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her new business place, a cafe.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 40 years old and lives in the town of Najera, in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has two children,who are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Stanley has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells household commodities.

To help expand his business, Stanley has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more household commodities to sell, including bread, eggs, toilet paper, sodas, and flour. The increase in his stock will help Stanley to generate greater profits. Stanley hopes that in the future, he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more household commodities to sell, including bread, eggs, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group

texts.en:
Anselmina is a hardworking mother who makes her living by managing a clothes business. She also sells small bites like noodles(tambi), donuts, chapati and other snacks. She has been in these businesses for more than four years now. She works at her business from 8am to 5pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. Anselmina is aged in her early 60s and has got four grown children. 

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy stocks of clothes which she resold up country. Anselmina has paid back the entire loan successfully. She received a profit and she used it to cover food expenses and plow it back into her business. Anselmina will use this loan to buy clothes to resell up country. She dreams of opening a clothes shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Pilika Pilika" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Fatina, who is in her early 30's, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been selling different types of products such as chips, cold drinks and cooked food. She starts her business from 11am to 10pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Fatina's second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy chickens and Irish potatoes for her business. She paid back her entire loan successfully. Fatina is doing good to her business and family. She managed to got an extra income which she used to cover part of school fees and household expenses. With her new loan request,Fatina will use to buy cold drinks, a sack of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, maize flour, beans and charcoal for cooking. She dreams to build a house for her family.

Fatina will share this loan with her loan group" Torees Group " which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cold drinks, a sack of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, maize flour, beans and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ibrahima âgé de 38, fait du commerce depuis 2000. Il travaillait avec son frère dans la même boutique, jusqu’à 2004 où il a ouvert son propre local. 
Ibrahima est célibataire sans enfant, il prend en charges sa nourriture et loge dans la boutique. 
Il vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit pour acheter de la marchandise : riz, sucre, huile, divers autres produits. Ibrahima peut avoir une recette journalière de 5000F CFA. 
Il veut se marier, avoir une maison et un véhicule, mais surtout veut développer son commerce et ouvrir une autre boutique.
texts.en:
Mister Ibrahima is 38 and has been in business since 2000. He worked with his brother in the same shop until 2004 when he opened his own locale.

Ibrahima is single and has no children. He takes care of his food needs and lives in the shop.

He is coming to request a loan for the first time to buy merchandise: rice, sugar, oil, and a variety of other products. Ibrahima can make 5,000 FCFA daily.

He wants to get married, have a house and a vehicle, but especially wants to develop his business and open another shop.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, put them in his shop and resell.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a man of thirty two years, married, and a father of two children. He runs a retail shop and also has a taxi transportation business. He has been in this business for three years and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Silas's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy stocks of sugar, rice, cooking fat, etc. for his retail shop. 

In the future he wants to be financially stable and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, cooking fat, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is 28 years single and supports his three siblings. He runs a motorcycle transport business in Kapsabet town. He has been in business for the last five years and he gets an average monthly income of KES.18,000. 

He has borrowed KES.45,000 and he plans to use the amount to purchase a dairy cow as a new income generating project. He will use the profits from the business to repay his loan and to purchase dairy feeds for the cow as well support his siblings.

He hopes to get married in future and save enough money to educate his siblings as well as his children when he is blessed with them.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Ngoné est une jeune femme de 34 ans qui s’active dans un peu de tout : elle est relais communautaire depuis 2003 ; en 2005 elle a commencé à travailler comme serveuse dans un hôtel de la place ; et elle s’active aussi récemment dans le commerce de céréales locales et de produits cosmétiques. C’est pour cette dernière activité, qu’elle sollicite ce crédit afin de pouvoir acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 20 sacs de pain de singe, 10 sacs de mil. 
Ngoné est célibataire sans enfant ; elle habite avec ses parents et donne une participation active dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
 Ngoné est jeune et a comme ambition de construire sa parcelle.
texts.en: Ngoné is a young 34 year old woman who is active in a little of everything: she has been a community go-between since 2003; in 2005 she began working as a server in a local hotel; and recently she has also been active selling local cereals and cosmetic products. It's for this last business that she is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy 10 bags of corn, 20 bags of baobab fruit, and 10 bags of mil [African cereal]. Ngoné is single and does not have any children; she lives with her parents and contributes actively to the management of the daily expenses. Ngoné is young and has the ambition of building her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of corn, 20 bags of baobab fruit, and 10 bags of mil [African cereal] to resell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is doing well in her boutique business, which she has been doing for the last five years, earning an average monthly income of KES 30,000. She operates her business in Kapsabet and is served by VisionFund Kenya's Kapsabet office. Lilian started a second business (horticulture farming) where she grows indigenous vegetables such as Managu and saget among others in order to subsidize her source of income. 

She has borrowed KES 45,000 to purchase farm inputs for her new horticulture business. She will use the profits from the business to educate her children as well as expand her businesses.

Her dream is to be able to be financially stable and support her family members.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a 28-year-old motorcycle operator in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a single man who supports two siblings. He has been in this business for the last five years and is doing well.

This marks his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and new wheels. 

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his sisters and repay his loan. He hopes to have a happy family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and new  wheels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, oil, pepper, biscuits, candy, peanuts, rice and soap for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a member of this group in Matete District.  She is pictured here in a group of four One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 50 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Beatrice has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Beatrice is 50 years old and has been a farmer for 28 years.  Beatrice works as a farmer to provide for her five children.  The community and other farmers know Beatrice as friendly, hardworking and trustworthy.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community in groups such as the women's group, savings group and prayer group.  Beatrice described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Beatrice joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Beatrice joined One Acre Fund so that she could earn enough to feed her family.  Because she is an active community member, Beatrice wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Beatrice has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Beatrice's life because she has more farm training and was able to feed her family.  In the future, Beatrice hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school.  							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Beatrice and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gorden

texts.en:
Gorden thanks the Kiva lenders for the support they accorded him during his previous loan.

Gorden also deals in cattle trade and cattle fattening to supplement his income. With this, he earns income to look after his family. 

Gorden has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy more cows for fattening and also to buy veterinary drugs to prevent them from epidemics. Gorden hopes to be the best cattle keeper in the whole village given the necessary support. His major challenge is inadequate grazing land for his animals. But with continuous support from Ugafode, this will soon be history. Despite these challenges, Gorden is a very hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening and buy veterinary drugs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, now 30 years old, used her previous loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell in her clothing business and it has been profitable. She has been able to repay the loan successfully. 

This being her second loan from VisionFund Kenya, she will be using the loan to buy skirts, blouses and shoes to sell and thereby expand her business. This will enable her to get more profits which she will use to grow her business.

In future Rose hopes to enlarge her business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy skirts, blouses and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary runs a computer services business in Kangundo town. These include typing, photocopying and scanning among other services. She is 55 years old, single and has two children. She has been in the business for 16 years and her monthly income from her business is KES 39,000.  She will be using the loan to buy printing paper, ink and other stationery materials. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she has paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hope is to educate her children up to the tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy printing paper, ink and other stationery.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa has been selling groceries for five years. She's requesting more capital to buy groceries (provisions). She will buy GHS 1,000 worth of groceries to sell to her customers. She has a wide range of customers. She wants to give her customers better options and keep on having the economic resources to make her payments and give her family a better lifestyle. She used the previous loan to increase her business to a good level and she needs more assistance. This loan will allow her to improve her sales and earn better profits. She was born in 1982, is married and has two children

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Sonia Victoria

texts.es:
Sonia de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta 9ª grado en el Centro Escolar, su esposo trabaja como soldado en la Ciudad, ambos tienen una hija de 14 meses de edad a quien ellos cuidan y actualmente solo su hija depende de ellos.

Sonia se dedica a vender en una pequeña tienda, la cual tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Dicho negocio nació por iniciativa propia, pues decidió establecer su pequeña tienda, además se dedica a la prestación de servicio en un molino de maíz, la cual tiene 2 meses de experiencia en esta actividad y que también le genera otros ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Anteriormente, se dedicaba al cuidado del hogar y los oficios domésticos.

La cliente viaja hasta la Ciudad, para comprar los productos necesarios para surtir su tienda, viaja en vehículo, haciendo un recorrido desde su comunidad, que se encuentra a una distancia de 10 kilómetros y cuenta con el apoyo indispensable de su esposo cuando este cuenta con días libres.

Sonia con el préstamo comprará frutas, verduras y productos de la canasta básica como fríjol, arroz, azúcar, café entre otros.

Ella sueña con ver crecer su negocio y de esta manera le permita obtener mejores ganancias, para sacar adelante a su hija y lograr darle lo necesario para que en un futuro, cuando tenga la edad  necesaria pueda estudiar y convertirse en una profesional. Ella manifiesta que el préstamo, le permitirá obtener mejores ganancias en su tienda y las que obtenga las invertirá para seguir ampliando su negocio y de esta manera pagara las cuotas del crédito para seguir teniendo la oportunidad de trabajar en la institución CREDICAMPO.
texts.en:
Sonia, who is 25 years old, went to school up to ninth grade. Her husband works as a sodier in the city. They take care of their fourteen-month-old daughter, who at this time is their only dependent.

Sonia works as a retailer in a small store. She has been in this business for four years. She started her business on her own initiative when she decided to set up her small store. She also works at a small corn mill, which she has been doing for two months and allows her a second source of income to provide for her family. In the past she always worked taking care of the home as a homemaker.

Sonia travels to the city to buy the products she needs in order to stock her store. She travels in a vehicle from her community, which is located ten kilometers away, and has her husband's indispensable support on his days off. She will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables, and basic goods like beans, rice, sugar, and coffee.

Her dream is for her business to grow so that she can obtain higher earnings in order to provide for her daughter and give her what she needs so that in the future, when she is old enough, she can go to school and have a career. She says the loan will allow her to obtain better earnings from her store and that she will use them to continue expanding her business and make her loan payments so that she can continue to have the opportunity of working with Credicampo.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and basic goods like beans, rice, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine sells cereals in Kangundo town and she has been in this business for six years. She is 39 years old and married. She also supports eight people in her family. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of cereals to resell and, thereby, improve her business. This will enable her to make more profits, which she will use to educate her children by paying for their school fees in the future. 

This is Catherine's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully paid her previous loans. In the future, Catherine hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cereals.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en: Ramzana is a 31-year-old married woman.  She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow, which she uses for to sell milk to the people in her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Ramzana has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase one more cow. Ramzana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Bara

texts.fr:
Bara est un jeune qui travaille comme livreur dans une boulangerie située à quelques mètres du guichet. Il a une expérience de quatre ans dans ce domaine et travaille de 4h à 11h du matin pour livrer du pain à tout ses clients. Il vient auprès de l’IMCEC afin de bénéficier d’un crédit qui lui permettra de compléter pour acquérir un véhicule pour en faire un taxi. Bara vit avec son frère et ils se partagent les charges (locatives et nourriture). Il envoie occasionnellement de l’argent à ses parents pour les aider dans leur besoins quotidiens.
Bara, s’il a les moyens, veut devenir un transporteur et avoir deux à trois véhicules.
texts.en:
Bara is a youth who works as a delivery man in a bakery located several meters from the branch. He has four years experience in this domain and works from 4am to 11am in the morning to deliver bread to all his customers. He is coming to UIMCEC in order to benefit from a loan which will allow him to acquire a vehicle to make it into a taxi. Bara lives with his brother and they share the expenses (rent and food). He occasionally sends money to his parents to help them with their daily needs.

Bara, if he has the means, wants to become a transporter and have two to three vehicles.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to make it into a taxi.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah sells textile materials to various tailoring traders in Emali town. He is 36 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. 

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of textile materials for resale. This will enable him to meet the demands of his customers as well as make more income. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. In future Elijah hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy more textile materials for resale

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 40 years old, and married to Leonard who is a farmer. She is a mother of five children, aged five to eighteen years old. Ann has been running a cereal shop for the last four years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.  She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 from Vision fund, which she plans to use to restock her shop with a variety of cereals. The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cereals for resale.

loans.name: Harison

texts.en:
Harison does masonry in Kangundo town. He also has a fruit-selling business. He is 36 years old, married and together with his spouse, he has been blessed with seven children; two among them are grown-ups. The masonry is his primary activity; fruit-selling is secondary.

He will be using this loan to buy mangoes for resale. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to open another kind of business.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and in future, Harison would like to be successful and rich.

loans.use: To buy mangoes for resale as a secondary business

loans.name: Florien

texts.en:
Florien, 48 years old, retails plastic materials and padlocks. He has spent six years in the business. 

Very happy with his previous loan, which helped in restocking and upgrading his enterprise, Florien is requesting a new one to buy more padlocks and sandals for resale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for his family.

loans.use: to buy more sandals and padlocks to sell

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 40 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.


Francisco labora para una empresa distribuidora de pan, se dedica a la venta de pan y otros en las instalaciones del negocio, tiene 5 años de desempeñar este trabajo, el negocio está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad a una distancia de 20 minutos en bus desde su lugar de residencia. Su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 AM  a 5:00 PM  de lunes a viernes  y sábado hasta al medio día.


El crédito lo utilizará para mejorar su vivienda, comprará tuberías, cemento, arena, ladrillos, y cancelará la mano de obra, ya que durante el invierno se ve muy afectado debido a que las tuberías de aguas del jardín de la casa, no dan abasto para evacuar el agua que cae, esto provoca que durante las fuertes lluvias, el agua se introdusca a la casa; por lo tanto, el crédito le permitirá colocar tuberías con mayor capacidad,  para ello tiene que remover parte del piso de la casa para instalar las nuevas tuberías y conectarlas con las de la calle. La necesidad que cubrirá será tener una vivienda segura para su familia.

Él sueña con brindarles una casa segura a sus hijos para que vivan en buenas condiciones, apoyarlos en sus estudios para que gocen de un futuro mejor a través de la preparación en una carrera universitaria
texts.en:
Francisco is 40 years old, married and has three children who are currently in school.

Francisco works for a company that delivers bread. The company sells bread and other products. Francisco has been doing this work for five years. The business is in the city centre, a 20-minute bus ride from Francisco's home. Francisco works from 8am until 5pm, Monday to to Friday. He also works on Saturday mornings.

Francisco will use this loan to buy pipes, cement, sand and bricks and to pay labourers as, during the winter, the pipes were damaged as they were not big enough to remove all the rainfall. This resulted in rainwater coming into the house when it was falling heavily. This loan will allow Francisco to install larger pipes. He also has to remove parts of the floor to lay down the pipes, and connect them to the city's water system. Francisco needs to do this in order to have a safe home for his family.

Francisco dreams of giving his children a secure house so that they can live in good conditions. He wants to support them in their education so that they can have a better future as a result of university studies.

loans.use: to buy pipes, cement, sand and bricks and to pay labourers to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en:
Christopher is a member of this group in Matete District.  He is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 75 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Christopher has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Christopher is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 6 children.  Christopher is 42 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Christopher is very active in his community and is involved in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue with the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.
							
Christopher joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Christopher joined One Acre Fund so that he could get new farming methods, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school.  Because he is an active community member, Christopher wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Christopher has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Christopher's life because he has more farm training, has more farm group support and was able to feed the family.  In the future, Christopher hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school.  							

Christopher and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, pepper, Maggi cubes, and many other items for her business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Ms. Salma is a 26-year-old married woman and doing a  restaurant business with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Salma's husband. She cooks food at home and her husband sells it in their small restaurant. They have been doing this business for the last six years.

Salma has two children, of whom one is school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. 
 
It’s Salma's third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through Kashf's support. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase rice, flour, sugar, and cooking oil in bulk. This will help them to grow their sales.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, sugar, and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es de la ciudad de San Gabriel, es alegre y muy respetuosa.
Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, vive con su hermano y es estudiante universitaria, al necesitar más dinero para continuar sus estudios, vio en este negocio una alternativa para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y terminar su carrera. En este negocio existe buena demanda de estos productos. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar mas mercaderia y poder tener un mayor inventario disponible para la venta. Su sueño a futuro es terminar sus estudios y ser una profesional, asimismo desea continuar con su negocio que hasta el momento le ha sido de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 25-year-old woman who lives in the city of San Gabriel. She is cheerful and respectful.

Gabriela sells cosmetics through catalogs. She lives with her brother and is a university student, so she needs more income in order to continue her education. Gabriela saw this business as an alternative for improving her income so that she could finish her degree.

Her business experiences good demand for these products. She needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise. This will enable her to have a large inventory at hand that she can sell. Her dream for the future is to finish her studies and become a professional. At the same time, she would like to continue her business since it has been a great help so far.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Denis Alexis

texts.es:
Denis de 29 años de edad, está acompañado, estudió hasta tercer grado debido a las dificultades económicas de su familia, desde muy pequeño comenzó a trabajar para aportar ingresos al hogar. No tiene hijos, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de mariscos.  

Daniel se dedica a vender dulces en los buses desde hace 3 años,  lo cual le permite lograr la estabilidad económica para los gastos de su familia. Anteriormente, él vendía agua, jugo, sodas y papitas. La venta de papitas era rentable, pero cuando no vendía se echaban a perder, tiempo después se dedicó a la venta de dulces, esto le permitió extenderse a otros lugares a vender. Fue por ello que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad. 

Él se dirige diariamente a la terminal de buses, que está a escasos metros de su casa, y desde ahí aborda los buses para vender dentro de ellos. Trabaja arduamente desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta  las 5 de la tarde cuando la afluencia de buses es menor.

El crédito le servirá para la compra de dulces de distintos sabores, las compras las hace al por mayor, esto le permite obtener el producto a un precio más cómodo, y además, de esta forma obtiene más ganancia. 

Él sabe que este es un trabajo informal, ya que no goza de las prestaciones de ley correspondientes, pero debido a la escases de trabajo formal, él  ha encontrado en este negocio la forma de brindarle lo necesario a su familia

Sueña con que el negocio siga siendo rentable, como lo ha sido hasta el momento, y además, tiene la expectativa de contratar a otra persona, para que le ayude en el negocio. 

Con respecto a su familia, espera alcanzar una estabilidad económica para tener hijos y brindarles lo necesario en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Denis is 29 years old and has a partner. He completed only up to third grade of school due to the family's financial difficulties. Denis started to work from a very young age, in order to support the household. Denis does not have children. His partner looks after the home and also sells seafood.

Denis has been making a living selling sweets on buses for three years. This allows him to be financially stable in order to pay household costs. Previously Denis sold water, juices, sodas and crisps. Selling crisps was profitable but, when he did not make enough sales, he made a loss. After some time Denis started to sell sweets. This allowed him to go to other places to sell and so Denis decided to stick with this work.

Denis mainly works at the bus station, just a few metres from his house. There he boards the buses to sell his sweets. He works from 8am until 5pm, after which time there are fewer buses.

This loan will allow Denis to buy sweets of different flavours. He buys in bulk, allowing him to buy sweets at a cheaper prices, and giving him a higher profit.

Denis knows that this is not a forma job, and so he does not enjoy certain rights afforded by the law. However, due to a lack of work on the formal market, he has found this way to give his family what they need.

Denis dreams of his business remaining as profitable as it has been up to now. He also hopes to employ somebody else to help him with his business.

In terms of his family, Denis hopes to be financially stable so as to have children and to give them everything that they need in their lives.

loans.use: to buy different flavours of sweets.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and she has a taxi business which she has been running for the past seven years. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. She also supports four people in her family. Her spouse does provide additional income.

She will be using this loan to service her taxi by buying new spare parts and keep it in good condition. She will also use part of the loan to pay school fees for her children. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to save more.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In future Ruth hopes to buy another car and expand her taxi business.

loans.use: To service her taxi and also pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 65 years old, married to Ecra and a father of six. He has been running a retail shop for the last three years, getting a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Simon has asked for a loan of KES 15,000 from VisionFund to restock his shop with a variety of consumable products. The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. 

His future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has a retail shop in Kangundo town. She also does farming. She is 36 years old, married, and together with her spouse she has been blessed with three children. She also supports five people in her family. Her spouse provides additional income. 

She will be using this loan to pay school fees for her children who are in high school. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to open a wholesale shop. 

This is her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya and she has been repaying her previous loans successfully. In future, Rose hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: This is Lusine's second loan. The first loan helped her to pay for her university tuition for the first semester. She has repaid the loan very responsibly and is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Now, to be able to pay for her university tuition for the second semester, she has applied for this loan. She will be very grateful to lenders if they help her to pay for her second semester tuition and waits for their support.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam, 23 years old, is from Nakuru. She is single and takes care of her four siblings.

She is a pharmacist, a business she has been running for the last three years, and to enable her to buy some more stocks of drugs to sell to her customers, she has applied for her first loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 12,000 and she intends to use the profits realized from her expanded business to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya, to expand her business and to educate her siblings.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase peppers, charcoal, oil, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 51 años de edad, vive en una Colonia, estudió hasta tercer grado. Está casado y tiene 5 hijos, su hija mayor ya está acompañada, 2 están estudiando y sus otros 2 hijos se encuentran trabajando.

Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, esto lo aprendió de sus padres que también fueron agricultores. El señor Pedro siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, lo cual le produce un promedio de 30 quintales de maíz. Además, posee un molino con el que trabaja su esposa, lo cual le permite tener ingresos económicos extras. Su horario de trabajo en la agricultura, es de 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 12:00 del mediodía y está a 10 minutos de su hogar.

Con el dinero del crédito podrá preparar la cosecha que este año recolectó, la cual almacenará para que no se dañe, de igual manera utilizará el dinero para pagar el alquiler del terreno e ir preparándose desde este momento, para la nueva cosecha del presente año 2014, brindando así la seguridad alimentaria a su familia con una parte de la cosecha, y la otra parte venderla.

Su sueño es seguir cultivando hasta que Dios se lo permita, darle la seguridad alimentaria a su familia, apoyar a su hija en sus estudios para que logre encontrar un trabajo formal, y que sus hijos sigan como hasta el momento, jóvenes trabajadores igual  él ya que es el mejor legado que puede darles.
texts.en:
Pedro, who is 51 years old, has a third grade education. He is married and has five children. His oldest daughter lives with her partner, two of his children are in school, and the other two are working.

He has worked as a farmer ever since he was very young. He learned from his parents, who were also farmers. Pedro farms 1.7 acres of land that produce an average of 3,000 kg of corn. He also owns a mill where his wife works, which allows them to make extra income. His farmwork schedule is from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm and his land is ten minutes away from his home. 

The money from this loan will allow him to prepare the last crop that was harvested and store it so that it doesn't suffer any damage. He will also use the money to pay rent on the land he uses and start preparing now for this year's harvest in 2014. Part of the harvest will bring his family stable nourishment, and the rest of it will be sold. 

His dream is to keep farming for as long as God allows him to do so and to give his family stable nourishment and support his daughter in her schooling so that she can find a formal job. He also wants his other children to continue being the young hard workers they have been so far, just like him, because that is the best legacy that he can give them.

loans.use: to prepare for the corn harvest and pay rent on the land he uses.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 36 years and a widow and supports a family of two of her children aged 13 and 5 years old.  Her main source of living is through her beauty salon which is now 8 years in operation and earns a monthly income of KES 48,000.

She is now servicing her fourth loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya and she intends to purchase more stock of beauty products for her salon. The profits she earns will be used to provide basic needs for her children.  Her dream is to build a good house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Diana Paola

texts.es: Se llama diana paola   tiene 21 años, vive en la ciudad de bogota con la mama y hermana, no trabaja ya que ella cuida de la hermana de seis  años de edad, decidió iniciar estudios en campo alto  en la carrera técnica administración en salud, para así tener un mejor futuro para ella, la mama y la hermana, como ya se hizo saber anteriormente no trabaja, por lo tanto la mama  tiene que cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar y no le alcanza para cubrir la mensualidad que campo alto  requiere, ella quiere solicitar la ayuda de kiva  porque piensa que es indispensable  el estudio para el progreso, aparte de esto la vocación es de prestar servicio al cliente y ayuda a la comunidad, por esto escogió esta carrera que va acorde con la personalidad y vocación.
texts.en: Her name is Diana Panola and she is 21 years old and lives in Bogota with her mother and sister.  She doesn’t work because she must care for her six year old sister, but decided to begin studying for a career in health technical management so that she can have a better future.  As mentioned before, she doesn’t work, so her mother must cover all the household expenses, but there is not enough to also cover the higher education costs.
